The delays we calculated with might come from the shortage of casting material, technical problems. To avoid most of these we try to have more than one source and will have multiple pressure chambers to be able to work even if one or two might fail. Even if there is an overwhelming interest, we think we can adjust the production by setting up even more pressure chambers.We already have the sculpts done and casting these can start when the campaign starts.
We will have help with the packing and posting, so if everything is done, we will pump out as many packages as possible per day. We will use registered shipping only to avoid untraceable, lost packages.

story:
? 45 exciting creatures and monsters, from dinosaurs to aliens and everything in-between! With more cards being added through stretch goals and social goals, your deck will be full of vibrant and funny characters that big kids (adults) & little kids will ❤️!

 

 ⚡ Take advantage of special weapons and space anomalies that can turn the tide of the game! 

 

 

A fantastic collection of the creatures onboard the Spaceship Zoo, with some special development sketches, background stories and funny info included. Printed full colour 5.5×8″ size.

A fold-able map included in each copy, perfect to show the scale of the ship and immerse yourself into the fantastical scifi world!

 ? Together we've unlocked a brand new Cyborg Dinosaur card, Time Travelling Watch card, opened the Prehistoric enclosure featuring a Sabre-Tooth Jack Russell and have voted as a community to include the Galaxy Squirrel in the game!

 

 Hi there! I'm Sam Milham, an illustrator working in the toy industry in Melbourne doing what I love, and in my spare time I draw things.

This will be my third Kickstarter, having Kickstarted a successful card game, 'Fairy God Plumber' last year which was delivered to backers all across the world, and before that, an art book.

I have just finished working on Spaceship Zoo, a hilarious card game for all ages (but great for parents or uncles/aunties to play with their kids) and I can't wait to share it with more awesome people just like you.

I've had the pleasure to be published on a range of awesome websites with a small selection below:

We have our awesome manufacturer lined up and we’ll begin printing the cards as soon as we’re funded. The cards will be printed on 56 poker-sized cards with a full colour printed tuckbox for security. Here is a general timeline from now until your Spaceship Zoo cards arrive.  

• May: Kickstarter Campaign 

• July: IndieGoGo InDemand

• Mid August: Production of game

• Late August: Delivery of cards to my door

• September: Shipping worldwide!

Our awesome family of playtesters, amazing community of backers that have joined us from the previous campaign, and of course all of our fantastic new friends joining Spaceship Zoo! Without which this game would not be a hilarious and fun reality. Thankyou so much!

Risks and challenges

Having already completed two successful Kickstarters, I'm fully aware of the systems needed to send out rewards to backers across the globe, however should unforseen issues arise I will be updating every backer on the progress of the goods and ensure everything arrives perfectly!

story:
Hello and Welcome To Monsters of Nature Featuring the Steam Pod!

We are Real Game FX. With the help of a little mad science we create marvelous machines that add special effects to tabletop games for the most immersive experience possible. We are owned and operated in the USA and have been designing and selling electronic components since 2005.

Last year backers helped us make a really cool fog machine for tabletop games called the "Fog Monster". This year we bring you the monstrous power of Steam in our new battery operated "Steam Pod". We have also created a few terrain pieces that use the Steam Pod for awesome FX. We hope you will support us in this effort to make tabletop gaming as realistic and immersive as possible.   

Introducing The Steam Pod

 The Steam Pod offers almost zero water condensation, especially when used vertically.  You can even aim the LEDs inside to light up the Steam with color. And it's gamer friendly, no foul smelling oil only pure water. How awesome is that?

Battery no longer required! The Steam Pod can now be operated using any of the following power sources:

1. A Li-Po battery. 

2. A AAA or AA Power Bank.

3. A Li-ion Power Bank.

4. A USB Cord directly plugged into the Steam Pod with no battery.

Features:

  • Colorless - Will not stain or leave an oily residue on your terrain. 
  • Odorless - No unpleasant burning smell. 
  • Runs on water - No expensive formula or "juice" to purchase. 
  • Instant - Steam begins when it's turned on.
  • Continuous on or Puffer mode, (Puffer turns on and off every 8 seconds like a geyser)
  • Comes with 2 Red LEDs in the cap to create colored fog! (LEDs are plugs so you can use your own LEDs to change colors.)
  • Battery: Works with any 3.7v Li-Po battery with Connector Type: 2P 2.0mm Pitch.  633048 900mAh recommended. Max battery length 63mm. Max width 34mm (battery not included) 
  • Battery charges by plugging a Micro USB plug into the Steam Pod from a 5v power supply. Battery available on www.realgamefx.com website, Amazon, or Ebay.

  

 

 

 

 

The Traveler's Gate

  • Rumored to be the secret of Dr. Gearsmith's return, this portal is not painted rather it is a fully functional device that looks a little more like the real thing. You will need more than one to instantly travel across the terrain to other Travel Gates. The Lightning Plate comes in your choice of one of 6 colors. Blue,  Orange, Pink, White, Green, and Multicolor.  Use with Bluetooth "Speaker Pod" for Sound activated Portal FX. (Speaker Pods will be available on our web-store)

Features 

  • Comes with 1 Lightning Plate. 
  • Runs on 2 AAA batteries. (not included)
  • Continuous on or reacts to Sound.

 

The Fangtooth Lava Maw  

Peer inside it's gaping maw, but don't fall in! Hand sculpted in exquisite detail. The Black Horn Volcanoes smaller but no kinder companion. Designed for use with the Steam Pod for puffing steam FX and volcanic lighting.   

Features: 

  • 6" tall x 4" wide (160mm x 96mm) 
  • Hand Sculpted by our artists
  • Detailed lava rock texture
  • Comes in Clear polyurethane resin
  • Paint available by our artists (add paint reward) 

 The Black Horn Volcano 

The Black Horn Volcano is a welcome addition to any respectable tabletop game, bringing another level of realism to your adventures. Designed for use with the Steam Pod for volcanic lighting and smoking FX. If we hit the Lightning Tower Stretch goal these will really play well together.

Features: 

  • 10" tall x 7" wide (254mm x 177.8) 
  • Hand Sculpted by our artists
  • Detailed lava rock texture
  • Comes in Clear polyurethane resin
  • Includes (1) Staircase
  • Includes (1) Height support stand for Steam Pod
  • Paint available by our artists (add paint reward)
  • Use with Bluetooth "Speaker Pod" for rumbling lava sounds. (Speaker Pods will be available on our web-store)

 

A word about shipping -  All packing will be done in the USA and will likewise be shipped from the USA.  At the end of the campaign our Shipping calculator page will give you the exact cost of your shipping. 

If you want to get an idea in advance you can always Check out our website store for realtime shipping cost to your country.  Simply go through the checkout process to see the actual amount on similar products. Note for Australia and Asia customers. We are looking into setting up shipping from Asia to those countries rather than shipping from the USA as it will save you on cost.

A word about Batteries -  Li-PO batteries are not included but will be listed on our web-store available for purchase direct from the manufacturer. We have the battery type listed on the reward so you can purchase from ebay or Amazoon locally if you prefer. 

Thank you for your support! 

We could never do this without you! We hope to offer many more strange and curious devices as we continue to develop the most realistic terrain our mad scientists can concoct. 

All the best from us here at Real Game FX.

Risks and challenges

We are owned and operated in the USA and have been designing, selling, and manufacturing electronic components since 2005. We formed Real Game FX because we love games and wanted to deliver real world and special effects that we believed would add immersion to tabletop games.

As an experienced manufacturer we looked at the success and failure of a number of crowdfunded projects and saw potential problems that came from offering too much too soon. Additionally we saw that shipping funds being included in the overall funding goal artificially inflate the project as shipping costs do not contribute to covering the actual manufacturing cost.

By starting the project with only a few rewards we know that when the project funds we will have covered the actual manufacturing costs. This assures us all that the project is now funded and ready for delivery to our customers.

Once we fund past the project amount it then opens up more project rewards and just gets better for everyone since we are then able to get preferred pricing on additional molds from the factory and offer more to our customers.

In short, we want what everyone wants and that is a successful project. We will use our years of experience in manufacturing, customer fulfillment, and support, to avoid the pitfalls that newcomers often experience. Let's make it happen!

story:
NOTE: The set includes only the Doppelsoldner and Ogre MKVI plastic miniatures. All other miniatures shown are in Set 1 and Set 2. Both of these sets are in the Ogre Battle Box, available at Warehouse 23 and as a part of this project.

The photos show the metal Ogre MKVI and Doppelsoldner miniatures, designs that the factory used to create the new CAD files. The updated plastic miniatures may vary slightly from the metal minis shown in these pics; all other minis shown are from the newer plastic sets. All miniatures shown were painted by Ben Williams.

Project Timing

The factory has completed the CAD work, and we are now ready to cut the steel tools to manufacture the minis sprues. That's where your support comes in. If we receive enough funding support, then we will instruct the factory to move to the next step.

Not In Stores

After our experience with Ogre Miniatures Set 1, as well as the Ogre Battle Box, we have chosen to keep the first run of these new miniatures out of distribution. For that reason, all the project costs must be covered as a part of this campaign. That makes our initial goal higher than usual, relative to the number of designs, and pulls back the curtain on the realities of manufacturing high-quality, ABS plastic minis. This is an expensive and complicated process, and we need your support to take these two minis from the CAD stage to your hands.

No Stretch Goals

In order to fulfill the project as cleanly and quickly as possible, we are not offering stretch goals as a part of this campaign. This limits the project's complexity and reduce the chance of errors. If this campaign is successful, we will return with more plastic miniatures in the future.

NOTE: The set includes only the Doppelsoldner and Ogre MKVI plastic miniatures. All other miniatures shown are available in Set 1 and Set 2. Set 1 and Set 2 miniatures are available in the Ogre Battle Box, available at Warehouse 23 and as a part of this project.

Ogre Battlefields

If you missed out on last year's campaign, now is your chance to add the Ogre Battlefields expansion to your Ogre collection. This Ogreloaded box weighs 8 lbs and includes four double-sided mounted gameboards, new units and counters, new scenarios, and a complete Ogre rulebook. We have a limited number of copies of this expansion available.

Risks & Challenges

Steve Jackson Games is an established game publisher with a successful track record and we have enough crowdfunding experience to deal with issues should they arise. The process of adapting older metal miniatures to plastic is proven – the factory we're working with handled the CAD work, tooling, and manufacturing for Ogre Miniatures Set 1 and Set 2 – and now we're ready to start work on this third set! All we need is enough support to cover the costs and demonstrate that there's enough demand to make the project a success. 

As we've done in the past, we will stay in touch with our backers during and after the crowdfunding campaign, all the way through fulfillment of the rewards.

ESTIMATED DELIVERY 
Please note that the June 2020 delivery date is an estimate. We will do the best that we can to meet that date, but the complexities of game manufacturing combined with international shipping sometimes leads to delays. Additionally, backers in some regions may receive their rewards before others; the games will be shipped to the United States where they will be packed for individual shipments and then, in some instances, forwarded to partners in other nations for final fulfillment.

If all goes well, we will be able to deliver the minis ahead of schedule. We have set the June 2020 delivery date to give us breathing room for the inevitable issues that slow a project in the tooling, manufacturing, and delivery phases.

story:
Finally! A 21st Century Board Game...

Outsmarted brings about the dawn of a new era of 21st Century board games, where tech meets tradition, in a giant leap for board gaming!

That's Christmas 2020!! 

There are two fantastic versions of Outsmarted available on Indiegogo, offering a $10 - $15 discount on the future retail price of Outsmarted. More importantly, if won't be in stores until April 2021, Get your copy today, whilst stock lasts. You can choose between the:

  1. Outsmarted Retail Edition ($35)

  2. Outsmarted Limited Edition ($45)

Once you have your game, gather round the TV and/ or the tablet and get the home board game + quiz show experience, the 21st Century demands! With questions based on the age of your team members and interactive video-based questions, it'll be an interactive experience for the whole family to enjoy in Christmas 2020!

 

Outsmarted means no one player, of any age, has an unfair advantage over the competition! With 2,500+ questions, and more added daily, including video-based questions, that can be streamed to your TV, what better way is there to spend Christmas 2020! You can EVEN play remotely with friends & family, as long as they have the app!

 

Outsmarted Features - The New Era of Board Games!

  • Smart Game Host. The Outsmarted AI host runs the show for you! Just choose your teams, select which question packs you'd like, and if you need to keep the game time within a certain limit, let the game's AI do the rest!

  • Fantastic Team / Party Mode. Supporting up to 6 teams of 4 players (24 players). But beware - even in team mode, Outsmarted sometimes selects one member of the team for an important solo question.  
  • Remote Play. Outsmarted is the first board game DESIGNED to support remote play. Perfect in these times when friends and family cannot always be together.  Even better is that only YOU need to own the game - your friends and family can use the FREE Outsmarted app to join your game!
  • Localised Questions. The questions in Outsmarted are dependent on the region that you select within the software. At launch the US, British, Canadian and International English versions will be available with further foreign language versions in 2021. 
  • Play it your way. Outsmarted is as much fun with just 2 players as it is with a huge team of 24! Play it with your Windows laptop, an iPad, Android tablet or mobile phone. You can share just one device or connect a second or third as well as up to 6 mobiles as handheld controllers (one for each player or team).    
  • Almost no learning curve. Outsmarted has almost no learning curve.  The AI hosts the show.  It always knows who's turn it is and which IQ Rings each player / team has collected. Anyone in the family can play straight away.
  • Questions by professional question writers. To make sure we have the best content on the planet, we have a small team of highly experienced question writers that have been involved in major TV show question writing.
  • A lifetime of free updates. Outsmarted is the world's first board game that constantly evolves with new surprises and great free new content on a regular basis. It means it never gets boring like other board games tend to over time!
  • In-game leaderboard. The in game leaderboard at the end of each round shows the positions of all players / teams. It also shows correct answer percentages for each player / team.
  • The 3D Genius Miniatures. We have put a lot of effort into the design of the 3D painted miniature genius characters that feature in Outsmarted and they're adorable as a result!! You can see the full line up below with more to come in future versions.  Got an idea for a new 'Genius'?  Drop us a line with your nominee!  
  • The Question Store. Outsmarted includes enough questions for hundreds of hours of play. If you need more questions or just want to customise the game with questions about topics you love - no worries!  The Question Store gives you instant access to an amazing library of additional content for free or low cost. 

There's more than one way to play Outsmarted! From intimate two-player games with just an iPad to the real Game Show experience on a big screen TV.  Which one are you?

The Purist - The purist has trouble letting go of that dusty old question pack, but soon realizes Outsmarted is just.. A lot better!  So they opt for intimate candle-lit iPad sessions (with the volume set low), playing with their partner or perhaps even a guest or two on very special occasions.

The Family Guy - The family guy (or girl!) understands Outsmarted is the perfect way to get the whole family involved. They have struggled to find a game that everyone enjoys playing and their kids spend more time glued to their phone than reality. But with Outsmarted everyone's happy and can compete together, best of all... Their kids are learning without even knowing it!   

The Frenemy  - The frenemy is your best friend until they get around a table with a board game. They suddenly become uber competitive. They are prone to sending invites weeks in advance - "How about Outsmarted three weeks on Saturday?". They make sure their new iPhone 12 is fully charged before the game starts, because they somehow believe all that processing power and a full battery gives them an edge.    

The Show Off - The show off streams Outsmarted to their 4K projector with their 8 speaker Dolby Digital setup providing an arena-like atmosphere, maximizing the video and audio-based question experience. They place a large leather chair in front of the screen and everyone has to take the hot-seat during their turn with a spotlight shining down on them for extra pressure! 

The Control Freak - The control freak runs Outsmarted on their Windows laptop and streams their laptop screen to the TV. They then act as a TV show host using their mouse to control the game. They can be heard frequently saying "Is that your FINAL answer?" & "That's the WRONG answer!"

The Party Animal - The party animal invites everyone over for a mass team game of Outsmarted. Rounding up 6 teams of 4 players (24 total)! They also have a giant trophy for the winners and an endless supply of drinks and snacks on hand.    

In Outsmarted there are six Ring Categories, each representing a unique challenge that you will have to master.  Land on a Ring Question and answer it correctly - you win that Ring. Collect all 6 Rings to reach the Final Round.      

Raw brain power.. this category involves observation, logic, reasoning, pattern recognition and sometimes a bit of quick arithmetic.  The catch is...  it's all against the clock!        

This category is about all the things you could or probably should have learned at school. Questions cover - History, Geography, Physics, Biology, Chemistry, English Language and Mathematics.       

 

If it happened yesterday it could be featured in the game today! New content is added to the Breaking News category daily. Questions cover World News, Celebrity News, Regional News, Political News, Tech news, Scientific News and Environmental News.       

This category is about pure Trivia.  The questions are similar to those you might find in old school trivia games or quizzes. Crazy facts, unusual events, things you should've known and things you didn't know you knew!      

No self-respecting Quiz Show would be complete without a category covering TV, Film & Books. What's great about Outsmarted is that many of the questions in this section include photos and video clips!     

And of course we haven't forgotten Music!  In addition to Musical themed trivia and specialist knowledge, we hope to have finalised a licensing deal by the time of launch which permits us to offer "name that tune" sound questions.      

Outsmarted includes 2,500+ multimedia questions. Perfect for hours and hours of play. This already exceeds the number of most 'card' questions provided by our traditional board game competitors, so in theory, the average player shouldn't feel the need for additional questions for a long time.  But if you do get the itch for something new... 

The in-game Question Store is there for you!  It's a world first.. being able to expand your board game and add exciting new content for years to come with one swipe.  We'll also introduce entirely new question categories!

So what does this mean for you?     

More Questions whenever you need them!

If you play a lot, you will eventually require more questions.  With all of our cardboard competitors, that's game over...  But not with Outsmarted!  We can provide you with an entire new game's worth of questions in an instant... And at a fraction of the price of buying a new game!   

An entire Core Question Pack of 2,500+ Questions is available in-game from only $8.99 / $11.99. Incredible value!  Incredible longevity!    

Get the question categories YOU WANT!

The questions categories in Outsmarted are great, but If you ever want more of the kind of questions you really love, you can get them instantly in the Question Store. 

Add Specialty Question Packs to the existing library of questions so they are added into the mix, or you can switch out a whole category you don't want and replace it with your chosen pack.  What's more, you can do this on a game-by-game basis... In seconds.

Don't like Breaking News... Switch it for the 1990's.  

Don't like Back to School... Switch it for Sports! 

In fact.. you can customize all the categories to your chosen subjects, should you wish!

Eventually, hundreds of Speciality Question Packs will be available, some are completely FREE OF CHARGE and others will start at only S2.99 / $3.99 for lifetime ownership.   

If you have a suggestion for a question pack you would like to see in the future get in touch and tell us!    

  • Focus. A lot of questions are designed to leave you with no time to think. Complete focus is needed from the first second of the countdown to give you the best possible chance. 
  • Know when to use an assist. If you go out all guns blazing with your assists, you won’t have any in reserve for the crucial ring questions. Likewise, if a question comes with a significant surprise bonus, it’s often worth using an assist or two to nail that question and grab the bonus.
  • Stay goal oriented. For example, when playing a fixed time-length game of 60 minutes and there is a tie for first place, the winner could be decided by the number of assists each player has remaining when the time is up.  So conserve your assists in a fixed-time match - unless you’re going all in on a ring question.
  • Make quick decisions. Quite often it’s clear that one, or two possible answers are definitely wrong.  When under pressure, quick decisions to eliminate these is often the difference between winning and losing. 
  • Plot your path. Going for your strongest categories can be a good idea in a fixed time game of 30 or 60 minutes. And if possible, memorize the 'roll again' opportunities so you don't miss them.         

Is Outsmarted really that much of a leap on its traditional quiz and trivia counterparts? We have put together this table to show you all the main advantages.   

Help us spread the word about Outsmarted. Tell your friends, your neighbors & your family! With your help increasing our user base we can develop new features more quickly, and add more free question packs!    

All versions of Outsmarted are the same physical boxed product, with the same game board (the board contains no text). When you first startup the Outsmarted software / app you simply select your preferred region to get localized game content, and to play in your language. 

Please check this list below to see what date your native language version will become available within the Outsmarted software: 

  • English  (United States Version) - Available at launch - December 2020
  • English (United Kingdom Version) - Available at launch - December 2020
  • English (Canadian Version) - Available at launch - December 2020
  • English (International Version) - Available at launch - December 2020
  • German Version - Not available until April 2021
  • French Version - Not available until April 2021 
  • Dutch Version - Not available until June 2021
  • Spanish Version - Not available until June 2021
  • Italian Version - Not available until September 2021

Regional differences in the English Language Versions

All questions included within the International English Version are relevant to all English speakers wherever they are from. In addition by selecting a specific region (USA + Canada / UK) you will get additional region-specific questions added into the mix. For example selecting the US version at install would result in about 30% of all questions served by Outsmarted being specifically about American News, Politics, Celebrities, History, Geography and Sport and so on. 

Other Language Versions

Backers that speak French, German, Spanish, Dutch or Italian can purchase and enjoy Outsmarted right away in English and then switch to their native language within the software when it becomes available in the future.  

Over the course of 2021 we may be adding even further language options, but we are unable to confirm which languages they will be at the current time.      

Environmental commitments

Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Indiegogo encourages sustainable practices.

Long-lasting design

Our game is software based, constantly updated with new features and content, it can also adapt to a player's preferences. In other words - it is always relevant. This greatly increases the product lifecycle and the long term replay-ability aspect - you will be playing Outsmarted for many years to come.

Sustainable materials

We have tried to minimise the use of plastic in our design. Aside from the figures and dice, no other plastic is used. It is not yet possible to produce the quality painted miniature figures included with our game in any other material than plastic, as soon as it is, we will switch. Our target is zero plastic!

Something else

In exactly the same way that a Kindle provides access to many books, Outsmarted provides access to limitless Question Packs and saves a lot of trees. Over years of play our game could conceivably provide the equivalent content of dozens or more traditional games. This is a significant environmental saving in all respects, less manufacturing, fewer chemicals, less transport, less plastic & ultimately, huge savings in the volume of paper / card required.

Risks & Challenges

All of the game mechanics rely on the Outsmarted software and this software development is already complete and has undergone extensive play testing over the past few months.

We are still working on small tweaks to playability to make the game even better, but, the beauty of software is that we can continuously upgrade & finetune the game experience long after your purchase.

Our game does not include extensive physical parts like some other more traditional board games and we are working with a highly reputable manufacturer so manufacturing issues are unlikely.

Our team has a lot of experience in delivering top level entertainment software and has been involved in some very large projects in the past.

The only perceivable risk is that due to the current global situation a yet unforeseen issue with manufacturing or shipping means that the delivery date is a little later than anticipated.

In this unlikely event, we are happy to guarantee to issue a full refund to any backer that does not wish to wait for a new alternative shipping date.

 

The past two years we have put our lives on hold and risked everything to get here. Outsmarted was too good a concept to ignore... 

The response of everyone that has helped us during play-testing has been a reward in of itself.  We've seen by their reactions that our game evokes a level of emotion, excitement and involvement that just isn’t possible with traditional board games, Outsmarted is genuinely the gateway to the future of board games... 

Never before has there been a board game with the capacity to grow and expand with new features and content in the way that Outsmarted can.

Even the older generation (our parents) enjoy taking part and the younger players are thrilled that there is now a board game where they can take on the adults on a level playing field...  They don't even realise how much they are learning as they play!

So we really hope you will get on board and join us at Outsmarted!  We want your support within our growing community as well as your suggestions to help us make Outsmarted the best it can be.  

We are certain that Outsmarted is just about the best board game experience you will ever get, starting from $35. Put simply, as a value proposition, it's in a different league to its traditional counterparts! 

Thanks in advance for backing us and take care of yourselves.

The Outsmarted Team
story_txt:
Finally! A 21st Century Board Game...
Outsmarted brings about the dawn of a new era of 21st Century board games, where tech meets tradition, in a giant leap for board gaming!

That's Christmas 2020!! 
There are two fantastic versions of Outsmarted available on Indiegogo, offering a $10 - $15 discount on the future retail price of Outsmarted. More importantly, if won't be in stores until April 2021, Get your copy today, whilst stock lasts. You can choose between the:

Outsmarted Retail Edition ($35)
Outsmarted Limited Edition ($45)

Once you have your game, gather round the TV and/ or the tablet and get the home board game + quiz show experience, the 21st Century demands! With questions based on the age of your team members and interactive video-based questions, it'll be an interactive experience for the whole family to enjoy in Christmas 2020!




 
Outsmarted means no one player, of any age, has an unfair advantage over the competition! With 2,500+ questions, and more added daily, including video-based questions, that can be streamed to your TV, what better way is there to spend Christmas 2020! You can EVEN play remotely with friends & family, as long as they have the app!
 

    Outsmarted Features - The New Era of Board Games!

Smart Game Host. The Outsmarted AI host runs the show for you! Just choose your teams, select which question packs you'd like, and if you need to keep the game time within a certain limit, let the game's AI do the rest!

Fantastic Team / Party Mode. Supporting up to 6 teams of 4 players (24 players). But beware - even in team mode, Outsmarted sometimes selects one member of the team for an important solo question.  


Remote Play. Outsmarted is the first board game DESIGNED to support remote play. Perfect in these times when friends and family cannot always be together.  Even better is that only YOU need to own the game - your friends and family can use the FREE Outsmarted app to join your game!

story:
Rescuing Robin Hood is a new collaborative deck-building game. Work together using your Wit, Stealth, Brawn and even your Jolliness to rescue the villagers from the Sheriff of Nottingham’s men. Once you have built up your Merry Band, select your dream team, storm the castle, and fight one final battle to rescue Robin Hood! Our talented illustrator, Paul Vermeesch, has worked incredibly hard on the art behind this exciting game. Help support Paul and the team at Castillo Games to finish this journey, and you’ll get stickers, posters, and an online version of the game in return!

This board game art sponsorship is the first of its kind. Our dream is to create a model that allows fans of the art and the game to be involved early on in the developmental stages in order to make games that are truly fantastic. Through your support both financially and by providing your feedback on our Tabletopia version, you can be a part of making this game incredible! If this model catches on, it could transform board game art across the industry!

Each character has a story. Meet Agnes Daisy and Fyrmyn.

These characters fearlessly lead the Merry Band in their attempt to rescue Robin!

A note from our founder:

Hi. I’m Bryce Brown, the board game designer for Rescuing Robin Hood. After working 6 years in pricing, finance, and marketing at Caterpillar and TDS Telecom, I decided to take a year off from work to serve the homeless, learn Spanish, and grow in my faith. In July 2019 I began my sabbatical. It has been a fruitful time of helping many and I am now conversational in Spanish!

Out of this time I also started designing a board game called Rescuing Robin Hood. Playtesting has been very successful. Only 1 of the first 30 people who played the game did not have fun playing it, and it has brought a lot of joy to people. Seeing the way that my game brought life and laughter to so many people, I decided in March 2020 to incorporate Castillo Games (named in honor of my grandmother) to publish my game with a vision of bringing joy to thousands of people across the world.

I also see this business as a way of giving back to the community. After thinking through the business need and the current difficult employment situation, I decided to hire a number of people to work part-time at Castillo Games. They have done an incredible job and I am very grateful for them. I would love to hire them full time and increase their pay, but I need your help!

This art sponsorship is an opportunity to provide employment, but it also makes you a part of creating something beautiful. Rescuing Robin Hood is not just a board game. It’s a work of art. Paul Vermeesch is a fantastic artist and is creating over 100 unique pieces of art for the game. Each character has their own art and unique backstory. You can see many of them for yourself on our website. By sponsoring the art, you will get cool collectible stickers and posters of these characters as well as an electronic playtest version of Rescuing Robin Hood on Tabletopia.

Playing Rescuing Robin Hood on Tabletopia has allowed me to connect with my friends and given us a neat way to spend quality time together. My hope is to bring that same joy and laugher to you and your friends. Here’s a what recent playtesters are saying:

"The artwork is beautiful, the mechanics are cohesive and accessible, and the theme is well developed. “Much more enjoyable than most of the cooperative games on the market!" – Dan O’Reagan

"Right now, this game is about as good as Forbidden Island, but with some more playtesting and refining it could be really good," – CT Spaulding

Because the Tabletopia is not a physical copy of the game, it will deliver much faster than a conventional game on Indiegogo or Kickstarter. Also, it will give you an opportunity to give feedback on the game and make the final physical copy of the game even better. Sponsor us on Indiegogo and become a part of creating a board game that is truly fantastic! 

By sponsoring the art, you will get an electronic playtest version of the game on Tabletopia, which will allow you to help refine the game mechanics. You will also receive stickers and posters of the game characters that are only available to Indiegogo sponsors along with exclusive access to the digital images of these characters. At the higher tiers, you can get an exclusive video tutorial from Paul Vermeesch on how to create vector art for your own characters and even the opportunity to be recognized in the rule book of the two final tiers.

Meet the team:

Bryce Brown

All the way from his hometown roots of Goure, Niger, Bryce established Castillo Games in Madison, WI because he absolutely loves board games and wanted to be a part of bringing great games to people he cares about and new friends he has yet to meet. “I love seeing the joy on people’s faces as they play my game and hope to bring that joy to thousands or even millions around the world!”

 

Paul Vermeesch

Paul grew up in the lovely Chicago suburb of Wheaton, IL and has a complete ZEST for life. As the artist and graphic designer of Bryce Brown’s “Rescuing Robin Hood” game, he feels as though he’s been preparing for this since he was little. “The lore of Robin Hood has been deep in my veins since I was a kid. I built numerous Robin Hood Lego creations growing up and even made a couple stop-motion Robin Hood movies! Being able to illustrate these iconic characters (and some new ones too!) for Rescuing Robin Hood has been a total blast.”

Risks and challenges:

With COVID-19 there is more uncertainty than normal. Government regulations or illness may bring delays certain manufacturers of stickers or posters. Another risk is that I could come down ill during June or July. 

To mitigate the manufacturing risk, we have quotes from multiple different vendors and are willing to go with a more expensive vendor if it means delivering the stickers and posters to you on time. To mitigate the risk of illness, I will be taking precautions with masks, social distancing and other precautions.

More Information on Intellectual Property

While backing us does provide you with images and the rights to use them for our personal use, Castillo Games retains all commercial use rights. All files, characters, images, and art associated with Rescuing Robin Hood (collectively the “Game”) are deemed to be licensed to you by Castillo, for your personal, non-commercial home use only. Castillo does not transfer either the title or the intellectual property rights and retains full and complete title to the Game as well as all intellectual property rights therein. You may not sell, license, redistribute or reproduce any part of the Game. All trademarks and logos are owned by Castillo and you may not copy or use them for commercial use. Permitted non-commercial uses include the creation of posters and stickers based on the images associated with the Game.
story_txt:
Rescuing Robin Hood is a new collaborative deck-building game. Work together using your Wit, Stealth, Brawn and even your Jolliness to rescue the villagers from the Sheriff of Nottingham’s men. Once you have built up your Merry Band, select your dream team, storm the castle, and fight one final battle to rescue Robin Hood! Our talented illustrator, Paul Vermeesch, has worked incredibly hard on the art behind this exciting game. Help support Paul and the team at Castillo Games to finish this journey, and you’ll get stickers, posters, and an online version of the game in return!
This board game art sponsorship is the first of its kind. Our dream is to create a model that allows fans of the art and the game to be involved early on in the developmental stages in order to make games that are truly fantastic. Through your support both financially and by providing your feedback on our Tabletopia version, you can be a part of making this game incredible! If this model catches on, it could transform board game art across the industry!
Each character has a story. Meet Agnes Daisy and Fyrmyn. 

These characters fearlessly lead the Merry Band in their attempt to rescue Robin!
A note from our founder:
Hi. I’m Bryce Brown, the board game designer for Rescuing Robin Hood. After working 6 years in pricing, finance, and marketing at Caterpillar and TDS Telecom, I decided to take a year off from work to serve the homeless, learn Spanish, and grow in my faith. In July 2019 I began my sabbatical. It has been a fruitful time of helping many and I am now conversational in Spanish!
Out of this time I also started designing a board game called Rescuing Robin Hood. Playtesting has been very successful. Only 1 of the first 30 people who played the game did not have fun playing it, and it has brought a lot of joy to people. Seeing the way that my game brought life and laughter to so many people, I decided in March 2020 to incorporate Castillo Games (named in honor of my grandmother) to publish my game with a vision of bringing joy to thousands of people across the world.

I also see this business as a way of giving back to the community. After thinking through the business need and the current difficult employment situation, I decided to hire a number of people to work part-time at Castillo Games. They have done an incredible job and I am very grateful for them. I would love to hire them full time and increase their pay, but I need your help!
This art sponsorship is an opportunity to provide employment, but it also makes you a part of creating something beautiful. Rescuing Robin Hood is not just a board game. It’s a work of art. Paul Vermeesch is a fantastic artist and is creating over 100 unique pieces of art for the game. Each character has their own art and unique backstory. You can see many of them for yourself on our website. By sponsoring the art, you will get cool collectible stickers and posters of these characters as well as an electronic playtest version of Rescuing Robin Hood on Tabletopia.
Playing Rescuing Robin Hood on Tabletopia has allowed me to connect with my friends and given us a neat way to spend quality time together. My hope is to bring that same joy and laugher to you and your friends. Here’s a what recent playtesters are saying:
"The artwork is beautiful, the mechanics are cohesive and accessible, and the theme is well developed. “Much more enjoyable than most of the cooperative games on the market!" – Dan O’Reagan
"Right now, this game is about as good as Forbidden Island, but with some more playtesting and refining it could be really good," – CT Spaulding
Because the Tabletopia is not a physical copy of the game, it will deliver much faster than a conventional game on Indiegogo or Kickstarter. Also, it will give you an opportunity to give feedback on the game and make the final physical copy of the game even better. Sponsor us on Indiegogo and become a part of creating a board game that is truly fantastic! 
By sponsoring the art, you will get an electronic playtest version of the game on Tabletopia, which will allow you to help refine the game mechanics. You will also receive stickers and posters of the game characters that are only available to Indiegogo sponsors along with exclusive access to the digital images of these characters. At the higher tiers, you can get an exclusive video tutorial from Paul Vermeesch on how to create vector art for your own characters and even the opportunity to be recognized in the rule book of the two final tiers.

Meet the team:
Bryce Brown
All the way from his hometown roots of Goure, Niger, Bryce established Castillo Games in Madison, WI because he absolutely loves board games and wanted to be a part of bringing great games to people he cares about and new friends he has yet to meet. “I love seeing the joy on people’s faces as they play my game and hope to bring that joy to thousands or even millions around the world!” Paul Vermeesch
Paul grew up in the lovely Chicago suburb of Wheaton, IL and has a complete ZEST for life. As the artist and graphic designer of Bryce Brown’s “Rescuing Robin Hood” game, he feels as though he’s been preparing for this since he was little. “The lore of Robin Hood has been deep in my veins since I was a kid. I built numerous Robin Hood Lego creations growing up and even made a couple stop-motion Robin Hood movies! Being able to illustrate these iconic characters (and some new ones too!) for Rescuing Robin Hood has been a total blast.”

Risks and challenges:
With COVID-19 there is more uncertainty than normal. Government regulations or illness may bring delays certain manufacturers of stickers or posters. Another risk is that I could come down ill during June or July. 
To mitigate the manufacturing risk, we have quotes from multiple different vendors and are willing to go with a more expensive vendor if it means delivering the stickers and posters to you on time. To mitigate the risk of illness, I will be taking precautions with masks, social distancing and other precautions.
More Information on Intellectual Property
While backing us does provide you with images and the rights to use them for our personal use, Castillo Games retains all commercial use rights. All files, characters, images, and art associated with Rescuing Robin Hood (collectively the “Game”) are deemed to be licensed to you by Castillo, for your personal, non-commercial home use only. Castillo does not transfer either the title or the intellectual property rights and retains full and complete title to the Game as well as all intellectual property rights therein. You may not sell, license, redistribute or reproduce any part of the Game. All trademarks and logos are owned by Castillo and you may not copy or use them for commercial use. Permitted non-commercial uses include the creation of posters and stickers based on the images associated with the Game.

story:
The main goal of the project is to raise funds for the realization of new figures and terrain elements from the new Rotten Factory line. The models, that will arise thanks to your support and will go to your hands, are unique and created especially for this event. They were not previously available for sale, so it can be said that these are fresh, still fragrant with resin models. I will create for you many more of truly exceptional models which, with the development of grants, will appear in the offer. So remember if you give more you will get more. ;)

And don't forget to follow Rotten Factory on:
Facebook
Instagram
Twitter

You are interested in the project, but do not have the funds to support it? No problem! Money is not everything. The knowledge and skills, that I can develop thanks to you, are invaluable. All the time, I am looking for passionate and creative people to work together. If you have questions, suggestions or ideas you would like to share with me, please write to info@rottenfactory.eu.

The shipping cost will depend on the number of products purchased and will be calculated at the end of the campaign. You will be able to pay for shipping via PayPal or Rotten Factory website.

Shipping cost:

Free shipping for everyone who will support the project for $150 or more.

For those who will support the project for less than $150:

Poland - 15 - 20 PLN
Europe - 5 - 16 EUR , 4,50 - 15 GBP
ROW - 6 - 18,50 USD

 

Risks and challenges

I know how important is quality, which is backed by proper mold preparation and the use of top quality materials. It is also important to keep the deadlines and I am focused to deliver all shipments as soon as possible to their new owners.
Currently, I am the boss of myself and I care about everything from the idea through design, execution to sales. The only fear I have is that the new models delivery time may be slightly longer when the number of users increases. I would like to ask for understanding, and I undertake to ensure that the entire process of sculpting miniatures from stretch goals, casting and shipping will go smoothly. Of course, I will inform you about the progress of my work on a regular basis.

story:
Welcome to the new ambitious crosslances project! An adventure in the world of the undead, an entire gothic style cemetery awaits you for your adventures, ideal for horror, fantasy and historical campaigns, and for the scenarios of your wargames. All enriched with zombies, skeletons and other monsters. 

they are not normal miniatures that you buy and put on a shelf, they are miniatures for your 3D printer! By buying this, you will receive .stl files to print miniatures directly by your own 3D printers, while cozy at home!  
 

-if you already own a 3D printer, it's cheap and also funny, you will print unique and incredible quality models.   -If you don't own a 3D printer, it can be an opportunity to buy one! Costs for a printer are already low and accessible to anyone. You can still use a service like: 3D hub, shapeways, or any other that the net are crowding.    -No shipping cost! Anywhere in the universe, you just download the files and print!    -You can print it as many times as you want, for you and your friends.    -You can decide any printing dimension, from miniatures to real size titan sculptures!    - You can use these miniature for other games, as proxyes in games like ninth age or fantasy football. 
 

PLEASE NOTE - This Kickstarter is for digital files (STLs) to make all these items on your own home 3D printer - these are not physical goods ** 


 What would a cemetery be without a horde of undead? Skeletons, ghouls, zombies, ghosts and mummies in this pack of miniatures will make your adventures unique and scary! In addition we have kept an eye on a game that in recent years has often accompanied us in our work, we are talking about fantasy football, in fact these miniatures are not just monsters but can perfectly compose a team of undead for the famous game with the oval ball! 


                       For these highly detailed miniatures we recommend a sla or dlp resin printer, but you can get excellent results even with fdm printers, our most expert customers have made really extraordinary prints in these years! 

 

some test-prints, unfortunately this resin is extremely difficult to photograph because it is transparent and glossy. We hope to be able to insert soon, other tests with different resins.

 

Here is the real news, it is the first time that we try to create scenarios, and we hope you enjoy it. The idea comes from our summer holiday in Edinburgh, a beautiful city! But above all, rich in cemeteries and picturesque churches, for fans of wargames and role-playing games, it was normal to think: "Hey, do you  know how it would be to set an adventure in a place like that??", So we got to work and after several months , and print test, we are pleased to present you our scenic package, "the gates of the cemetery"! 


                       We have taken in over many photos that worked as a reference for our sculptures: you can find them on our amateur photo page: 

Photography Page

tell us what you think of our parallel passion! 

 All the scenarios reported here have been tested and printed with a very economic Tevo Tornado in our possession, and without the aid of any support. The painting of these scenarios was extremely simple: a black background spray, and a dry brush with acrilic white represented 90% of the work, to complete the presentation: some small washing and retouching by hand as a finishing touch. 

the cathedral is divided into three parts (façade, naves and transept) in order to make the printing easier and to make the modular length

the gate is divided into 3 parts, arch and the two doors

the crypts are divided into two parts: structure and roof

the dice throwing tower has internal structures that allow the passage of the dice.

 For these scenarios, a fdm print is suggested. 

 Taken from the impetus of sculpting we found ourselves sometimes creating elements that we can't categorize as miniature or scenic. These are three very particular sculptures: 

 
                      Two monumental tombs

Very complex to be printed with traditional filament printers, at least without significantly increasing the size, we suggest to realize them with Sla / Dlp printers so as not to lose part of the details. 

 The hearse 


                       This wagon is designed to be printed with filament printers, as those with more experience and a good 3D printer will not need any additional support.. The horses are designed in fact to facilitate even the filament print, the wagon instead has been divided into several parts and then be able to reassemble. 

 As already happened in the past, our stretch goals are not outlined at the beginning, in fact during the campaign it is usual for us to listen to you, backers, to create new sculptures during the campaign according to your suggestions. Obviously it is not always easy to please everyone, but we do our best. We have therefore set only a few Stretch goals at the moment, but they can change during the campaign, so we are open to your proposals that you can see added to your pledge. 

Miniature

Scenic

Miniature

 

Miniature

Scenic

Another small update for our beloved backers!

We followed one of your suggestions and we created an alternative piece for the crypts.

Ruined and partially collapsed roofs, to give a more sinister appearance to your graveyard.

Miniature

Still a small addition, following one of your suggestions here is our interpretation of the nightmare.

Scenic

Some simple elements but I think they will please many of you.

of the ruins of a circular building.

And broken tombstones.

Miniature

One more miniature for you.

A necromancer or an exorcist if you prefer, we really like this miniature, what do you think?

Scenic

 A funeral scene, with the coffin about to be dropped into the grave, while the second is the same tomb a few nights later! but with surprise!

Scenic

A bell fallen to the ground coming from some kind of abandoned bell tower.

Scenic

As you suggested we created a chapel, which can be used where space is not sufficient to insert the cathedral with its bell tower.

Scenic

A small bridge in our usual style.

We did not want to make a very large bridge with buildings above or very long.

We thought that our sculptures are ideal for building wargame and exterior scenarios, and we believe it is extremely difficult to place a large bridge together with all our other sculptures.

So we made a bridge that crosses a ditch or a stream.

Miniature

A plague doctor who wanders in the cemetery with bad intentions!

Scenic

The house of the watchman, we have created this very versatile and compact house that you can easily insert in your scenarios.


Miniature

Scenic

So here is the last sculpture for you that we decided to add: the requests were many, many beautiful ideas, but in the end we decided to make a well, we consider it a characteristic element that is good with the rest of the scenics in over a medium-sized piece that you can easily place within your landscapes.

Crosslances studios is founded by 3 artists and their commons passion for the world of games. Students at the Comics courses in Florence, made by the greebo games sculptures, they approached the world of miniatures. It has actually became a revelant studio in the world of miniatures and digital miniatures prototyping. Our products can be found in many places, we had collaborations with: Labmasu, Megalith Godslayer, Hidden Dreams, Minuteman miniatures, Fireforge , and many others  

Risks and challenges

Crosslances is a dynamic studio researching for innovation, our challenge is to renew ourselves by renewing our opening game, hoping it could give us a good lift. 
We hope the world will always be more prepared to our little revolution: bringing 3D printable games into houses. Risks for customers are minimal, with a good preparation with your own 3D printer, it will impossible to have problems. 
Biggest difficulties are found in supports positioning, in fact printing quality of complex objects can be improved wit adequate supports.

story:
*This campaign is for a set of digital STL files - no physical products*

Beautiful Night is the first set by Bella Nacht 3D Studios, but hopefully not the last. 

I poured my heart into every one of these ladies, and I learned so much as I finished each of them and moved on to the next. 

Bella Nacht is a one-woman project, but I can't claim sole credit for its existence. 

Without the constant interruptions from one fat cat, the never-ending encouragement from my university lecturer Conor O'Kane (@cokane on IG) and the butt-whoopin'-get-it-done attitude from my grandmother (on a daily basis), I wouldn't have even attempted this project to begin with. 

 Artstation | Instagram | Twitter | Bella Nacht FB Group | Bella Nacht Discord

The core set is made up of 8 lovely ladies. You will receive the digital files for each one. These models are ideal for resin printers, but suitable for FDM printers as well. 

 What will you receive?

Each figure has been exported as a high-quality STL file. 

The products will be delivered via Gumroad, so the files will always be available in your online library in case you ever lose your downloaded files -anything can happen- this also ensures you'll receive any updates that may become available with minimum hassle. 

*These models are 75mm tall - give or take a few mm depending on the model's pose* 

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

 

__________________________________________________________________________________________

Stretch goals are currently being sculpted and will be released shortly after the Core set is released, or as they're finished. They will be announced and posted as they're unlocked. 

__________________________________________________________________________________________

Ophelia, Celestria, Belladonna, Livana, Radella, and Rhodanthe have gone topless for the first stretch goal. To comply with Kickstarter's rules, I've posted renders in my Facebook Group Here and the Discord Channel to avoid any issues. 

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

UNLOCKED - WIP Coming Soon - Please be patient, this is a one woman project. 

__________________________________________________________________________________________

UNLOCKED - WIP Coming Soon - Please be patient, this is a one woman project. 

__________________________________________________________________________________________

UNLOCKED - WIP Coming Soon - Please be patient, this is a one woman project. 

__________________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________________________________________

Rules

Base Tier:

By purchasing the base tiers, you agree that both the digital files and the printed versions of the Beautiful Night models may not be sold commercially.   You must not profit from these models in any way. 

Commerical Tier:

By purchasing the commercial tier, you agree that the digital files may not be shared or sold. The printed versions of the models CAN be sold in whatever outlet you wish. You may not use my renders or images for your product or display photos. You must create your own images for the products. 

I must be credited as the original artist. Bella Nacht, Bella Nacht 3D Studios, Blythe Thompson - any of these are suitable as well as a link to one of my social media profiles.

Only the physical products may be sold, not the digital files. 

 

Test prints 

 

Risks and challenges

This project is for a set of STL files (digital files) so risks are truly limited. Any issues that may arise with the models can be amended, upgraded and delivered to all backers. Some minor changes may be made to the models as the Kickstarter progresses, to improve printing quality.

WARNING: Placing supports on boobs or butts will result in printing privelges being revoked.

They will be announced and posted as they're unlocked. __________________________________________________________________________________________Ophelia, Celestria, Belladonna, Livana, Radella, and Rhodanthe have gone topless for the first stretch goal. To comply with Kickstarter's rules, I've posted renders in my Facebook Group Here and the Discord Channel to avoid any issues. ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________UNLOCKED - WIP Coming Soon - Please be patient, this is a one woman project. __________________________________________________________________________________________UNLOCKED - WIP Coming Soon - Please be patient, this is a one woman project. __________________________________________________________________________________________UNLOCKED - WIP Coming Soon - Please be patient, this is a one woman project. ____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________RulesBase Tier:By purchasing the base tiers, you agree that both the digital files and the printed versions of the Beautiful Night models may not be sold commercially.   You must not profit from these models in any way. Commerical Tier:By purchasing the commercial tier, you agree that the digital files may not be shared or sold. The printed versions of the models CAN be sold in whatever outlet you wish. You may not use my renders or images for your product or display photos. You must create your own images for the products. I must be credited as the original artist. Bella Nacht, Bella Nacht 3D Studios, Blythe Thompson - any of these are suitable as well as a link to one of my social media profiles.Only the physical products may be sold, not the digital files.  Test prints  Risks and challengesThis project is for a set of STL files (digital files) so risks are truly limited. Any issues that may arise with the models can be amended, upgraded and delivered to all backers. Some minor changes may be made to the models as the Kickstarter progresses, to improve printing quality.WARNING: Placing supports on boobs or butts will result in printing privelges being revoked.

story:
WHO ARE WE?

We are a group of gamers dedicated to growing and promoting the board game hobby and those who enjoy it.  Tom Vasel, Sam Healey, Zee Garcia, and many others produce weekly videos of hundreds of different games each year.  Additionally, Eric Summerer and Tom produce a weekly podcast all about games and the people who play them.  We also produce a news podcast, Board Game Breakfast and other variety shows, a series of popular "Top Ten" list videos, shopping guides, and more!  All of this can be found at our website - www.dicetower.com.

WHY BACK THE DICE TOWER?

Our show gets a majority of its funding from our fundraising campaign each year.  We have four full-time employees (Tom, Sam, Zee, and our editor, Derek), as well as a part-time webmaster and Eric.    Last year, our focus was on making the show better in the audio department. This year, our goal is to continue our focus on improving audio, and possibly getting our own studio!  We're asking for your help as we pursue our goal of covering the entire world of board games.  We have a myriad of cool rewards, but we hope that your main goal in supporting this campaign is to keep The Dice Tower going.  We are dedicated to keeping the show and our videos free for download and viewing, and appreciate those who join us in that goal.

Here are our stretch goals for our campaign this year!

$205,000 - We bring in Chaz Marler again as a freelancer! - DONE!

$210,000 - Eric Summerer will do his top 100 games of all time as a video series. - DONE!

$215,000 - We will once again have a booth (and show) at Essen Spiel! - DONE!

$220,000 - Roy Cannaday will do his top 100 games of all time as a video series. - DONE!

$225,000 - The Dice Tower crew will play a one-off RPG live! - DONE!

$230,000 - Married with Board Games will do their top 100 games of all time as a video series. - DONE!

$240,000 - Joe Steadman, the original co-host of the Dice Tower, will come in for our 500th episode! - DONE!

$250,000 - DICE TOWER HEADQUARTERS planning will begin. - DONE!

$260,000 - We will do a second 30-hour gaming marathon sometime in 2017. - DONE!

$270,000 - Yeah, the HQ is definitely a thing here.  Also a third camera for three angles. - DONE!

$280,000 - Yes, we'll finally do a walkthrough of Jason's collection.  FOR SURE. - DONE!

 

REWARDS

We have a pile of amazing rewards!  Check below at our incredible (thanks to amazing publishers) promo packs, as well as other Dice Tower Swag.

$ 10 - Show your love for the Dice Tower by putting this sticker on your car, computer, or wherever it will stick! (use responsibly)

 

$15 - Two types of dice.  

1.  Either a pair of amazing quality dice from Chessex, of various colors (you can't pick the color, but they will be the same color).  Each die has a custom side where the "six" would be.   

2.  A pair of dice with the Dice Tower logo on all six sides.

 

$ 25 - Each year Andre designs us an amazing playmat, and this year is no exception!

 

$ 30 - Tom, and all eight of the other Vasels, will sign a Christmas card, and send it out to you over the holiday season!

 

$ 25  - Show up at game night with a custom bag, showing off your amazing games in style!  (Note:  the bag is a cloth bag, not the same one that we did last year.)  Size is 15"h x 13"w x 10"

 

$ 30 - Do you hate paper money as much as Tom?  Replace it with these cool money cards!  About 100 cards in total.

 

$ 48 - The velvet voice of Eric Summerer - recording a message for you live (no commercial messages, please - this is for your phone).

 

$ 60 - Sam, Tom, and Zee will wish you or a loved one a happy birthday, happy anniversary, get well, or whatever you want.  Videos will be around 1-2 minutes, and we'll need a month's notice to get them finished.

 

$ 30 - We'll give you a shoutout at the end of at least 5 videos that we post over the course of the year in the credits.

 

Play a game with us digitally online or in-person at a convention - check the perks for details!

 

Join us for breakfast, lunch, or dinner at a convention - check the perks for details!

 

$ 35 - Rob will send you one of his custom box inserts (just pick any of the current games on his website.)

 

$ 40 - Digital Dice Pledge:  For either iOS or Android, you will get: Ticket to Ride, Colt Express, Splendor, Potion Explosion, Mysterium, Mr. Jack Pocket, and Pandemic!

 

$ 50 - Andy does a magnificent pirate-themed wooden dice tower for us!

 

$ 50 - Once again, Andre makes us a cool viking-themed wooden dice tower.

 

$ 50 - Get a wooden dice tower with our mascot on it!

 

$ 50 - Get a plastic tower with our mascot on it!

 

$ 50 - Get the classic plastic dice tower that we put out each year.  This year's will say "2017", and comes in clear with pink tumblers, clear with red tumblers, and translucent green with green tumblers.

$50 - Another wooden dice tower, with beautiful artwork!  Note:  This is a separate pledge on the side, since it was added after the campaign started.

 

$30 - A plastic card holder to help keep your cards nicely organized!

 

$ 10 - It's a custom deck of Time's Up cards - chosen by YOU guys from a poll during the campaign.  52 cards, 104 words!

 

A new card for this great deck-building game!

 

Chuck the Die makes his debut appearance in a game!

 

A new card for this fun microgame!

 

A promo that works for both games!

 

Huzzah!  A new card for the mega-hit Scythe!

 

A new tower defending the universe!

 

Two new cards for Onitama!

 

A new upgrade card for the fun game Get Rich Quick!

 

An expansion for this fun card game coming out in 2017!

 

Bonus cards for Century: Spice Road! (formally known as "Caravan")

 

A new tile for Roll for the Galaxy (both sides shown)

 

A brand new card for Coup!

 

Delve deeper into the dungeons of Clank with these enchanted dice!

 

New ways to bluff or not bluff in Sheriff of Nottingham!

 

Three new cards for London Dread!

 

Three new cards for Wazabi!

 

A new weapon for Adrenaline (artwork coming soon.)

 

 

 

The Dice Tower shows up in Islebound!

 

A new mini expansion for this cooperative game.

 

Ron couldn't do the spell, but you can have the card!

 

A new card for 7 Wonders Duel (artwork coming soon).

 

A brand new card for your Terraforming Mars game!

 

A new dragon for Battleground Fantasy Warfare!

 

New ways to kill people! Er, I mean new cards!

 

From our last campaign, a great tile to include in your Imperial Settlers game!

A new god for Santorini!

 

Get Kookie, the giant King of Tokyo monster!

 

A new djinn card for Five Tribes! 

 

A promo for Escape (artwork coming soon.)

 

A promo for World Monuments (artwork coming soon.)

 

A pack of 8 secret mission cards for Cry Havoc!

 

 

A new pet (includes mini) for Arcadia Quest!

 

Eric turns evil for Zombicide!  (mini included.)

 

Four hilarious new cards for Emojito!

 

A new card (with AMAZING artwork) for Valeria!

 

3 new cards for the "fun version of Life" game CV

 

A new card for the very unique Roll Player

 

Cards for the new expansion for Thunder Alley!

 

Two new cards for Tom's favorite game of 2016!

 

A pack of three of these cards for this card drafting game!

 

A cool new card for this Eric Lang game.

 

A mini expansion for Stockpile!

 

Jason Levine shows up as a playable character for Champions of Midgard!

 

A set of four cards to replace the towers in Machi Koro (from last year's campaign.)

 

A new promo card for the upcoming redesign of Stop Thief!

 

A new set of evolution cards for Evolution!

 

Some promos for Cyclades: Monuments

 

New penguins for Ice Cool.

 

 

A promo figure for War of the Ring!

 

A mini expansion for the game Rome

 

Two promo characters for Dice Masters

 

Two HeroClix ID cards!

 

A new character card for Burke's Gambit!

 

A promo for Manhattan Project: Energy Empire!

 

A new advisor for Master of Orion!

 

A mini expansion (with rules to a new game) for Pyramid Arcade!

 

A Slaughterball dice bag!

 

A Splendor promo card!

 

New promos for Garbage Day, designed specifically for board gamers!

 

 

Tom, Sam, or Zee will draw you a custom dice masters card! (you will also get the actual, better art as well.)

 

A pack of Slaughterball promo miniatures, including the ugly Tom Vasel.

 

A dead of Winter promo pack! (from the 2014 campaign!)

 

A set of four coasters to keep you drinks from ruining your table!

 

A large 30mm D6 with the dice tower logo on it!

story:
Set sail on the high seas with your fellow pirates in a fast-paced game of confidence, discovery, and bluffing.  Avoid the dreaded Pirate's Mark as you navigate the open waters to gain prestige and treasure.  Take turns staking your claim on how many cards you can pull without being marked. The last player without a Pirate’s Mark wins.  Will it be you? 

130 cards are on the table.  How many can you pull without getting a Pirate’s Mark? One? Two? Ten?  Players place their bids one at a time.  Each player must raise their bid by at least one card.  If someone doubts a player's ability to accomplish a bid, they can call their bluff.  

If a fellow player calls your bluff, you’ll have to prove it!  As you turn over cards, some will make your journey worthwhile, and some will make it more treacherous.  Some cards must be followed immediately and others can be collected for future use.  But be careful!  If you pull a Pirate’s Mark card, you’re out...for now at least.  Some pirates are hard to get rid of.     

If you successfully navigate the waters without pulling a Pirate's Mark, the player that called your bluff must pull one card as punishment.  The game continues until there are either 10 cards left on the table or just two unmarked players.  At this point, the final duel begins and unmarked players take turns pulling one card at a time.  The last player without a Pirate’s Mark wins. 

Full Game and Rules Explained: 

CLICK HERE FOR PDF COPY OF RULES

The box contains a 10 sided dice and 151 Total Cards: 1 compass card, 35 luck cards, 35 curse cards, 80 item cards.

  

Pirate's Mark is designed by Puzzol Creative, a creative company started by lifelong friends with the goal of bringing unique, exciting, and affordable entertainment to the city of Memphis.  We've always been big fans of board games, routinely getting together with friends and family for game nights, and that love of board games led to us creating our own.  Pirate's Mark is the first of three games we plan to debut this year.   

We are working with Black Box to ship and we will do everything within our power to get it to you on time. However, there are some countries they cannot ship to. They are Afghanistan, Brazil, Congo, Cote d'Ivoire, Cuba, Democratic Republic of Congo, Eritrea, Guam, Guinea-Bissau, Haiti, Iran, Iraq, Liberia, Libya, Myanmar (Burma), North Korea, Russia, Somalia, South Africa, Sudan, Syria, and Ukraine.
