story:
Our Story

There is something magical about toys. Inspiration, imagination, and wonder machines that return us to a brighter time and bring some of our wildest dreams to reality! However, it has never been enough for me to just be a toy collector or appreciator. I have always wanted to create. To flush out my own ideas into the three dimensional world. Enter 3D printing!

In 2015 I purchased my first 3D printer as a kit and hand built the machine more or less as a personal science project. The build looked nice and printed fairly well but was a bit unreliable, and the hobby was still fairly expensive in both cost and time.

So it went to the back burner until 2018 when I was randomly gifted with a 3D printing pen that was still on back-order. Even without the machine in hand it immediately triggered my past curiosities and I began researching the new printers out there and a short time later found myself with a newer, full factory made printer!

I had originally designed the concept for DRAUGHTNAUTS in 2015 but could not accurately print them till I had this newer machine, and the machine just happened to be perfect for printing the parts needed to make these figurines! Long story short the new machine printed so well I just had to get two more to print more figurines faster! And I began thinking of variant color schemes, and helmets and weapons! And each new idea seemed totally possible and I got that amazing sense of magic I felt when I was a kid! That’s when it dawned on me to create the game. That I could create something that everyone could enjoy and hopefully bring back that feeling to others. That return to a playful magic, that feeling of something new!

 

Breaking Down the Costs

So lets get down to business. This is obviously a crowdfunding campaign which means we are looking to the community for help in getting to our next goal, of being able to fully mass produce this game and supply it to our eager fans!

Here's what we need. We are looking to raise $7500 in order to kick our little start-up into full gear. Here's how we break down the costs.

  • 1/4 of the funds will go to buying the rest of the printers and filament we need to get to full mass production. With only 3 printers right now we are only running at about 1/3 our capabilities. With the new additions we speed up production by 50%!
  • 1/4 of the funds go to the packaging and the other design elements. This allows us to get all the raw elements and machinery to create the packaging, literature, and game boards in house, saving our customers in the final retail costs.
  • 1/4 of the funds goes to the completion of our studio workshop! We've got a lot accomplished already but we still need the proper finishing and furniture before we can move in and begin full production!
  • And the final 1/4 of the funds will address the legal costs, fees associated with creating the business, as well as crowdfunding costs.

 

What You Get

Let's talk about donation rewards!

  • Our tier 1 Street Team level donation of $20 will get you a bumper sticker, 2 base character stickers, and a coupon for 25% off a retail full set.

 

  • Our tier 2 Gamer level donation of $50 gets you a full set of Draughtnauts, a bumper sticker, and a coupon for 25% off a retail expansion set!**

 

  • For a $100 donation you'll enter into our Super Fan tier! You'll get a full set of Draughtnauts plus a designer t-shirt*, as well as a bumper sticker, and 2 coupons for 25% off retail expansion sets.**

 

  • Our 4th tier is appropriately called the Collector tier! For your donation of $250 you will get everything we will be offering once we launch. You'll get the full set, an expansion set, a t-shirt*, a bumper sticker, 2 base color stickers, and 50% another retail expansion set. But you'll also be one of the first people to receive our expansion game board, the Mega Board which also includes an additional Standard Board of your choice (*see below for choices).

 

CHOOSE CUSTOM EXPANSION

COLOR AND NAME!!

 

  • And finally we have the mega lode! The Draughtnaut General tier! For a donation of $450 you become a Draughtnaut master with 2 Full sets, 2 expansion sets, 2 t-shirts*, the bumper sticker and the base color stickers, 2 coupons for 50% off retail expansion sets as well as 25% off another full set, a Mega Board with 2 additional Standard Boards of your choice (*see below for choices), and you even get to choose the color scheme and name of the next expansion line! But lets keep it G rated!

 

*You will be contacted by email after donating to select your T-Shirt size (Tier 3, 4 & 5), your standard board choice (Tier 4 & 5), and color/name of your choice (Tier 5).

**Tier 2 and Tier 3 donations will be charged a flat rate for 1-3 day priority shipping.  Free shipping for Tiers 1, 4, & 5!

Tier 4 and 5 Standard Board options!

Battlefield (Default)

Royal Hall

Ice Land

The Great Forest

Island Battle

 

The Impact

Our very tiny, home business has been trucking away since July 2018 and producing at a steady rate, but we've got a lot of work ahead of us.  Every product we produce is manufactured and assembled by hand, currently by myself in my free time.  With your awesome and gracious contributions we will be able to expand into full production mode and be able to provide the highest quality products with faster delivery to our customers!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially, but still want to help?  No worries, any help is great help!

  • Like and share this crowdfunding page to help spread the word!
  • Please feel free to use #Draughtnauts or #Lazartstudios on social media!
  • Share our website and keep an eye out for news and upcoming releases!

Like and share us!

  • Instagram: @LazArtStudios
  • Facebook: @LazArtStudios

If you would to make a donation by check/wire please drop us a line at:

lazartstudios.com/contact

Our Story
There is something magical about toys. Inspiration, imagination, and wonder machines that return us to a brighter time and bring some of our wildest dreams to reality! However, it has never been enough for me to just be a toy collector or appreciator. I have always wanted to create. To flush out my own ideas into the three dimensional world. Enter 3D printing!
In 2015 I purchased my first 3D printer as a kit and hand built the machine more or less as a personal science project. The build looked nice and printed fairly well but was a bit unreliable, and the hobby was still fairly expensive in both cost and time.
So it went to the back burner until 2018 when I was randomly gifted with a 3D printing pen that was still on back-order. Even without the machine in hand it immediately triggered my past curiosities and I began researching the new printers out there and a short time later found myself with a newer, full factory made printer!
I had originally designed the concept for DRAUGHTNAUTS in 2015 but could not accurately print them till I had this newer machine, and the machine just happened to be perfect for printing the parts needed to make these figurines! Long story short the new machine printed so well I just had to get two more to print more figurines faster! And I began thinking of variant color schemes, and helmets and weapons! And each new idea seemed totally possible and I got that amazing sense of magic I felt when I was a kid! That’s when it dawned on me to create the game. That I could create something that everyone could enjoy and hopefully bring back that feeling to others. That return to a playful magic, that feeling of something new!
 

Breaking Down the Costs
So lets get down to business. This is obviously a crowdfunding campaign which means we are looking to the community for help in getting to our next goal, of being able to fully mass produce this game and supply it to our eager fans!
Here's what we need. We are looking to raise $7500 in order to kick our little start-up into full gear. Here's how we break down the costs.


1/4 of the funds will go to buying the rest of the printers and filament we need to get to full mass production. With only 3 printers right now we are only running at about 1/3 our capabilities. With the new additions we speed up production by 50%!
1/4 of the funds go to the packaging and the other design elements. This allows us to get all the raw elements and machinery to create the packaging, literature, and game boards in house, saving our customers in the final retail costs.
1/4 of the funds goes to the completion of our studio workshop! We've got a lot accomplished already but we still need the proper finishing and furniture before we can move in and begin full production!
And the final 1/4 of the funds will address the legal costs, fees associated with creating the business, as well as crowdfunding costs.

 
What You Get
Let's talk about donation rewards!

Our tier 1 Street Team level donation of $20 will get you a bumper sticker, 2 base character stickers, and a coupon for 25% off a retail full set.
 

Our tier 2 Gamer level donation of $50 gets you a full set of Draughtnauts, a bumper sticker, and a coupon for 25% off a retail expansion set!**
 

For a $100 donation you'll enter into our Super Fan tier! You'll get a full set of Draughtnauts plus a designer t-shirt*, as well as a bumper sticker, and 2 coupons for 25% off retail expansion sets.**
 


Our 4th tier is appropriately called the Collector tier! For your donation of $250 you will get everything we will be offering once we launch. You'll get the full set, an expansion set, a t-shirt*, a bumper sticker, 2 base color stickers, and 50% another retail expansion set. But you'll also be one of the first people to receive our expansion game board, the Mega Board which also includes an additional Standard Board of your choice (*see below for choices).
 


CHOOSE CUSTOM EXPANSION
COLOR AND NAME!!
 
And finally we have the mega lode! The Draughtnaut General tier! For a donation of $450 you become a Draughtnaut master with 2 Full sets, 2 expansion sets, 2 t-shirts*, the bumper sticker and the base color stickers, 2 coupons for 50% off retail expansion sets as well as 25% off another full set, a Mega Board with 2 additional Standard Boards of your choice (*see below for choices), and you even get to choose the color scheme and name of the next expansion line! But lets keep it G rated!
 
*You will be contacted by email after donating to select your T-Shirt size (Tier 3, 4 & 5), your standard board choice (Tier 4 & 5), and color/name of your choice (Tier 5).
**Tier 2 and Tier 3 donations will be charged a flat rate for 1-3 day priority shipping.  Free shipping for Tiers 1, 4, & 5!
Tier 4 and 5 Standard Board options!
Battlefield (Default)

Royal Hall

Ice Land

The Great Forest

Island Battle

 

The Impact
Our very tiny, home business has been trucking away since July 2018 and producing at a steady rate, but we've got a lot of work ahead of us.  Every product we produce is manufactured and assembled by hand, currently by myself in my free time.  With your awesome and gracious contributions we will be able to expand into full production mode and be able to provide the highest quality products with faster delivery to our customers!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute financially, but still want to help?  No worries, any help is great help!

Like and share this crowdfunding page to help spread the word!
Please feel free to use #Draughtnauts or #Lazartstudios on social media!
Share our website and keep an eye out for news and upcoming releases!

Like and share us!

Instagram: @LazArtStudios

Facebook: @LazArtStudios


If you would to make a donation by check/wire please drop us a line at:
lazartstudios.com/contact

story:
Update: We're now officially on Google Play Store! Thank you so much for everyone's support!

Download the app for FREE

Get the "Early Bird -- Join the Beta!" perk here on Indiegogo for a $1 discount on Premium! First come first serve!

---------------------------------------

The problem with party games now is that there is no lasting solution. What if you run out of categories to play? Find a new app. What if you want to play a game that's pretty similar, but just not similar enough? Buy a new game.

We've noticed that games like Head's Up, Charades, Catch Phrase, Monikers, etc., all use very similar playing concepts, and yet each variation becomes another item on the shopping list. Say What is here to change that. Here’s how:

 

Say What is the ultimate app for people who love party games. In a single app, you get tons of game modes and a community deck collection. The Game Modes allow all your favorite games to be packed into one app. And the community-built deck collection means that there will always be new decks to be played. These two powerful ideas put together allow Say What to be constantly expanding and offering more entertainment value as the app grows. 

 

 

With just a swipe, you can start playing an entirely new game. The following games are modes that we would love to include in Say What. In the current beta version, we only have a few of these modes. But as we get more support, we’ll be able to include all of these games and more!

 

Say What comes with a "Standard Deck" section with topics we've handpicked, as well as a community deck collection. So if you're not satisfied with topics we choose, you can make your own decks, or look around to see what other players have created. The possibilities provide endless fun!

While other apps charge $1 per deck, all decks in Say What will always be FREE! It would take you $30+ worth of other games to get the same playability that Say What offers. (And that's WITHOUT purchasing additional decks!) All backers get our premium version which lets you play without worrying about ads.

Our app is currently only for Android. If we get enough support, we would love to launch an iOS version of the app.

With your contribution, we can make ‘Say What’ not just a ground-breaking idea, but a reality!

 

(NOTE: All higher-tiered perks include the perks of a lesser tier, but you MUST have a gmail account in order to access the beta test. When the app makes an official launch, then you may use any email to register. Sorry for the inconvenience!)


 

 

Fresh out of college, we don’t have much to go on. And a game with a lot of decks takes a lot of space and computing power! Our goal is to raise $1,000 dollars here on Indiegogo to kick-start our project. Here's a list of our initial expenses:

  • Data management (using Firebase servers)
  • Deck search functionality (using Algolia search function, which costs a lot. We hope to make our own server to eliminate this need.)
  • Proper legal consultation (regulate our awesome user content, keep it clean)
  • Developer costs (Nicholas gets hungry)
  • Designer costs (Justin gets hungry, too!)
  • Resources for new features, sweet updates, and bug squashing.

The rest will go to lots and lots of coffee.  (Just kidding! We don’t even drink coffee :) ) But really, because of the active and changing user base, this game will require a lot of maintenance, which just can’t happen unless we get a little help. The $1000 will be enough for about 6 months of server and deck fees alone -- and that’s if we don’t eat for 6 months! Once the app gets rolling, it will sustain itself through its own revenues.

 

The challenge with Say What, and with all social games, is the user base. We are hoping that our game has enough great users and content that it can naturally build its own community. We’re reaching out to newspapers, bloggers, education journalists, and gaming websites and telling them the great potential that this game can bring. We’re crossing our fingers that we won’t need to dip our toes into Facebook advertising, since that costs a lot of money. But we might resort to that for some exposure as well.

Taking those possibilities into account, we’re still confident that our app is stellar and will gain enough traction to have a great take-off. Just watch it go!

 

If you can't contribute but still think our idea is cool and deserves a chance, don't forget to tell your friends about Say What through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, word of mouth, or whatever way you can find! The Indiegogo share tools are a great help to get started!

And remember, no matter how you contribute, you get to be part of revolutionizing the party game world!

Justin and Nicholas form a tight-knit team that have boatloads of fun together. But not only fun. They also have some awesome ideas which result in awesome things. ‘Say What?’ is their newest creation, made to make the world a better place and give it a reason to party!

 

Oh. And we like meditating in extreme locations.

 

 

Disclaimer: We have no connection with Hasbro, Warner Brothers, or any other company whose games may be similar to game modes in Say What. Say What should not be confused with any other games mentioned on this page.

story:
Welcome to the 27th volume of Dimgaard's DnD adventures. Thanks for the consideration. These are PDFs delivered through our proprietary document management system. If you want to see what a Dimgaard adventure module looks like, samples of the opening chapters in the two current campaigns (Patron Wars and Encounters with Gold) are available at www.dimgaard.com – as well as other information about the Dimgaard setting - including other free modules from past campaigns.

We would note the six principles that Dimgaard builds its adventures around (each of which is elaborated on at www.dimgaard.com):  

  • A strong story.   
  • Strict adherence to Rules As Written (RAW). 
  • Largest set of player options. 
  • Challenge PCs at all levels of play. 
  • Low DM prep time. 
  • Easy presentation.

There are two 21 chapter Dimgaards currently in play. Encounters with Gold explores the dragonkin culture in Dimgaard. And the Patron Wars brings the Blood War to Dimgaard.

As an useful supplement in the examination of the Blood War, the next installment in the scaling of monsters from CR0-20 takes a look at barlguras - the apelike demons - with GLD28 Barlguras CR0-20. The other supplement reward is another expansion of the NPC galleries that are useful in many campaigns beyond Dimgaard with DGN4 NPCs Vol. IV.

Here are the summary statements for the seven modules offered:

Encounters with Gold

EG14 Draconic Sanctums. For weeks the Dragon Cabal has terrorized southern Dimgaard with the assassinations of influential citizens. However, everyone who observed the campaign realized that this was a prelude – but to what? The answer threatens the lives and freedom of all who aren’t a part of the Dragon Cabal – even other dragonkin. Can heroes slow the Cabal’s onslaught? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 14th level characters. Episode 14 in Encounters with Gold.

EG15 Draconic Escape. War has gripped southern Dimgaard as the Dragon Cabal makes its move. The defenders were destabilized and are fighting to regroup. Can heroes rescue the important assets from the beleaguered city of Odill before it falls? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 15th level characters. The 15th episode of Encounters with Gold.

EG16 A Draconic Ally.  All southern Dimgaard is on the verge of falling under the dominion of the Dragon Cabal. The events have evolved so quickly that – although rumors are that the Metropolitan is attempting to coordinate a broad reactionary force – the Dragon Cabal has faced very little resistance. But a few forces are holding out – such as the Verdadis barony. Can heroes unify the disparate opposition to the Dragon Cabal into a force to turn the tide of the onslaught? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 16th level characters – the 16th episode in Encounters with Gold.

EG17 The Draconic See. The Dragon Cabal has overwhelmed the communities of southern Dimgaard. They have begun to solidify their positions by ruthlessly eliminating resistance and coopting resources. Can heroes’ help keep the only center of organized resistance independent? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 17th level characters. Episode seventeen in Encounters with Gold.

Patron Wars

PW5 The Corrupting Patron. With the River Styx cutting through Dimgaard, the Blood War floods into the region. While Farjvad is under attack, but relatively safe, the lesser communities are not faring well. Palga is a small community built around the caretaking of a sacred burial site. It has become the focus of Ansitif the Befouler. Can heroes protect the sanctity of Palga’s sites and relics? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 5th level characters. Episode 5 in the Patron Wars.

PW6 The Criminal Patron. Ulskov has long had a sketchy reputation – a haven for those wanted by justice, and rumored to be the source of many criminal plots. Word arrives that a new order is in place. Can heroes ensure that the newly forming syndicate will have not be an instrument of chaos, havoc, and murder? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 6th level characters. Episode 6 in the Patron Wars.

PW7 The Quiet Patron. Positioned closest to the breach the River Styx has created to the Abyss, Farberg should have been the first community to come under attack, but the agrarian community – an independent fief – has been quiet, and replied to inquiries that it is secure. But questions have arisen. Can heroes discern investigate this curious situation and bring revelations to light? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 7th level characters. Episode 7 of the Patron Wars.

Episode 7 of the Patron Wars.

story:
Facebook | Instagram | Twitter | Website

Link to review

Please see the link for the full Manipulate Rule Book (please note these are the rules in their current form, there may be some tweaks to the final version).

 

 

Below is a very quick summary of how to play the game.

While setting up the game, players pick or randomly draw a Character (Celebrity, Criminal Mastermind, Head of Police, Media Mogul, Politician and Tech Entrepreneur) and associated Super Favour. Your Super Favour is a one time special ability that you can use to attack other players during the game. 

Players then take turns to build up their empire by setting up Ventures, attacking other players and making deals. At the end of the game, players count up Power from all Ventures, any Power bonuses and from their mountain of cash and declare a winner.

The recommended game length is 8 rounds, but you can easily play for more or less. 

The reversible turn guide
 

Rake in a "chicken feed" salary of £100k in your first turn which you can increase in following turns by setting up some Ventures.

 

Build your empire - Set up Ventures to give you a steady stream of income and to build up your Power.

Some Ventures have a white header bar with symbols, such as Jetsetter, and any Character can collect a set of these cards for extra Power at the end of the game. The number of symbols shows how many cards are in the set and the symbol shape shows you which set the card belongs to - in this case the airline set. 

Ventures - The building blocks of your empire

Make deals with other players - you can make any deal you like, apart from trading Power and Skeletons. Trading Ventures or Favours can be a good way to make friends, or you can consider threats and extortion to earn some extra cash...

Call in Favours - Call in Favours to attack your opponents or to give yourself a boost. Some Favours are illegal which will mean you gain an additional Skeleton in your closet...

Favours - Call them in to attack your enemies or boost yourself

 

Skeletons are a mixture of political, celebrity and business scandals and if uncovered will cause you to lose Power, cash or both.

Skeletons - Guard the Skeletons in your closet closely, it could cost you money and Power if they are uncovered...

Finally, top up your cards, sit back and wait for carnage to unfold as your carefully laid plans fall into place...

 

 

 

Every single Venture and Skeleton card is unique and there are 50 unique Favours.

 

Prototype components - Here is a board we mocked up and some cards we had printed in a factory in Italy

We've had amazing feedback from over one hundred playtests, including a large number of blind tests, public playtesting at the UK Games Expo and from reviewers we've sent copies of the game to. 

 

- @md_wheatley on Twitter and Instagram

Link to review

 


Luke, Jack and Marc from Muster joined us for a game at our launch event. Muster is the ultimate social & organisational app for all tabletop gamers. Check out their thoughts on Manipulate and the app in the link

Link to review

 

Link to review

 

Some of the comments we have had from friends and playtesters:

 

 

 

We will be shipping Manipulate from inside the EU and we currently plan to use GamesQuest to help us achieve this.

To reduce shipping costs, parcels will not be tracked. We estimate it will take items sent within the UK around 2-3 days to arrive from the date of posting. Items sent to Europe will take 3-5 days, and Rest of World 7-9 days. Some locations may take slightly longer.

Shipping for all our pledge levels is free for UK backers, and subsidised for backers anywhere else. Please make sure you enter your shipping address correctly.

Before we ship we will offer you the chance to double check your details and correct any errors before shipping begins.

 

As this is Walrus Ventures' first game we are more than happy to hear from retailers. If you are a retailer and would like to get in touch then please contact either josh@walrusventures.com or henry@walrusventures.com.

 

Hi everyone, we are Josh and Henry, the creators of Manipulate - two board game addicts who met 4 years ago whilst working together in London. We developed a healthy board game rivalry (Henry always wins) after moving in together, playing a huge range of board games but particularly enjoying the more competitive ones where our unscrupulous natures are allowed to come to the fore. When not gaming we're always sharing games ideas together, which is how Manipulate was born. 

The idea stemmed from Josh reading The Establishment by Owen Jones, and thinking about how the Media, Big Business and the Government are all in cahoots with each other and struggling for Power and influence. Originally just made as a bit of fun for us to play between us and our mates, we enjoyed it so much and the feedback was so good that we started to take it seriously and develop it into a marketable game. We thought that would take a few months - we've now been developing, testing and designing it for over two years! The game has changed and improved so much through countless play tests and blind tests, such as at the UK Games Expo in Birmingham where we got awesome feedback. 

We've hired Laura Payne to design it, who we think has done a fantastic job and finally have a prototype that we are really proud of and are incredibly excited to launch on Indiegogo! An absolute ton of hard work and effort has gone in to the game, as well as a lot of first hand experiences from living and working in London, and a lot of our sense of humour. We hope you love it as much as we do and really, really appreciate any support. Please feel free to share with your friends, family and on social media (and follow us on @manipulategame on any social media)!

Finally, we'd like to say a huge thank you to everyone who has helped in the development of the game - the friends and family who have playtested with us and helped us work through ideas. The guys at the UK games expo who tried out the game and gave us really helpful feedback. To Tom and his team for their stellar work on the video, and of course to Laura whose hard work, ideas and awesome design have really brought the game to life! 

Josh and Henry

 

Risks and challenges

This is our first game, which means it's an incredibly exciting feeling for us to be putting it out in front of the world. However it also poses certain risks and challenges which we've had to face and deal with. We've listed these below with how we have mitigated them, but if you have any further questions then please get in touch with either of us at josh@walrusventures.com or henry@walrusventures.com.

1) Risk - that our manufacturer will not be able to produce the game in the time required and to the standard expected.

Mitigation - to mitigate this we've done extensive research on the best supplier for us. We got in touch with people who have previously created games and asked their advice and recommendations, we requested samples from a host of suppliers, and we've done online research into all the companies we spoke to. In the end we met and partnered with Long Pack Games because we have had the best experience with them, they have a great reputation and are very confident that they can get the job done to the standards we expect. We'll be in touch if there are any delays to the project, but we're hoping there won't be any! Our estimated fulfilment date in December 2018 includes leeway, but delays outside our control may still occur. Our project updates will keep all backers notified.

2) Risk - that our distributor will not be able to distribute the game to the dates required / fully intact.

Mitigation - see Risk 1's mitigation. Again, we've taken the necessary time and effort to research distributors and make sure we're getting the right people for the job. We're going with Games Quest for their excellent reputation and a recommendation from one of our friends after his successful campaign

3) Risk - potential impact of Brexit on currency increasing our costs.

Mitigation - While any major swings in currency will impact our manufacturing costs, we are mitigating this by buying USD towards the end of our pitch, which we will then use to pay Long Pack Games. This should minimise our risk and mean that no matter what the politicians do, your copy of Manipulate is safe.
story_txt: Facebook | Instagram | Twitter | WebsiteLink to reviewPlease see the link for the full Manipulate Rule Book (please note these are the rules in their current form, there may be some tweaks to the final version).  Below is a very quick summary of how to play the game.While setting up the game, players pick or randomly draw a Character (Celebrity, Criminal Mastermind, Head of Police, Media Mogul, Politician and Tech Entrepreneur) and associated Super Favour. Your Super Favour is a one time special ability that you can use to attack other players during the game. Players then take turns to build up their empire by setting up Ventures, attacking other players and making deals. At the end of the game, players count up Power from all Ventures, any Power bonuses and from their mountain of cash and declare a winner.The recommended game length is 8 rounds, but you can easily play for more or less. The reversible turn guide Rake in a "chicken feed" salary of £100k in your first turn which you can increase in following turns by setting up some Ventures. Build your empire - Set up Ventures to give you a steady stream of income and to build up your Power.Some Ventures have a white header bar with symbols, such as Jetsetter, and any Character can collect a set of these cards for extra Power at the end of the game. The number of symbols shows how many cards are in the set and the symbol shape shows you which set the card belongs to - in this case the airline set. Ventures - The building blocks of your empireMake deals with other players - you can make any deal you like, apart from trading Power and Skeletons. Trading Ventures or Favours can be a good way to make friends, or you can consider threats and extortion to earn some extra cash...Call in Favours - Call in Favours to attack your opponents or to give yourself a boost. Some Favours are illegal which will mean you gain an additional Skeleton in your closet...Favours - Call them in to attack your enemies or boost yourself Skeletons are a mixture of political, celebrity and business scandals and if uncovered will cause you to lose Power, cash or both.Skeletons - Guard the Skeletons in your closet closely, it could cost you money and Power if they are uncovered...Finally, top up your cards, sit back and wait for carnage to unfold as your carefully laid plans fall into place...   Every single Venture and Skeleton card is unique and there are 50 unique Favours. Prototype components - Here is a board we mocked up and some cards we had printed in a factory in ItalyWe've had amazing feedback from over one hundred playtests, including a large number of blind tests, public playtesting at the UK Games Expo and from reviewers we've sent copies of the game to.  - @md_wheatley on Twitter and InstagramLink to review Luke, Jack and Marc from Muster joined us for a game at our launch event. Muster is the ultimate social & organisational app for all tabletop gamers. Check out their thoughts on Manipulate and the app in the linkLink to review Link to review Some of the comments we have had from friends and playtesters:   We will be shipping Manipulate from inside the EU and we currently plan to use GamesQuest to help us achieve this.To reduce shipping costs, parcels will not be tracked. We estimate it will take items sent within the UK around 2-3 days to arrive from the date of posting. Items sent to Europe will take 3-5 days, and Rest of World 7-9 days. Some locations may take slightly longer.Shipping for all our pledge levels is free for UK backers, and subsidised for backers anywhere else. Please make sure you enter your shipping address correctly.Before we ship we will offer you the chance to double check your details and correct any errors before shipping begins. As this is Walrus Ventures' first game we are more than happy to hear from retailers. If you are a retailer and would like to get in touch then please contact either josh@walrusventures.com or henry@walrusventures.com. Hi everyone, we are Josh and Henry, the creators of Manipulate - two board game addicts who met 4 years ago whilst working together in London. We developed a healthy board game rivalry (Henry always wins) after moving in together, playing a huge range of board games but particularly enjoying the more competitive ones where our unscrupulous natures are allowed to come to the fore. When not gaming we're always sharing games ideas together, which is how Manipulate was born. The idea stemmed from Josh reading The Establishment by Owen Jones, and thinking about how the Media, Big Business and the Government are all in cahoots with each other and struggling for Power and influence. Originally just made as a bit of fun for us to play between us and our mates, we enjoyed it so much and the feedback was so good that we started to take it seriously and develop it into a marketable game. We thought that would take a few months - we've now been developing, testing and designing it for over two years! The game has changed and improved so much through countless play tests and blind tests, such as at the UK Games Expo in Birmingham where we got awesome feedback. We've hired Laura Payne to design it, who we think has done a fantastic job and finally have a prototype that we are really proud of and are incredibly excited to launch on Indiegogo! An absolute ton of hard work and effort has gone in to the game, as well as a lot of first hand experiences from living and working in London, and a lot of our sense of humour. We hope you love it as much as we do and really, really appreciate any support. Please feel free to share with your friends, family and on social media (and follow us on @manipulategame on any social media)!Finally, we'd like to say a huge thank you to everyone who has helped in the development of the game - the friends and family who have playtested with us and helped us work through ideas. The guys at the UK games expo who tried out the game and gave us really helpful feedback. To Tom and his team for their stellar work on the video, and of course to Laura whose hard work, ideas and awesome design have really brought the game to life! Josh and Henry Risks and challengesThis is our first game, which means it's an incredibly exciting feeling for us to be putting it out in front of the world. However it also poses certain risks and challenges which we've had to face and deal with. We've listed these below with how we have mitigated them, but if you have any further questions then please get in touch with either of us at josh@walrusventures.com or henry@walrusventures.com.1) Risk - that our manufacturer will not be able to produce the game in the time required and to the standard expected.Mitigation - to mitigate this we've done extensive research on the best supplier for us. We got in touch with people who have previously created games and asked their advice and recommendations, we requested samples from a host of suppliers, and we've done online research into all the companies we spoke to. In the end we met and partnered with Long Pack Games because we have had the best experience with them, they have a great reputation and are very confident that they can get the job done to the standards we expect. We'll be in touch if there are any delays to the project, but we're hoping there won't be any! Our estimated fulfilment date in December 2018 includes leeway, but delays outside our control may still occur. Our project updates will keep all backers notified.2) Risk - that our distributor will not be able to distribute the game to the dates required / fully intact.Mitigation - see Risk 1's mitigation. Again, we've taken the necessary time and effort to research distributors and make sure we're getting the right people for the job. We're going with Games Quest for their excellent reputation and a recommendation from one of our friends after his successful campaign3) Risk - potential impact of Brexit on currency increasing our costs.Mitigation - While any major swings in currency will impact our manufacturing costs, we are mitigating this by buying USD towards the end of our pitch, which we will then use to pay Long Pack Games. This should minimise our risk and mean that no matter what the politicians do, your copy of Manipulate is safe.

story:
UPDATE - the very last Constellation Dice are available in the follow-up campaign launched on November 14th 2016 and ending on December 20th, featuring the constellations of the Southern Emisphere... and more! http://bit.ly/ConstellationDiceVoyagerEdition

"With a palmful of stars, I throw them like dice on the table...
I shake them like dice and throw them on the table, repeatedly
Until the desired constellation appears..."

Dedicated to the pioneers of astronomy and space exploration, inspired by the words of a song by Björk, this collector's dice will be unique. Will you help me?

I am an italian designer with many interests and a good working experience.
My plan is to produce these dice in limited quantities and close to factory cost.


Now available (only in bundle)!
Sky Blue Constellation Dice & Cloudy Night Dice

 

Let the Stars Guide Your Quests.

Since ancient times, the Constellations above us have been deemed responsible of a great part of men's destiny, and have been asked for guidance or blessings.

This Dice is embellished with some of the most ancient Constellations known to men, from a list compiled by the greek astronomer Ptolemy about 2000 years ago.

You may use this D6 Dice in any RPG game, from fantasy to science fiction.


Constellation Dice will shine a light on you.

 

Well, at least it will shine inside your hands, or on the table during an evening game.

Constellation Dice will be manufactured to the highest quality standards by a specialized company in Europe, in three distinct steps:

  • High Precision Laser Engraving, 1 mm deep (they will never wear out).
  • Hand Painting with luminescent pigments on a white background.
  • Quality control, to reject what is not up to standard, and keep the best.

This is an accurate and quite costly process, with a mandatory base lot of 50 dice.
My first goal is to cover production and shipping of those 50, or else... no dice.

One month and 75 backers later, from all over the world, the Stretch Goal has been finally reached..! Over €1900 from Indiegogo and €150 locally will allow the manufacturing of more than 500 Constellation and Cloudy Night Dice at a reduced cost, in both versions (night black and sky blue)!

Together we brought this little jewel on earth. Let your friends know!

 

 

 

 

The Stars of Your Party. What's on the faces?

 

Each face has been accurately designed to be recognizable, inspiring, and unique.

  1. Polaris is the North Star, around which all the Constellations revolve.
  2. Canis Minor is the only ancient Constellation comprised of just two stars.
  3. Triangulum Constellation was first described by Babylonians around 1000 B.C.
  4. Corvus' brightest stars form a distinctive quadrilateral in the night sky.
  5. Cassiopeia is the iconic pattern named after a greek Queen of great beauty.
  6. Corona Borealis, whose six brightest stars form a shiny crown.

 

 

Timing and Expectations


I have experience in designing and distributing promotional items in the hundreds.
This is a quite simple project that I have deeply researched, to find the best path from ideation to completion. It should take a couple months for the dice to be manufactured, and another month to be shipped. 

If the stars are benevolent, you will receive your Constellation Dice in September!

 

I am at your disposal for any further information you may need... Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Devil's Staircase Wild West is a fast, fun wild west roleplaying game played using poker cards. Rather than rolling a die and random chance  of high or low results, in this game you have a hand of cards and play the one that hits the goal. You will know when you are down to just a pair of 2s. Realistic it isn't, fun it most certainly is.

Character creation is as fast as being dealt a hand of cards and deciding what brought you out west.

Devil's Staircase is the diceless roleplaying game engine best suited to genres where gambling and poker were prevalent, the Wild West is the first game to use the engine.

What We Need & What You Get

The game is complete. It featured as a playtest on DriveThruRPG.com for a year and was downloaded 385 times and a companion supplement was downloaded 275 times. Since the end of the playtest the Quickstart pdf booklet has been downloaded a further 15 times in the past couple of weeks.

The development is all paid for and the game is ready to go. This campaign is all about reimbursing the costs involved in having the setting chapters professionally written by Neal Lithland and about funding more expansions and adventures. There is a lot of interest in Weird West and that would make a great follow up supplement.

Everyone who pledges, even $1, will get the full game text as a PDF and their name in the book as a backer. The pledges get bigger so do the rewards.

The Impact

The funding target for this campaign is just £500 which is minimum allowed by IndieGoGo. Even if the game does not reach that target every pledge level will be met. £500 meets the expenses already paid out and allows for future marketing

In the future I would like to write a 1920s prohibition era game using the same game engine and a First World War Aces High rpg. Both of these I think will suit the poker style play. A successful campaign here would be a great motivator to write those other games.

Risks & Challenges

This is an exceptionally low risk project. Everything bar the print on demand proof copies has already been bought and paid for by me.

Fulfillment will be by OneBookShelp and DriveThruRPG.com. PDF documents will be send directly to backers within 2 weeks of the end the the campaign, to allow time to add the names to the PDF and for IndieGoGo to do their part. Printed books will be fulfilled by sending out at cost coupons, you only have to pay post and packaging.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please help raise awareness of the game and this campaign by sharing the link http://bit.ly/DSWW-Igg
  • You can also use the built in IngieGoGo sharing tools.

story:
Welcome to the 28th volume of Dimgaard's DnD adventures.

This video gives more detail about the episodes of Patron Wars and Encounters with Gold in Vol. XXVIII: https://youtu.be/Ysui5rdiHSQ

Thanks for the consideration. These are PDFs delivered through our proprietary document management system. If you want to see what a Dimgaard adventure module looks like, samples of the opening chapters in the two current campaigns (Patron Wars and Encounters with Gold) are available at http://www.dimgaard.com – as well as other information about the Dimgaard setting – including other free modules from past campaigns.

We would note the six principles that Dimgaard builds its adventures around (each of which is elaborated on at www.dimgaard.com):  

  • A strong story.   
  • Strict adherence to Rules As Written (RAW). 
  • Largest set of player options. 
  • Challenge PCs at all levels of play. 
  • Low DM prep time. 
  • Easy presentation.

There are two 21–chapter Dimgaard campaigns currently in play. Encounters with Gold explores the dragonkin culture in Dimgaard. And the Patron Wars brings the Blood War to Dimgaard.

As a useful supplement in the examination of the dragonkin, the next installment in the scaling of monsters from CR0-20 takes a look at dragonborn with GLD30 Dragonborn CR0-20. The other supplement reward is another expansion of the NPC galleries that are useful in many campaigns beyond Dimgaard with DGN5 NPCs Vol. V.

Here are the summary statements for the seven modules offered:

Encounters with Gold

EG18 The Draconic Caliph. Dedicated to the god/wyrm Rugarth, dragonkin have seized control of a large swath of southern Dimgaard as a religious state. Faced with a new racial order with dragonkin subjugating all other races – including humans – the entire region is on the verge of a devastating sectarian war. Can heroes avoid a horrific conflagration? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 18th level characters. Episode 18 in Encounters with Gold.

EG19 The Draconic Capitol. A wide-ranging race/sectarian conflict between the One True Faith and the Dragon Cabal has brought all Dimgaard to the verge of disaster. But diffusing the violence requires a mission deep into the homeland of the great gold wyrm Rugarth. Can heroes penetrate this hostile realm? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 19th level characters. Episode 19 in Encounters with Gold.

EG20 The Dragon Archon.  In Auricholm, the capitol of the organization led by and supporting the great gold wyrm Rugarth, his desires are conveyed via his Archon. But access to the Archon is strictly controlled, and there are vested interests in Auricholm that would suffer if the militarism of the organization subsided. Can heroes gain access to the Archon and convince him against war and conquest? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 20th level characters. Episode 20 of Encounters with Gold.

EG21 The Great Gold Wyrm. All may not be as it seems with the godlike great gold wyrm Rugarth. There may be a reason why a gold dragon turns from benevolence to warmongering. Can heroes learn the truth about the great gold wyrm and realign his attitude? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 20th level characters. Episode 21 of Encounters with Gold.

Patron Wars

PW8 Celestial Patrons. While the insinuation of the River Styx into Dimgaard has already drawn the attention of powerful entities from the Abyss and Baator, there are other forces in the cosmos with interests in the activities of fiends. Their influence could undermine the structure in place to protect innocents from the violence of the conflict between devils and fiends. Can heroes find a way to integrate these forces into a productive defense? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 8th level characters. Episode 8 in the Patron Wars.

PW9 Patron Animosity. Already plagued with continuous violence as fiendish forces clash, the arrival of new elements threatens to push the region into a devastating, escalating sectarian war. Every incident has the potential to destroy the fragile framework of protection for the downtrodden and innocent. Can heroes address the flashpoints and keep the defenses effective? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 9th level characters. Episode 9 in the Patron Wars.

PW10 Patron Alliances. The Dimgaard breach of the River Styx has produced an almost never-seen situation. Because of the strong influence of the defenders, members of groups that historically did not pause from attacking each other have the opportunity to find common goals and negotiate aligned strategies – but these powerful alliances could present a danger by destabilizing the delicate defense framework. Can heroes manage these emerging coalitions in a way to protect the innocent? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 10th level characters. Episode 10 in the Patron Wars.

Can heroes manage these emerging coalitions in a way to protect the innocent? A Dungeons and Dragons® 5th Edition Adventure for 1-8 10th level characters. Episode 10 in the Patron Wars.

story:
The FirstBlood F18 has taken the latest advancements in wireless technology to engineer a first-of-its-kind high-performance gaming mouse system. Utilizing our proprietary InSync system, the F18 is an integrative wireless mouse and mousepad solution that is always communicating with each other to provide a seamless user experience. 

With continuous wireless charging and synchronization through the mousepad, you will never have to worry about lag, transmission dropouts, or battery loss. By reducing the transmission distance to nearly zero, you can experience an unparalleled gaming experience that is lightning fast, precise, fully responsive, and comfortable. The future of PC gaming is here. 

 

 

The newest Ford PowerFlow wireless charging technology ensures the endless charging while playing.

 

FirstBlood invented its own proprietary fast wireless charging technology to deliver the ultimate high-performance wireless gaming experience. Unlike most of the existing wireless charging technologies, the F18 doesn’t require the mouse to sit steadily while charging. With the independently developed wireless charging chipset, the mousepad itself becomes a controllable electromagnetic field to achieve wireless transmission to the mouse. Thus, the mouse can be charged even when it is in play. No cables, no more battery replacements, no more fuss. Your victories alone charge the F18.

Designed as a professional gaming mouse, the FirstBlood F18 is fully versatile, with powerful PAW3338 lightspeed sensor, configurable DPI, transmission rate, and handling. With the freedom to switch between 800, 1200, 1600, 2400, 3200 and up to 16000 DPI’s, you’ll always be ready to make your striking move. With a transmission rate of 1,000 Hz (1 ms) and the 40G acceleration, you can rest assured that the lightspeed F18 will always keep you ahead. 

 

The FirstBlood F18 is among the fastest wireless mouse systems currently available, even beating speeds of wired gaming mice.

Now, you can enjoy the total freedom of a wireless system without any compromises. And with Continuous Charge, you will never have to plug the F18 in or change its batteries. It’s your game, no restrictions.  The F18 can be utilized both as a wired or wireless system. While you can rest assured in the precision and speed in both modes, the flexibility means the F18 can be used with virtually any computer system.

 

The FirstBlood F18 InSync system utilizes Continuous Charge to make sure your mouse is fully charged at every moment with its built-in super-condenser and fast charge capability. With a charge cycle life of 500,000 full charges, you can rest assured your battery performance will be uncompromised for many many years ahead. 

The advantage of InSync goes further, making the mousepad itself the transmission source, bringing the connection as close as possible to the mouse for the fastest and most reliable connection.

 

Simply take out the receiver and insert it into the USB port of a computer and turn the power switch to ON and wait 3 to 5 seconds to use (depends on how long the computer reads the receiver)

Traditional lithium batteries generate electricity through a chemical reaction between the electrolysis and the electrodes, so it takes time to charge. After repeated charging and discharging, the electrolytes gradually decompose and need to be replaced after several years of use. Supercapacitors do not produce chemical reactions and can store electricity directly. Not only does the charging time significantly decrease, but also a large amount of current can be released instantly. The charging and discharging can be repeated 500,000 full cycles, which is 100 times that of ordinary lithium batteries, so it essentially will never have to be replaced in your lifetime.

 

Wireless charging continues to provide surging power, but by utilizing our InSync system, the charging process never interferes with the high-precision performance of the mouse. The floating height is 50mm from the charging base, so you do not need to worry about the use of the mouse when it is raised. This is safe, powerful, and efficient wireless charging.

 

Separable and convenient double-sided mouse pad! The mouse pad has a detachable structure, a waterproof surface design, and a hard + fine-grained dual surfaces. Now you can choose your desired tactile feel for the mousepad surface. Simply use the pull tab and you can immediately convert your mousepad experience.

 

Tune your performance with your choice of mousepad surfaces. We include hard pads so you can customize and swap interchangeably. Hard surface + fine texture waterproof mouse pad now allows double-sided use, and help fine-tune your precision.
story_txt: The FirstBlood F18 has taken the latest advancements in wireless technology to engineer a first-of-its-kind high-performance gaming mouse system. Utilizing our proprietary InSync system, the F18 is an integrative wireless mouse and mousepad solution that is always communicating with each other to provide a seamless user experience. With continuous wireless charging and synchronization through the mousepad, you will never have to worry about lag, transmission dropouts, or battery loss. By reducing the transmission distance to nearly zero, you can experience an unparalleled gaming experience that is lightning fast, precise, fully responsive, and comfortable. The future of PC gaming is here.   The newest Ford PowerFlow wireless charging technology ensures the endless charging while playing. FirstBlood invented its own proprietary fast wireless charging technology to deliver the ultimate high-performance wireless gaming experience. Unlike most of the existing wireless charging technologies, the F18 doesn’t require the mouse to sit steadily while charging. With the independently developed wireless charging chipset, the mousepad itself becomes a controllable electromagnetic field to achieve wireless transmission to the mouse. Thus, the mouse can be charged even when it is in play. No cables, no more battery replacements, no more fuss. Your victories alone charge the F18.Designed as a professional gaming mouse, the FirstBlood F18 is fully versatile, with powerful PAW3338 lightspeed sensor, configurable DPI, transmission rate, and handling. With the freedom to switch between 800, 1200, 1600, 2400, 3200 and up to 16000 DPI’s, you’ll always be ready to make your striking move. With a transmission rate of 1,000 Hz (1 ms) and the 40G acceleration, you can rest assured that the lightspeed F18 will always keep you ahead.  The FirstBlood F18 is among the fastest wireless mouse systems currently available, even beating speeds of wired gaming mice.Now, you can enjoy the total freedom of a wireless system without any compromises. And with Continuous Charge, you will never have to plug the F18 in or change its batteries. It’s your game, no restrictions.  The F18 can be utilized both as a wired or wireless system. While you can rest assured in the precision and speed in both modes, the flexibility means the F18 can be used with virtually any computer system. The FirstBlood F18 InSync system utilizes Continuous Charge to make sure your mouse is fully charged at every moment with its built-in super-condenser and fast charge capability. With a charge cycle life of 500,000 full charges, you can rest assured your battery performance will be uncompromised for many many years ahead. The advantage of InSync goes further, making the mousepad itself the transmission source, bringing the connection as close as possible to the mouse for the fastest and most reliable connection. Simply take out the receiver and insert it into the USB port of a computer and turn the power switch to ON and wait 3 to 5 seconds to use (depends on how long the computer reads the receiver)Traditional lithium batteries generate electricity through a chemical reaction between the electrolysis and the electrodes, so it takes time to charge. After repeated charging and discharging, the electrolytes gradually decompose and need to be replaced after several years of use. Supercapacitors do not produce chemical reactions and can store electricity directly. Not only does the charging time significantly decrease, but also a large amount of current can be released instantly. The charging and discharging can be repeated 500,000 full cycles, which is 100 times that of ordinary lithium batteries, so it essentially will never have to be replaced in your lifetime. Wireless charging continues to provide surging power, but by utilizing our InSync system, the charging process never interferes with the high-precision performance of the mouse. The floating height is 50mm from the charging base, so you do not need to worry about the use of the mouse when it is raised. This is safe, powerful, and efficient wireless charging. Separable and convenient double-sided mouse pad! The mouse pad has a detachable structure, a waterproof surface design, and a hard + fine-grained dual surfaces. Now you can choose your desired tactile feel for the mousepad surface. Simply use the pull tab and you can immediately convert your mousepad experience. Tune your performance with your choice of mousepad surfaces. We include hard pads so you can customize and swap interchangeably. Hard surface + fine texture waterproof mouse pad now allows double-sided use, and help fine-tune your precision.

story:
• Q: Does the Gyro only come in three colours?
  • A: At present these are the only colours we provide. Should popularity rise during this In-Demand campaign, more may be considered. 
  • Q: How much does shipping cost and where do you ship?
  • A: We offer Free Shipping across the world, regardless of where you are.
 
  • Q: How do I give you my address and colours?
  • A: You can provide all this info to us 11 days after pledging using a free service called BackerKit. They’ll email you at the time to your Indiegogo email to collect these details.
 
  • Q: How much warranty do we get?
  • A: You get a one year warranty on all your Gyros.
 
  • Q: How can we contact you if we have any questions?
  • A: You may contact us through any of the below and we'll aim to get back to you within the hour (We're in GMT):
  • Indiegogo messages - (if you’re a backer)
  • Indiegogo comments - (if you’re a backer)
  • By email at: support (at) MalboroKane (dot) com
story_txt:
Q: Does the Gyro only come in three colours?
A: At present these are the only colours we provide. Should popularity rise during this In-Demand campaign, more may be considered. 


Q: How much does shipping cost and where do you ship?
A: We offer Free Shipping across the world, regardless of where you are.
 
Q: How do I give you my address and colours?
A: You can provide all this info to us 11 days after pledging using a free service called BackerKit. They’ll email you at the time to your Indiegogo email to collect these details.
 
Q: How much warranty do we get?
A: You get a one year warranty on all your Gyros.
 
Q: How can we contact you if we have any questions?
A: You may contact us through any of the below and we'll aim to get back to you within the hour (We're in GMT):
Indiegogo messages - (if you’re a backer)
Indiegogo comments - (if you’re a backer)
By email at: support (at) MalboroKane (dot) com


Risks and challenges
We’re a four-time creator with three campaigns under our belt. Through our last couple of campaigns for the Claw and Sub on Kickstarter and Indiegogo, we’ve had the support of over 7000+ backers raising over $270,000 in total.
Progressing on to our site at MalboroKane.com, we went on to ship over 65,000 Claws to many thousands of happy customers, so we know how to get your spinner to you exactly how you want it.
In order to ensure complete transparency, the samples you can see are final production samples which is exactly how yours will be made.
We've done many months of prototyping to make sure that the final spinning top is perfectly weighted, polished and perfected so you get only the best from us. Some projects can come with delays, so we’ve made every effort to reduce them by preparing in advance for everything we need and getting ready for every scenario with backup manufacturers who have the exact same quality we see on the campaign.
We know you guys have a lot of questions so we'll keep an open line of communication with you all through the comments section and occasional updates to let you know where we are at every point.

story:
Our community loves playing tabletop fantasy football, even when the dice, and the opposition, kick us in the teeth. The ups, downs, elation and despair are what have always drawn me to the game. I revel in the dark underbelly of the setting - the blood, guts and treachery that counterpoint the simple task of carrying the ball to the end zone.

The Indiegogo campaign I present to you today captures, distils and refines these emotions into physical form. The campaign aims to raise enough funds to produce some incredibly high-quality coins and tokens for use with your favourite fantasy football game.

Let's take a walk on the dark side as we peruse in more detail the deadly delights of the art of corruption…

The coins and tokens for this for this project will be produced in a zinc alloy, which is then die stamped into the shape required and finished with hard coloured enamel. Ready to play with from the box and, within reason, indestructible, you'll be able to enjoy these items for many, many years to come.

As every game gives you the opportunity to foul, carry the ball, argue with the ref and of course flip for kick-off think of these less as accessories than as vital game aids alongside the scatter template or range ruler. Bribes too are a huge part of the game whether from inducements or just getting lucky at the kick-off!

The ball. For some of us it’s the be-all and end-all of the game. For others it simply gets in the way of a good punch-up. Nevertheless, it’s important that we know where the ball is at any given point in the match. This token has been designed to fit easily around your player's base, be that 25mm or 32mm in size. Moreover, with its cunningly designed shape, it fits snugly into the most crowded of cages or scraps. If the ball is loose on the pitch, simply flip the token to indicate it's up for grabs. Never again will you forget who’s holding the ball (and scrag them). 

Being the coach of a fantasy football team is a difficult and frequently violently curtailed career choice. Some are better than others at dealing with the stresses of coaching a team, prowling the side-lines barking orders and questioning the calls and parentage of the referee. Sometimes they go a little too far…

Assuming all's well, this coach coin shows your head coach where they belong, in the dugout. Should they go too far and have to be removed from the game just for politely suggesting at knifepoint that the ref lets their poor little chainsaw back on the pitch then simply turn this coin over to show your coach has left the dugout. With any luck, they'll recover from their 'security escort' in time for the next match…

Fouling is a fantastic part of the fantasy football world. There is no greater feeling than having a no-name lineman suddenly become the hero after booting a fallen star player to death! In the excitement of the match we sometimes forget if and who has performed a foul action. Not anymore! This handy token slips over your player's base to show they have completed the foul action. Should the player in question be ejected from the field after attracting the attention of the referee then simply turn this token over to identify this player as caught and remove to the dugout.

WARNING! Use of this token in the last turns of the game may lose you friends. Charlie Victor Products does not accept liability for loss of limbs, life or rides home in such circumstances.

Bribery! Such a wonderful thing. If you have deep enough pockets you can really gain an advantage with these. Foul to your heart's content, safe in the knowledge that you can just pay off the referee should they have the temerity to try to enforce the rules. Careful though, referees can be greedy bastards and you may need more than one to convince them to look the other way. Spend these valuable coins wisely. You can track your spending by turning each one over after use. The bloody tears on the reverse side of each coin will be a dead giveaway as to its status. Try not to roll too many ones…

Nobody and I mean NOBODY bribes as hard as Goblins do. They are masters at it, which is just as well as they're terrible at everything else. They work hard to subvert the rules, so much so that the little buggers stole the original bribe coin stamps and produced their own versions, with some very dubious amendments! They have even tried to dodge showing if they have used them at all - very sneaky stuff the gits! Never fear though, because the bloody tears reverse side always gives away the status of the bribe. 

Charlie Victor is very proud to present this special kick-off coin. Every game of fantasy football starts with a kick-off. The referee flips the coin after a coach has picked a side. Heads or Tentacles? There are old stories of coaches rolling dice to see who kicks and receives. Well, no more!

We at Charlie Victor are very proud of this coin, confident that it is at least the equal of any fantasy football community produced coin in existence. A quality item for a momentous choice - kick or receive?

This Limited Edition of the Kick-Off Coin will be produced in a Black Dye Metal finish with Coloured Soft Enamel, ONLY 100 units will ever be produced making this the most collectable coin in the campaign.

One of my duties as Commissioner of the Leicester Blood Bowl League is to attract and retain Blood Bowl Coaches from all over the shire of Leicester and beyond. To achieve this, each coach that takes part in and completes a league season with us is presented with a 'loot' item. Previously we’ve had unique dog tags, poker chips, dice bags and, in Season III, the set of high quality bribe coins that you see below. These went down very well and the spare sets that I did have (due to a minimum order amount of 100) sold very quickly to overseas collectors.

Inspired by the success of these coins I’ve always wanted to reproduce them for the community at large. This naturally led me to produce a new campaign celebrating the glorious corruption of fantasy football and all the awesome shenanigans that go with it.

As with my previous project for the Casualty Dice, this project will also include Stretch Goal Inducement Cards. These have proven to be very popular indeed, and as a result I’m excited to announce that there will be more cards in this project, created at the same size as before and by the same artist Rob Parham, so, for anyone who already has a set from the original project, these new cards will fit seamlessly into your deck. If you don't have a set of cards from the Casualty Dice project then never fear, you can now buy a set of Casualty Dice and Cards as an Add On to your pledge to this campaign.

These cards will be two very different wizards for use in your matches. Never again will you ever forget to zap that ball carrier or firebomb a cage in the second half.

Next up is a High Quality Embroidered Patch for the 'FAS' - the Foul Appreciation Society! This patch will be produced to a high standard and come with an iron on material on the reverse. I plan to slap mine onto my favourite shirt and show the world just how foul I am.

Introducing, Fouling Dice. As anyone who backed the Casualty Dice project will know, I’m a bit of a dice fanatic! I LOVE dice. I could not do a campaign that does not include them, so here we have the ‘Armour & Blood Dice’ A special set of D6 with all sides engraved with some pretty brutal foul manoeuvres. Each side will also detail the number equivalent to the foul performed, so that calculations can be made after rolling. Be careful though, should you happen to perform two of the same manoeuvre on the downed player the referee is bound to notice and may eject you from the game. Don’t worry though, your coach I’m sure will argue your case and everything will be just fine!

This assistant can be used to help your coach and their dodgy dealings during the match. Careful though, if you push too hard, your coach and assistant can both face the consequences!

It's important to note which Perks include which Stretch Goals. Please take careful note of the graph above to clarify which Stretch Goals you will receive with your Perk. Any addition items you order (instructions below) will also come with the relevant Stretch Goal items included.

Back by popular demand are my Casualty Dice from my first Indiegogo Campaign. You can now order yourself a set(s) of Casualty Dice as an Add-On to any of the Perks you have back on this project. Once you have backed a Perk, please then follow the instructions further down this page to see how to order Add-On's or extra items from the campaign. Remember, cards from both campaigns will seamlessly fit together as they are designed to the same specification.

Add the regular Kick-Off Coin to your Limited Edition Corruption Pack purchase, completing the set! NOTE: This Add On is ONLY available to backers who have backed the 'Limited Edition Corruption Pack' Once you have backed the Limited Edition Corruption Pack, please then follow the instructions further down this page to see how to order this Add-On.

My name is Duncan; I’m a 38-year-old self-employed designer with 20+ years of industry experience, living in Leicester, UK. I’m also the founder and current Commissioner of the Leicester Blood Bowl League (LBBL).

As a designer and design fanatic I have a good feel for what good design should look like and how it should perform. My first dice project was to produce my very own Block Dice; I wanted to pour my creativity into something other than my day-to-day job. I produced around 100 sets of Block Dice and have successfully shared these with Blood Bowl leagues and fellow fanatics around the world. This led me to launch an Indiegogo Campaign for my Casualty Dice which successfully funded in under 24hrs and went on to raise 946% of the original goal. The link for the project can be found here:

Charlie Victors Casualty Dice

I just love to produce design, no matter how small or large the idea. I get a real kick out of seeing people using products I have created, and this is where I hope you, the community can come in and help my vision for these Coins of Corruption to become a reality. Here is a selection of my previous creative work, some of which you may recognise. 

Congratulations! You're well on your way to awesome levels of corruption! Don't worry, your desire to save money on shipping is celebrated here! The first step is to order your first Perk which will include your shipping fee and create an order number in the Indiegogo backend. To be eligible for no extra shipping charges on multiple perks or Add-Ons, your first perk ordered must be the 'The Bribe Coins Pack' or any Perk above that tier. These perks are Tracked & Signed Delivery and most importantly have insurance to cover loss or damage of all items.  This can be done by clicking the 'Get This Perk' button that sits on the Perks box. The next step is to order the extra Perks and/or Add-ons you’d like. To do this you need to use the ‘BACK IT’ button that sits above the Perks and below the Campaign Progress Bar on the right-hand side of the campaign web page, shown here:

When you click ‘Back It’ it will ask for a ‘Donation Amount’. Here you need to add a figure that covers your requirement. So, for example, if you’ve ordered the ‘Absolute Corruption Pack’ but also require two extra sets of Bribe Coins for a couple of friends, you would enter £18 x the number of Bribe Coins Sets you require, in this case, two. That would make an extra donation amount of £36 and cover the extra Perks required. Of perhaps you'd like some freaking awesome Casualty Dice, just add an extra donation of £14 etc. 

Once you’ve made that Donation, take a look at your original ABSOLUTE CORRUPTION PACK (or whatever it is you ordered) order details in your Indiegogo page. Take note of your ‘Order ID’ (a two or three-digit number). Once you have that number you can then use the Contact Button to send me a message. Here you will be able tell me your original Order ID and what you would like to order as extra items and/or Add-ons. It’s VERY important that those details are given to me, so I can compile your order and ship to you on time at no extra cost. Any extra items that are ordered this way will also include any stretch goals that are available to them.

If you have any problems during the process of adding to your original order, please do not hesitate to contact me via this website, Facebook, Twitter or email me at charlievictorproducts@gmail.com - I’m here to help.

This project does not aim to break any technological bounds nor does it pretend to be anything other than an opportunity for me to bring my design ideas to life, and for you in the community to have fun with them. It’s in my nature to share and I very much want to share this with you.

I’m deliberately using die stamping and hard enamel because, despite it being more expensive, it’s by far the best quality finish and has an increased longevity over any other type of production process.

Backers can choose from eleven different Perks. Ranging from just £16 all the way up to £54. As with my previous project I always want to keep the barrier to entry as low as possible, while offering the high end of the Perk levels to those who wish to have a complete collection.

All coin designs featured here in 2D & 3D are for visual purposes only and could be subject to small changes. Some small details can be lost in the process of stamping, so, for an accurate feel for detail and finish on these coins, please reference the LBBL Bribe Coins pictured above.

I like to think I’m a trusted member of the Fantasy Football Community and I value that trust immensely. I responsibly manage the finances of the LBBL and have previously produced and delivered to hundreds of backers around the world my Casualty Dice Project. I have produced a similar product in the past so I’m very confident in completing this project to the standard I’ve seen before. I think the point I’m trying to make is you can trust in me to deliver this project to you, my reputation depends on it.

There is not really much in terms of challenges that haven’t already been overcome. I have the designs completed and prototyped and I’m using a trusted producer that can produce the quantities we might need. I’ve been designing products for many years so understand the challenges of shipping products across the world. I’m 100% confident that I’m equipped to deliver this project. 

I aim to ship this project to Backers around October 2018.

Please consider backing this project and spread the word to as many people as you can. After the Casualty Dice project closed I had many people message me wanting to have a set of dice. It’s great to have these people come forward, even better if this back the project in the first instance. If however you choose not to back this project then please feel free to share this project with people you think would like to get involved. This support would be very much appreciated and could make all the difference.

Thank you for taking the time to read my pitch, and I hope you choose to help me succeed on this passion project of mine. Should you have any questions please do not hesitate to ask; I'll be ready and waiting to answer them.

Cheers!
Duncan
