The first step is to order your first Perk which will include your shipping fee and create an order number in the Indiegogo backend. To be eligible for no extra shipping charges on multiple perks or Add-Ons, your first perk ordered must be the 'The Bribe Coins Pack' or any Perk above that tier. These perks are Tracked & Signed Delivery and most importantly have insurance to cover loss or damage of all items.  This can be done by clicking the 'Get This Perk' button that sits on the Perks box. The next step is to order the extra Perks and/or Add-ons you’d like. To do this you need to use the ‘BACK IT’ button that sits above the Perks and below the Campaign Progress Bar on the right-hand side of the campaign web page, shown here:When you click ‘Back It’ it will ask for a ‘Donation Amount’. Here you need to add a figure that covers your requirement. So, for example, if you’ve ordered the ‘Absolute Corruption Pack’ but also require two extra sets of Bribe Coins for a couple of friends, you would enter £18 x the number of Bribe Coins Sets you require, in this case, two. That would make an extra donation amount of £36 and cover the extra Perks required. Of perhaps you'd like some freaking awesome Casualty Dice, just add an extra donation of £14 etc. Once you’ve made that Donation, take a look at your original ABSOLUTE CORRUPTION PACK (or whatever it is you ordered) order details in your Indiegogo page. Take note of your ‘Order ID’ (a two or three-digit number). Once you have that number you can then use the Contact Button to send me a message. Here you will be able tell me your original Order ID and what you would like to order as extra items and/or Add-ons. It’s VERY important that those details are given to me, so I can compile your order and ship to you on time at no extra cost. Any extra items that are ordered this way will also include any stretch goals that are available to them.If you have any problems during the process of adding to your original order, please do not hesitate to contact me via this website, Facebook, Twitter or email me at charlievictorproducts@gmail.com - I’m here to help.This project does not aim to break any technological bounds nor does it pretend to be anything other than an opportunity for me to bring my design ideas to life, and for you in the community to have fun with them. It’s in my nature to share and I very much want to share this with you.I’m deliberately using die stamping and hard enamel because, despite it being more expensive, it’s by far the best quality finish and has an increased longevity over any other type of production process.Backers can choose from eleven different Perks. Ranging from just £16 all the way up to £54. As with my previous project I always want to keep the barrier to entry as low as possible, while offering the high end of the Perk levels to those who wish to have a complete collection.All coin designs featured here in 2D & 3D are for visual purposes only and could be subject to small changes. Some small details can be lost in the process of stamping, so, for an accurate feel for detail and finish on these coins, please reference the LBBL Bribe Coins pictured above.I like to think I’m a trusted member of the Fantasy Football Community and I value that trust immensely. I responsibly manage the finances of the LBBL and have previously produced and delivered to hundreds of backers around the world my Casualty Dice Project. I have produced a similar product in the past so I’m very confident in completing this project to the standard I’ve seen before. I think the point I’m trying to make is you can trust in me to deliver this project to you, my reputation depends on it.There is not really much in terms of challenges that haven’t already been overcome. I have the designs completed and prototyped and I’m using a trusted producer that can produce the quantities we might need. I’ve been designing products for many years so understand the challenges of shipping products across the world. I’m 100% confident that I’m equipped to deliver this project. I aim to ship this project to Backers around October 2018.Please consider backing this project and spread the word to as many people as you can. After the Casualty Dice project closed I had many people message me wanting to have a set of dice. It’s great to have these people come forward, even better if this back the project in the first instance. If however you choose not to back this project then please feel free to share this project with people you think would like to get involved. This support would be very much appreciated and could make all the difference.Thank you for taking the time to read my pitch, and I hope you choose to help me succeed on this passion project of mine. Should you have any questions please do not hesitate to ask; I'll be ready and waiting to answer them.Cheers!Duncan

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Kenechukwu Ogbuagu. I am a 24 years old boardgame designer and publisher. I have just recently been approved as a boardgame designer on Boardgame Geek. Since 2013 when I first designed a game on a paper, I have gone on to publish 7 games and sold over 2500 games in the first 6 months.

 

In my desire to  promote a Tabletop gaming culture in Nigeria (a country with the highest population in Africa), I have organised what was termed 'arguably the first boardgame convention in West Africa by Nigerians National Television Authority) and organised over a dozen gaming activities since 2016.

Organizing convention and activities - which have all been free - comes from this thirst to introduce people to boardgaming and break the stereotypes about general tabletop gaming in Nigeria and other part of Africa.

"Do you know most Nigerian parents wouldn't want their children playing cards because they think it’s only for gambling? Oh yes!"

"Do you know that most Nigerians do not know there are more than 7 boardgames in the world? This cracks me up when I see the look on their faces as I tell them there are literally millions of games".

African Boardgame Convention was conceived to meet this challenge as well as build a community of gamers, designers, artist, illustrators and other people who are interested in the Tabletop gaming community/culture. It's also an opportunity to introduce new games to people - games they wouldn't have otherwise known.

This years edition is the 2nd and will hold;

Date: September 17, 2017

Location: Abuja, Nigeria

Time: 9:00am - 9:00pm

Since 2013 (actively from 2015), I have done a lot with the help of few individuals and a wonderful team to bring this alive which has gotten international and local press recognition and increased the interest of gaming however, I deeply need your assistance to create a better experience.

This year, we are organizing a 12 HOURS OF NON STOP GAMING - the first of its kind within the sub-Saharan region of Africa. And we intend to make it FREE.

Your donations will go a long way to help this second edition not only successful but create better and more memorable experience as well as rewarding to what each of us believe in - building relationships, connecting people, sharing in stories and narratives presented in each game.

Your donation will help turn Mundane to Gamers.

To ensure sustainability, we are already putting measures in place to be able to organize subsequent events without running a crowdfund campaign. One is a deal with one of Nigerian's leading brand however, they are insisting on seeing what this years would look like before making this commitment.

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for 3000$  (current exchange rate in 1$ = 309 Naira) and here is what am going to use it for;

Location (includes Hall space, and hiring of tables, chair and sound) = 800$ (This is relatively cheap as we have built a relationship with IBI event centers, Box Office, Wuse 2, Abuja)

Logistics (travels, communications, meetings,) = 500$

Creating awareness and Media (Print media, Radio and TV awareness tour & online media) = 750 $ (The reason for allocating this amount is because, Nigeria has an almost zero boardgame community. It would require a lot of constant campaigns to get attraction and also, most Nigerians are not social media inclined).

Personnel and volunteers cost (1 event planner, 10 Volunteer Game tutors) = 300$

Free promotional games = 300$ (We will be donating these games at production cost ) 

Photography and Video Making: 200$

Miscellaneous = 150$

PERKS

The truth is I have thought a lot about the perk to offer especially as I have nothing to ship. This is what I have come up with.

  1. 10$ - Thank you sooo much. We would acknowledge you at the end of our documentary video.
  2. 20$ - We would acknowledge you on our event brochure as well as video
  3. 50$ - We will name one of our tables during the event after you as well as the above mentioned
  4. 100$ - We will name one of our 6 game booths after you plus the perk of 10$ & 20$
  5. 500$ - We are naming the only competition during the event after you. Including being the signatory on the award(s) presented.

The Impact

Every day, I see many games and miniatures and videos about table top games; much more I see the joy and the relationship that are shared and built. And I want to be part of it and I want many people in my country, in Africa to be part of it.

THIS YEAR, YOU WILL HELP US REACH OUT TO 1000 AUDIENCE IN A 12 HOURS NON STOP GAMING EXPERIENCE.

I also want people from other part of the world to be part of African themed games too. OMG! They are soooo nice and exciting and engaging and thrilling and am so certain you would enjoy it.

But for all this to happen, your help is not only needed but very important and like i said, I will never be able to do this alone. I need your help

Risks & Challenges

Organizing a similar event last year helped us become familiar with some challenges that might come up;

Weather condition: We are planning an indoor event.

Time Constraint: We recorded a high disparity in the timing among people and so, we are running a 'day-light' round the clock activity to give everyone the opportunity to share in the experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Donation of games: PLEASE if you can or if you want your game to be played, we want that too. Please leave a message and we can share more details with you. 

2. Share: Please we would really need your help to help us share among your community. It's my hope that one day, you too will be able to attend #ABCon

story:
This is a pre-order campaign for the second print run of the Willow zine. If you missed the kickstarter this is a second chance to get the zine in print.



Willow is an old-school, grim, backwater micro setting made for Swords and Wizardry rule system, but can easily be used with other old-school systems or even 5E. All in a compact zine format.

It is a modular town that can be dropped into your campaign. Its fully formed and flavorful. It focuses on game-able content and being easy to use at the table. It is graphic and art heavy and utilizes random tables to make it easier for GMs to run in a pinch.

 

Deep in a vast wood, a town called Willow sits beside the Lake of Tears. The lake is framed by weeping willow trees, their vines pouring into the lake’s dark green shores. Willow is not what one would call an upbeat town. The rains here are relentless and the grey skies loom low like a giant cage. Travelers do not linger here long; one night in the Blue Brew Inn is enough to make most jump on the ferry and move on. But recently the ferries have stopped running as something terrible has taken up residence on the river. Meanwhile, the town folk will not talk about the noises echoing up from the staircase that descends below the lake, nor the broken stone circle on the hill at the edge of town. The town's leader, a witch named Morose Morgan, is a recluse and refuses to leave her island.

Willow is a mini hexcrawl and players will have to work to investigate a mystery to move on from this damp backwater town to bigger, brighter places. 

  • Hooks and rumours for players
  • 5 Keyed Hex Locations
  • Random encounter tables for different areas
  • New monsters and monster factions 
  • An aquatic themed dungeon
  • NPC relationship web
  • Key NPCs with desires, fears and mannerisms
  • A mystery to be solved upriver
  • A shop and inn
  • Changes and sets of events that happen over time
  • Necrotic plants
  • Table for how the village will react to different actions players take 

  • Trim size : 5.5” x 8.5” 
  • 100lb silk paper stapled with 110lb laminated card-stock cover 
  • Printed in a single green hue
  • 36 pages
  • The PDF has hyperlinks and bookmarks

  • The design goals for Willow were to make a zine that has a focus on:
  • Modular design
  • Game-able content
  • Easy to pick up and run with little DM prep
  • A lot of art and graphics to cut down on text
  • A dark fantasy fairytale theme
  • Creating a memorable town that can be used as a starting town for campaigns

 

Woodfall

Back at a higher level to receive both Woodfall and Willow in print! (free shipping for Canadians)

Woodfall is a system neutral dark fantasy mini setting.

Explore a dark fairytale setting, wade through a misty swamp, get caught up in the fighting between warring monster clans, discover a strange town of witches and thieves, and search for forgotten treasure.

Woodfall is a swamp belonging to a king where witches, thieves and outlaws are squatting. They have built a town on top of the swamp and have resisted several evictions. The town is a hub for black market activity and magical folk. The surrounding forest and swamp is a hexcrawl filled with various monster factions.

The Setting has many political themes, influenced mostly from 15th-16th century European history but also includes contemporary political themes and satire. Woodfall village depicts anti-authoritarian peasants in revolt against a kingdom. Elements of influence are taken from :the German peasants war, the anabaptist's, the diggers (of the 1600's), the free miners in the forest of Dean, the history of the witch trails in Europe and history of squatting in the middle ages in Europe ( Tŷ unnos ). Woodfall village is thus a strange village that players might not have encountered much before in fantasy games.

About the Woodfall Book

  • 6 x 9 digest size
  • Designed to be easy to drop into your game or run as a stand alone
  • Printed Black and white
  • 92 Pages

 

Expect to get your zine in December. Shipping from Canada.

Risks and challenges

The risks are very low as this is a pre-order campaign for another print run of a zine that is already finished. My printer is still operating during covid with no delays.

story:
Why did we make the Vortex?

We’re a team of three designers and too often we realised we weren’t giving ourselves any time out from work. We’re the generation that’s overworked to the brink with deadlines, meetings and targets to hit and so, we just wanted something that would let us put it all on pause for just a minute.

Think back to the time when you’re at the checkout and fumbling to put all the coins and cash away, if you had a minute where everything just paused, the relief that comes with it is like nothing else. Now apply that to your work, life and everything else you have going on.

Oftentimes, that moment to breathe is all you need to help you refocus and get your attention back. A moment of tranquility in the palm of your hand.

This is what we set out to achieve.

The Vortex fits any size of fingers, from small children (while supervised) to the biggest of adults. We all need to take a moment to just detract ourselves from the stressors of daily life.

 

Throw your Vortex into an exhilarating nose dive and let it tear up a paradoxical upside down spin on your desk space.

Turn your world in the opposite direction and let the Vortex animate your desktop.

 

 

The scores along the neck are designed purposefully to give you the maximum grip while providing a dazzling show.

Even with the stickiest of fingers, the Vortex provides enough tension to spin it your way.

 

 

Nestle it in your front pocket or day bag to ensure you always have it to hand whenever and wherever you need it.

You'll never forget the restful relaxation you get each and every day with your Vortex.

 

 

Have a good ol’ fashioned spin off and pit yourself against a worthy adversary to see who can spin the longest.

With over a minute of spin time, you can have plenty of tiny games to let off some steam throughout the day.

Checking our smart tech on breaks immediately raises levels of anxiety without us even knowing.

Watching the soothing spiral of the Vortex helps settle your blood pressure, heart rate and breathing into a harmonious pattern, all at once, achieving a refreshingly peaceful timeout.

 

 

In the haze of stress, our cognitive functions and memory become confused which leads to unwanted mistakes and missed timescales.

Vortex is there to help you step back from the noise. By taking a spin, we allow ourselves a little time to re-centre and our brain.

 

 

How many times have you put your phone down, only to pick it right back up again right after, for no good reason? It’s all too easy to feel restless at work.

Let Vortex take you to a world where you can refocus your brain and reanimate your desk with the twist of a finger.

 

 

Immerse yourself in present mindfulness and lift your mood. Engage every part of your senses to notice each touch and sound so that you savour every sensation.

Let Vortex lift your mood and be present in the moment. Raise your spirits organically with each spin, with a feeling of all-round wellbeing.

 

 

 

Brass is commonly used for the decorative and low friction properties it has. It’s the perfect centrepiece for a sophisticated mahogany workspace. The more you use it, the more the gold sheen will patina over time to create a more personal piece.

It’s weighty feel and increased spin time makes this a firm favourite amongst spinning top aficionados.

316 Stainless Steel is the strongest and most robust version we could mill into the silhouette of a Vortex. Made up of Nickel, Chromium, Manganese and a few other elements, it is ultra-durable and provides excellent resistance to corrosion. It is used in hospitals and the automotive industries, so it's made to last.

Lose yourself in the endless shimmer of the sharp, clean and contemporary finish of the Stainless Steel.

 

Vortex fits perfectly between your finger tips. Its ergonomic and reassuringly familiar feel sends us back to our roots of classical and comforting entertainment.

 

 

Having a beautifully crafted classical desk spinner at your finger tips, yet light and small enough to fit into the small jean pocket, ensures you are ready wherever and whenever to immerse yourself in the Vortex.

 

 

Vortex enhances the feeling of space and time on our desk space and looks right at home. An outlet at hands reach to remind us to take regular breaks, but without the distracting effects of modern technology.

 

 

Our day bag is often filled with clutter that only adds to the daily stresses. By placing Vortex into your daily arsenal of tools, it adds an escape to ‘me time’, unlike anything else you carry.

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

We’ve examined every part of the production process and currently have a whole team of manufacturers and shippers. Alongside this, we have two backup manufacturers (as we’ve seen other projects depend on only one) and three backup shippers (it’s super easy to find people willing to ship stuff in quantity).

We're confident that we'll be able to deliver earlier than the projected date on the campaign as that is simply there to give us some breathing room.

We hold the Indiegogo community in a very high regard as we’re serial backers ourselves and we appreciate the thought and insight that can come from running a project so we plan to keep you all in the loop transparently through Indiegogo updates and comments whenever we have a development.

Thank you for your support and we hope you love the Vortex as much as we do!

It is used in hospitals and the automotive industries, so it's made to last.Lose yourself in the endless shimmer of the sharp, clean and contemporary finish of the Stainless Steel. 
 Vortex fits perfectly between your finger tips. Its ergonomic and reassuringly familiar feel sends us back to our roots of classical and comforting entertainment.  Having a beautifully crafted classical desk spinner at your finger tips, yet light and small enough to fit into the small jean pocket, ensures you are ready wherever and whenever to immerse yourself in the Vortex.  Vortex enhances the feeling of space and time on our desk space and looks right at home. An outlet at hands reach to remind us to take regular breaks, but without the distracting effects of modern technology.  Our day bag is often filled with clutter that only adds to the daily stresses. By placing Vortex into your daily arsenal of tools, it adds an escape to ‘me time’, unlike anything else you carry.      
Risks and challenges
We’ve examined every part of the production process and currently have a whole team of manufacturers and shippers. Alongside this, we have two backup manufacturers (as we’ve seen other projects depend on only one) and three backup shippers (it’s super easy to find people willing to ship stuff in quantity).
We're confident that we'll be able to deliver earlier than the projected date on the campaign as that is simply there to give us some breathing room.
We hold the Indiegogo community in a very high regard as we’re serial backers ourselves and we appreciate the thought and insight that can come from running a project so we plan to keep you all in the loop transparently through Indiegogo updates and comments whenever we have a development.
Thank you for your support and we hope you love the Vortex as much as we do!

story:
Initially, we laser-cut a keyboard-shaped box from thick cardboard to store our cards, just for fun. To our surprise, people went crazy over the box! There were actually some people who bought our early test version of the game just for the box, without even trying the game! We knew we had something special on our hands.

We could have went with the conventional cardboard box but we wanted all of you to feel the same sense of amazement we felt when the cards were stored in such an amazing box. We've searched high and low for a manufacturer in China who would be willing to work on a project like this for an affordable rate with high standards for manufacturing quality. We're glad to give you a quick preview of the final design and we'll update you as manufacturing progresses!

 

 

 

Gameplay video with Kirsten Long and Wanning Wong (full time musicians and music teachers)!

Video interview with The Cardboard Stacker:

We are just 3 Musically-inclined(hence the theme), Engineering-trained(hence the box) and Game-addicted(hence the game) guys from Singapore(hence the asian parents forcing us to learn music). 

We had a horrible experience learning music theory when we were younger.  We created this game because we want to transform that terrible experience into a terrific experience, and we believe we can - with your help! 

While this is our first crowdfunding project, all 3 of us have backed Kickstarter projects before and we each bring strong complementary skills to form a great team. From video filming to digital marketing to game design to publicity outreach, the three of us have been hard at work daily to chase our dreams. We've tried to do as much of it by ourselves as possible so that we can ensure that every part of this campaign and journey retains the style, humor and quality that we've promised with the game.

If you’re into geeky Musical references and epic Composer puns, Pliszt Bach us and help us to make this game a reality. 

Check out Jonathan's Medium Article for the detailed composition of our bach story, filled with lots of be-haydn-the-scenes action and accounts of our crazy sustained hustling.

Translations and Musical Variations

Due to cost issues with manufacturing small quantities, we are only able to print the game in English. However, here is a Google Sheet with descriptions and translations for the Minor Edition. Feel free to add translations in your own language!

 

We also understand that different musicians have different notation systems such as B/H for Bflat/B in certain parts of Europe, quarter Notes and Crotchets, fixed solfege and "ABCDEFG".

This is how we have addressed these issues:

  • The Note cards will come with an extra 8 cards of B and H. If you use the "ABCDEFG" system, you can simply throw away the extra B and H cards and vice versa. 
  • All Note cards will also include the fixed-do solfege notation on them. An "A" Note will have a "La" on it and so forth.
  • All descriptions involving time value of Notes will have both the American and English versions in it. It will appear as "Eighth Note / Quaver" for example.

Manufacturing, Shipping and Pledge Manager

Manufacturing

Update: We recently went on a trip to China to visit our partners! Check out our post in the Updates section for more info.

We are currently working together with WhatzGames (King of Tokyo, Krosmaster Quest, Antidote) to produce our game components and IdealHard (Robo3D, Body Boss) to manufacture our box - both in China. Both companies have great records of working with crowdfunding campaigns and we have been in close communication with the companies pre-launch.

Shipping

Shipping will not be charged during the campaign. It will be charged through the pledge manager after the InDemand based on the actual costs incurred to ship. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all, and also give you more stretch goodies and possibly a choice of carrier options.

We will be working with SendFromChina (SFC). They are an experienced company who have received good reviews from other crowdfunding creators and offer highly competitive shipping rates. We are offering tax-friendly options for US, EU, Canada, Australia and Mexico.

The shipping rates below are an estimate but they will be the maximum possible value charged to the pledge manager at the end of the campaign. We have slightly overestimated some of the rates so as to give ourselves some leeway to work with unforeseen circumstances. 

Delivery is expected to be in October 2019.

Pledge Manager

We will be working togther with CrowdOx. For those who are new to crowdfunding, a pledge manager will help us to manage the orders and information more effectively. About a week after InDemand ends, all backers will receive an email with a survey to confirm shipping address, shipping costs and any additional add-ons or purchases that they'll like to make.

Retailers

Please email us at hello@lordofthechords.com.

Estimated Timeline

 

Risks & Challenges

Lord of the Chords LLP was founded in 2018, by Jonathan, Jun Yu and Keith. All three of us engineering majors at university. We are proud to say that the three of us have taken a year's leave of absence to ensure that fulfilment goes smoothly. There's nothing more that we want than for Lord of the Chords to be in your hands, wow-ing your friends, making you laugh, and showing you that music theory can in fact be fun!

At Lord of the Chords, we strive to make products that are beautiful, hilarious, and enlightening, and we think we've done that with this game.

The money raised by this campaign will be used to fund the first round of production for Lord of the Chords. This includes injection molding for the box, manufacturing costs for the cards, rulebook and tokens, and shipping.

We have done our best to accurately gauge our costs by building relationships with our future manufacturers and suppliers.

While printing, shipping, and processing delays are always a possibility, we have set a reasonable delivery date based on our experience.

Fun Guaranteed! 
We want you to love your experience with Lord of the Chords. If you don't enjoy the game after you've received and played it, just send it back to our headquarters and we'll issue you a full refund, no questions asked.

Refunds – Indiegogo
If you'd like a refund before your item ships, you have until one week before the scheduled ship date to request one. We can offer you a 90% refund since the Indiegogo retains about 10% of your pledge for various fees. If there is something wrong with your item, we appreciate the opportunity to replace or exchange it. If a refund is preferred and there is no defect with the product, you'll be responsible for shipping it back to us. Upon receipt of the returned item, we'll issue you a 90% refund. Refund requests must be made within 30 days of the date the item was delivered to you.

Replacements 
We are always happy to replace defective or damaged tokens, cards, or other components. Just send us photos of the damage, and we will ship a replacement at no additional cost to you. If your item needs to be returned, we will cover the cost of the return shipping. We provide replacement pieces while titles are active in our catalog, which is typically at least a year after their initial printing. Replacement requests must be made within 30 days of the date the item was delivered to you.

story:
The Total Party Kill Handbook is a Game Master’s aide, containing twenty-five encounters and a Trap Workshop full of dangerous obstacles designed for use with your favorite fifth edition roleplaying game. Clocking in at close to 150 pages, The Total Party Kill Handbook has enough content to keep even seasoned adventurers busy.

Each of the encounters is ready-to-run; including beautiful maps, dangerous monsters, fiendish puzzles, and bountiful treasure. Whether you need a memorable boss fight at the end of a dungeon, a random encounter more engaging than 2d6 goblins, or just a little inspiration to help you design your own masterwork challenge, The Total Party Kill Handbook will help your campaign level up.

The encounters included in The Total Party Kill Handbook span the full range of character levels from 1 to 20, and each includes scaling guidelines and suggestions for altering the challenge for higher or lower level adventurers. More than just stat blocks and a grid, you get notes on monster tactics, reminders about which rules are likely to come up during play, and suggested reactions to common (or uncommon) actions the players may take. Each encounter includes a number of helpful tags covering appropriate terrain types for the encounter to take place in as well as which types of characters will do well in the challenge, and which types will struggle.

What exciting adventures await your players? 

  • An unassuming pool of shallow water, hiding crafty water elementals determined to drag trespassers into an aquifer beneath the ground! 
  • A gang of doppelgangers lurking in a trap-filled maze, ready to divide and conquer! 
  • Innocent looking bridges that conceal nests of harpies, a long fall, and hungry carrion crawlers in the depths below! 
  • Iron golems, a crazed pyromancer, and too many deadly gnomish contraptions to count guarding a fantastic treasure hoard! 
  • Top it all off with a crazed hydra trapped inside a ruined keep, with each of its heads in a different, dangerous room!


Beyond the encounters, you also get The Trap Workshop. A new way to build traps for the 5th Edition game, The Trap Workshop contains a broad selection of types, triggers, and modifiers to help you build traps that are both exciting (for you) and terrifying (for your players). 

How does it work? 

You start by picking from the list of trap types, which range from simple pit traps or projectiles to complex moving floor systems and clouds of gas with multiple effects. Each of these types is scaled by party level, with damage and difficulty checks figured out for you. Then, you select a triggering mechanism, anything from the typical tripwire to the more unusual trap that goes off if anyone speaks louder than a whisper. Finally, you can add modifiers to your contraption, including encounter changing terrain effects, illusions to confound your players, as well as a collection of effects designed to split the party, for when you really want to push your players.

On top of that, the book includes several example traps with a bit more flair than your typical swinging blades. You can look forward to reading about The Early Retirement, The Used-to-be-an-Adventurer-Like-You, and the mad wizard’s favorite, The Spellctacular Finisher. The challenges in this book aren’t designed to require lucky dice rolls or optimized characters; they are designed instead to challenge the players to think critically, work as a team, and react to the unexpected. They reward good planning, preparation, and generally doing something other than drawing their weapons and charging at the first thing they see. 


Finally, The Trap Compendium contains 50 unique traps, each more devious than the last, totaling close to 80 pages. We'll design these traps using the mechanisms from The Trap Workshop portion of The Total Party Kill Handbook, and include additional supplements to The Trap Workshop's creation process. 

Are your players ready?

We're excited to bring you The Total Party Kill Handbook, but we've got some awesome ideas for follow-up projects that'll really knock this out of the park!

 The Trap Compendium -- UNLOCKED via Kickstarter!


The TPK Adventure Module -- $25,000

If we reach $25,000 in total funding (Kickstarter and IndieGoGo), we’ll unlock an official Total Party Kill Adventure Module as an Add-On for $15 (digital PDF) or $20 (physical softcover). The official TPK Adventure Module will combine a selection of the encounters from the Total Party Kill Handbook with all-new content and a cohesive narrative, giving you a fully-fledged story with memorable encounters from start to finish that showcases the amazing encounters from The Total Party Kill Handbookin a standalone adventure format. As we'd be starting this a bit later than the other content, expect it to come out around January, 2017, rather than the October, 2016 date.


More to Come?

We have some other exciting ideas, including partnering with some other great start-ups and development of additional TPK Handbook material. As we approach these other stretch goals, we'll reach out to the community and get your advice about what you'd like to see!


Steven Gordon, author of The Total Party Kill Primer and longtime professional Dungeon Master, will be the primary Author for The Total Party Kill Handbook (and The Trap Compendium). While neither raised by wolves nor orphaned as the result of an orc attack, he has been rolling dice and delving dungeons since elementary school, and made it four years before his first character death.

Nolan N. Nasser, a freelance illustrator and concept artist from Grand Rapids, began working in the gaming industry roughly two years ago as the artist for TCGplayer’s MaxPoint Author Tokens. Now his works spans as far as clients such as Greater Than Games and recently, 2CGaming. Reveling in the idea of creating characters and developing worlds his passion for stories and gaming fuels his passion for art.

Check out his work at n3art.com

Ambrose H. Hoilman is a freelance illustrator from Western North Carolina. He has been working as a freelance illustrator full time for the last two years. For almost a decade before that, he worked as an illustrator and graphics specialists for a cultural resource management company.

A longtime tabletop gamer, Ambrose acted as one of the primary artists for The Total Party Kill Primer and will continue his work on The Total Party Kill Handbook and any stretch goals we hit!

Check out his work at ambrosehh.com

Jon Kelly, founder of 2CGaming, performs shady back-ally deals with artists, authors, and corporate partners that often end in blood-pacts and strange extra-geometrical tattoos. No one knows his role on 2CGaming's projects, but it is rumored that he does just enough of everything to keep the ship sailing.


Thanks so much for stopping by! We're very excited to be able to bring this project to you and appreciate your support and interest!

story:
EOE Presents a Harlequin Miniatures Production - 32 Classic Oldhammer Great Orcs by Kev Adams

The Barnorsk Great Orcs were sculpted in 1996 and are just too good to rot away in the back of the warehouse. We are remolding these wonderful Miniatures and will lovingly cast them in lead-free pewter to show them in all their original glory. They will once again be ready to wage war across your gaming table. Now for a little bit of history...

Barnorsk Orcs of the Wild North

A reclusive Orc tribe who share little of their culture with others, the Barnorsk dwell in the deep north where the biting cold of the never-ending winter is a brand of torture all its own. The harsh inhospitable nature of the Barnorsk environment, and the fact that few traders ever enter their lands, has skewed their world view to the point where all non-Orc races are viewed as imperfect and they enter into alliances only after much consideration. As their lands are rumoured to contain great wealth, the occasional warband or adventurer's party will take a chance with the inclement weather but these are almost always unsuccessful. Initially, their Frontier Guard were unrelenting in their attacks on the unwelcome visitors in an attempt to be rid of them but now they allow the weather to do their job for them.

These huge Great Orcs tower over their Orc and Goblin Brethren. How huge? Well here's Pollod meeting the Halfling ambassador for the first (possibly last) time.

 

Barnorsk Orc Heroes

 

Barnorsk Orc Mountain Marauders
 

Barnorsk Orc Ice Breakers
 

Barnorsk Orc Wildland Warriors
 

Barnorsk Orc Border Raiders
 

Barnorsk Orc Arra Lads
 

Stretch Goals

This time around we're adding 2 stretch goals. When we reach $1500 all backers who've ordered one of the sets or higher will get Barnorsk Orc Champion Ricko da Ols. If we get to $2000 then we'll also add Jocko Wilson the Barnorsk Orc sniper assassin!

story:
"The Butterfly Curse” is an original horror escape game that mixes physical and digital puzzles with dark narrative to immerse you in a such terrifying experience that it may be impossible for you to distinguish reality from fiction.

A mysterious envelope will reach your hands. Inside, you will find the material that serves as a bridge to connect the physical and digital world. By interacting with it, you must solve the enigmas and puzzles to survive to this evil curse. Your ingenuity and courage will be your only ally.

This model of escape game serves us to create more complex and surprising puzzles to immerse you into a more sophisticated story and, by not being dependent on a physical space we can make the game reach all over the world. 

 

 

The envelope is the heart of the project and the online support material its soul. With this combination, you and your friends can face the multiple challenges with at least 2 hours of fun and puzzle-solving.

Special materials

You shouldn't trust your senses due these puzzles will make you doubt the limits between reality and fiction. It maybe looks like ordinary objects but they keep dark and dangerous secrets you must reveal. 

 

Immersive and digital puzzles

Keep in mind that nothing is what it seems. The pictures and videos you will need to explore will make your blood freeze. Will you be able to keep your sight on the screen looking for clues hidden in our websites?

More puzzles

Do you love cracking codes? Translate from old, forgotten languages? Fold and interact with papers in order to unlock ancient knowledge and hideous spells? These kind of puzzle just require you to think slightly outside the box. 

Some of the puzzles shown above are examples. We don't want to show you the final puzzles to not spoil your experience.

 

The game can be played solo or with a group of friends, is recommended for people over 16 years old and is available in English and Spanish. 

Although it will be necessary to have a device with a good internet connection, this game will be more focused on brings you a phisical experience by making you interact with the objects and, of coure with the rest of your team.

It is not necessary to be an expert at any particular subject, you just need to accept the challenge and don’t be afraid of your own shadow.

It will be about 120 minutes of puzzles and scary moments but if you get stuck, do not worry, you can interact with the characters in the story and ask for advice. They will give you clues and hints to help you move forward.

If you are ready to get a taste of the game, you can play our DEMO here. Totally online playable. Screw up your courage and go through with it!

During the Middle Ages, the Inquisition condemned and extinguished the most prestigious and powerful witches' coven in Europe. Each coven worshiped a demon, but this specific clan worshiped Farglos, the cursed messenger.

There are various theories about the origin of this entity, but the oldest explanation comes from a strange manuscript dating from the early fourteenth century. This document tells the story of Graal.

By not depending on spatial and temporal limitations like other Escape Rooms, we are able to have greater freedom to improve.

 

 

Shipping is charged as part of this Indiegogo campaign. You just have to select your reward and when filling your shipping info the shipping price is automatically added to the pledge.

Actually, this point is our biggest worry. What shipping will look like post COVID-19 is unclear thos the outbreaks are affecting the lives and work of people all across the globe. As a consequence, there might be delays regarding the delivery of our products. We'll try our best for the game to reach you before Christmas

Shipping estimates:

Europe: 4€
Rest of the World: 5€

 

 

 

We are a startup that aims to launch different Escape Games themes (Terror, Adventure, Detective,...) that resemble the Escape Room experience but right in your home.

Other games

 

For those who don't know, "The Butterfly Curse" is not our first project. Last February we launched "Hack Forward"  another Escape Game in which you have to put yourself in an investigator's shoes and find those responsible of a worldwide cyberattack that threatens the security of the world.  The story is divided into 8 chapters and each one can be completed in 1 hour. If you like conspiracy theories, science fiction and plot twists you will love this one.

 

With "Hack Forward", we reached our goal of 28.500€ in just two days. Once the campaign finished, we got more than 1.375 backers who pledged 86.176€ for our product. But that's not all! Since then, we have reached  101.400€ at Indiegogo and the number of backers have risen to 1602.


Hack Forward will be delivered in October then... why are you starting this new project when the first one is not ready yet?


Good point. Key Enigma team is made up of two storytellers and puzzle makers, two graphic designer and Albert, who is in charge about the financials, logistics and software developer/computer programmer. 


Hack Forward goes according to plan: the logistics are almost done and we have most of the materials and puzzles. Besides, all the writings are finished although the translation of the texts may be delayed.


We have time to start planing our next step and keep working hard in this adventure. As big fans of Escape Rooms and Escape Games we love mysteries, enigmas... and HORROR. So here we are, like a dog with two tails presenting our new project to bring you all a new story you will be able to enjoy before Christmas.


But it can only be carried out if we get enough support through Indiegogo.

 

Main Inspirations

 

The night of October 30th, 1938 gave us the most famous and scariest radio broadcast in history: "War of the Worlds" by Orson Welles. 

Orson Welles certainly understood all the possibilities radio could offer and knew how to use it to carry out a very different entertainment experience from what people were used to. Wasn't a coincidence that he decided to experiment with the deepest and most primitive emotion of the human being: FEAR.

story:
Please view our Pledge Levels Comparison Chart HERE
or at the bottom of this page.


 

 
 
 

 
 

 
 




 


PLEASE NOTE: These videos show an "early prototype" of the game with Miniatures and Art/Design that has since been updated. All game elements shown in these videos are not final. The board and cards in these videos were printed on our office printer and miniatures were hand-sculpted. This in no way reflects the high-quality sculpts or printing/paper weight/finish that will be used in the final product.
 

Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers is a Pre-Painted Miniatures board game. Play as Sonic, one of his friends, a rival, or a foe, and race through a track full of different obstacles and challenges. Along the way, collect as many rings as possible and destroy Badniks at every opportunity. But don’t forget to keep an eye on your fellow Racers, they could be hot on your heels and ready to strike!

Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers comes with 5 iconic Sonic characters as Pre-Painted Miniatures, each with a different Racing style.

Each Racer has a Pre-Painted Miniature, Racer Profile, and Speed Token. Each Racer Profile contains the Racer’s unique special Ability, Power, and is used to track the Racer’s Speed, and Rings collected throughout the game.

If racing against four opponents isn’t enough of a challenge, try adding a Boss to your game. Included in the Super Pledge, characters such as Dr. Eggman can be used as a normal Racer or a Boss in the game with different abilities and effects.

Bosses are not controlled by any player and have a Boss Profile detailing their special rules and effects, combined with their own specific set of Boss Cards used during the game, each Boss presents a new challenge for Racers to overcome.

What Sonic game would be complete without Badniks getting in the way and causing trouble for the Racers? Buzz Bomber, Crabmeat, Spinner, and Moto Bug each present a different threat, and with them covering the track, you will have to consider the risks and plan your route carefully.

Sculpted Badniks are a LIMITED-TIME BONUS to this campaign (they are included in the Super Pledge and Hyper Pledge) and will not come in the retail version of the game.

Each round, every player will choose an Agility Card to play. Agility Cards are a combination of one Action and one Movement. The Action portion can adjust a Racer’s Speed, allow them to Jump over obstacles and Badniks, or even activate a Racer’s Power, to name just a few choices. The Movement portion allows you to Run or Jump, and is always mandatory — this is a racing game after all!

To learn more about the game rules, download the Rulebook HERE.

Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers is designed by Benjamin Yamada. Benjamin Yamada is a board game designer at night and programmer at day. His deep love of video games have lead him, to not only work in the video game industry, but also to design video game inspired board games. You can follow him on Twitter at @benjaminyamada.

Sonic the Hedgehog: Battle Racers game design has been fully completed, tested, and approved.  

Shipping will be charged after the campaign through our pledge manager, based on the actual cost to ship your pledge and any additional rewards you select. This is so we can be fair to all our backers as shipping is rarely one size fits all.

We will ship your rewards from the closest of several fulfillment hubs around the world.

Our current estimate for shipping costs are listed below:

Africa: $80 to most countries
Asia: $10 - $15 to China and Hong Kong, $30 - $40 to most other countries, $50 - $60 to Russia and Israel, $70 to Turkey, We cannot estimate Malaysia.
Canada: $15 - $30 to most cities.
Europe: $20 - $30 to Germany. $20 - $30 to most other countries. $35 - $50 to Scandinavia, Estland, Lettland, Latvia, Bosnia/Herzegovina, Croatia, and Serbia. $50 - $60 to Bulgaria, Lithuania, Romania, and Iceland. $70 to Greece and Ukraine.
Latin America: $60 - 70 to most countries.
Oceania: $20 - $45 to Australia. $30 - $40 to New Zealand.
UK: $10 - $15 to most cities.
USA: $10 - $15 to most cities. $50 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico.

Please note that these are ESTIMATES ONLY and may change as we unlock more items or if you purchase additional rewards.

We cannot ship to PO Boxes domestically or internationally. Due to the size of each package there is too great a risk of the package being bounced back to us.



Shinobi 7, LLC., is run by a core team whose members have an average of 15+ years of experience in the hobby game industry, and have worked on top licensed brands such as Star Wars, Lord of the Rings, Disney, Marvel, DC Comics, My Little Pony, Tokyo Ghoul, and many more.

Shinobi 7, LLC., is a tabletop game company dedicated to producing and publishing high quality games based on hit pop culture brands. Formed in 2016, Shinobi 7 is an independent subsidiary of Seven Seas Entertainment, LLC.

story:
Dear backers!

BLOOD OF THE NORTHMEN is the latest game by Carl Chudyk (Glory To Rome, Innovation, Impulse) taking players north of Europe into the wild Nordic lands of the 9th century. Each player controls his own Viking clan with a unique ability. Players playing tiles from hand together build a board on which they place their warriors. Each tile in the game is both a board element, an action card, and strength in a fight. During the game, players gain victory points by fighting other clans, as well as by taking strategic settlements. The game is filled with negative interaction and a huge amount of strategy and tactics. The game has an unusual and unique mechanics of using tiles, not yet seen in other games. 120 unique tiles, 48 high detailed figures and 12 Strongholds are just some of the items in the box. Carl Chudyk is back with a really innovative game, BIG game, that we would like to fund and publish with your help. It won't work without you. As always, we count on your help and support.

 

 

How to play video
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c5XntVbo79A&feature=emb_logo
 

 

All Stretch Goals have been unlocked during the Kickstarter campaign. All of the following goals will also go to anyone supporting our campaign on Indiegogo. Every backers here and on Kickstarter will receive the same version of the game with all previously unlocked stretch goals.

 
 
 
Shipping is Worldwide Friendly. We ship this game around the world.
There will be no pledge manager. When making a pledge you will select shipping cost.
 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

This is our twenty sixth Global Crowdfunding campaign. Producing thousands of products and coordinating their delivery to homes across the planet is a complex business, and there are many things which could go wrong. This is why we build in as much time for the unforeseen as possible. We want to ensure that we have the space to deal with any unexpected setbacks and still get your game to you before the estimated delivery date.

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented in this Kickstarter project.

We have already booked a printer for November 2020. You will receive "Blood of the Northmen" by March 2021. Of course manufacturing a game is not a simple process, so always something may go wrong, but it is outside our power. For now - we have done everything possible to be sure to fulfill by the end of March 2021.

Check out:

The Rules in English

The Rules in Italian

The Print and Play

 

 

 

 

 

Reviews:

 

 
 

 

Shipping:

 

The project is customs friendly for Australia, Canada, the EU, and the US. We do not anticipate customs fees to be charged for any of our reward tiers. However, should you live in the US, Australia, Canada, or the EU and have to pay customs, please email Turnsidewaysgames@gmail.com with a photo of the invoice and we will refund you the amount paid for customs fees.

Our Story:

Social Media:

Instagram: @TurnSidewaysGames

Twitter: @TurnSWGames

Facebook: @TacoNinjaAdventure

Risks and Challenges:

Taco Ninja Adventure has been extensively play tested and prototyped - it's ready to go. We understand there are risks associated with any project, but we're confident we've mitigated these as much as possible before launching this project. We have several different manufacturing options and shipping partners picked out based on how successful the campaign is and we're happy with their quotes and their customer service reputation. We have made friends with a lot of other game designers in Chicago who have gone through this process and have an awesome network to help resolve any issue that may come up during the campaign and fulfillment process. In addition, our team has a combined total of over 10 years experience working in international manufacturing in the consumer electronics space. We understand many of the pitfalls that surround creating a product internationally and delivering it to customers, and we are confident in our ability to successfully deliver a high quality product to our backers.

story:
Mighty Dwarves

Immerse Yourself in the Magic World of Mighty Dwarves.

Get these beautifully crafted dwarf miniatures and paint them the way you want!

Mighty Dwarves includes eight (8) 120mm resin miniatures, designed by M. Molovtsev:

Grymaad Empty-Head

Un unlucky dwarf, Grymaad Empty-Head has a tendency of getting into trouble. Yet it is his seemingly ill-fated steps that lead the dwarf princes into the most daring of adventures.

 

Uttmaar the Hooded

A simple dwarf and a skilled miner, Uttmaar the Hooded is devoted to little besides the pleasures of shimmering stones and gold. Yet he is a hearty dwarf, eager to partake in adventure.

 

Thinnghaar Silver-Arrow

A warrior through and through, Thinnghaar Silver-Arrow mostly wears a scowl on his face and never travels without his crossbow and piercing arrows. He is the youngest of the dwarf brothers and mighty cunning.

 

Thryggstyr the Knowing

Unlike most of his bretheren Thryggstyr the Knowing is a learned and powerful dwarf. He has a knack for weaving potent spells, and is the oldest of the dwarf brothers, perhaps the wisest too.

 

Styggma'ar Hammer-Hand

Weilding his tools with mountainous strength, the black smith Styggma'ar Hammer-Hand is a real force of the underground kingdom. Little does he know that soon his skill and brawn will wreak havoc in the world above. 

Zygma'ar the Simple

Like his name suggests, Zygma'ar the Simple is usually slow to catch on with happenings in the kingdom. But sometimes it is his very aimlessness that reveals to him necessary treasures and secrets.

 

Bryddba'ard the Tamer

A friend of beasts and wolves, Bryddba'ard the Tamer is a more thoughtful dwarf. His power often goes unnoticed, but when the time comes he can fight and scheme like a fearless dwarf prince.  

 

Krynnruud Iron-Brow

Having walked through the City of the Dead all by himself, Krynnruud Iron-Brow is the most fearless of the dwarves. Nothing can shake his steadfastness, and few even dare to face him in battle.

 

How can these be painted?
 

We have already painted a set of these miniatures, take a look at what can be achieved:

 
 
 
 
 
 
 

Attention to Details

All the miniatures are designed with attention to details:
 
 
 
What We Need & What You Get
  • We have already produced a small quantity of each miniature, so for the first people who pledge we will be able to ship right away! We need just $5K to start a bigger production.
  • You can get these miniatures for a much better price now, saving between 45-36%

The Impact

With the funds received from you, we will be able to make new designs and collections for all the miniatures enthusiasts worldwide.

Risks & Challenges

As we are in the holidays season, there might be some delays in shipments, but we really hope that the Mighty Dwarves will get to you pretty soon!

Mighty Dwarves includes eight (8) 120mm resin miniatures, designed by M. Molovtsev:
Grymaad Empty-Head
Un unlucky dwarf, Grymaad Empty-Head has a tendency of getting into trouble. Yet it is his seemingly ill-fated steps that lead the dwarf princes into the most daring of adventures.

 
Uttmaar the Hooded
A simple dwarf and a skilled miner, Uttmaar the Hooded is devoted to little besides the pleasures of shimmering stones and gold. Yet he is a hearty dwarf, eager to partake in adventure.

 
Thinnghaar Silver-Arrow
A warrior through and through, Thinnghaar Silver-Arrow mostly wears a scowl on his face and never travels without his crossbow and piercing arrows. He is the youngest of the dwarf brothers and mighty cunning.

 
Thryggstyr the Knowing
Unlike most of his bretheren Thryggstyr the Knowing is a learned and powerful dwarf. He has a knack for weaving potent spells, and is the oldest of the dwarf brothers, perhaps the wisest too.

 
Styggma'ar Hammer-Hand
Weilding his tools with mountainous strength, the black smith Styggma'ar Hammer-Hand is a real force of the underground kingdom. Little does he know that soon his skill and brawn will wreak havoc in the world above. 

Zygma'ar the Simple
Like his name suggests, Zygma'ar the Simple is usually slow to catch on with happenings in the kingdom. But sometimes it is his very aimlessness that reveals to him necessary treasures and secrets.

 
Bryddba'ard the Tamer
A friend of beasts and wolves, Bryddba'ard the Tamer is a more thoughtful dwarf. His power often goes unnoticed, but when the time comes he can fight and scheme like a fearless dwarf prince.  

 
Krynnruud Iron-Brow
Having walked through the City of the Dead all by himself, Krynnruud Iron-Brow is the most fearless of the dwarves. Nothing can shake his steadfastness, and few even dare to face him in battle.

 

How can these be painted?
 
We have already painted a set of these miniatures, take a look at what can be achieved:


 

 

 

 

 

 

 
Attention to Details
All the miniatures are designed with attention to details:

 

 

 
What We Need & What You Get

We have already produced a small quantity of each miniature, so for the first people who pledge we will be able to ship right away! We need just $5K to start a bigger production.
You can get these miniatures for a much better price now, saving between 45-36%


The Impact
With the funds received from you, we will be able to make new designs and collections for all the miniatures enthusiasts worldwide.

Risks & Challenges
As we are in the holidays season, there might be some delays in shipments, but we really hope that the Mighty Dwarves will get to you pretty soon!

story:
What is the Core Codex?

The Codex contains a complete RPG 'engine' designed to allow players the freedom to build characters of their liking. For the GM it provides a toolkit from which any campaign setting can be built from the ground up. 

About the Author

I began my foray into role-playing games even before getting my first D&D set when my brother and I put together our own RPG we called 'Saga'. 

It wasn't until well into my adulthood that I discovered my autism. Looking back with that knowledge I can see just how much RPGs helped me to socialise and develop. For me, this is what the Codex represents. That is to say, it is more than just a hobby project or something I just want to share with people, but a statement about how we as individuals grow and change.

How far along is the Codex?

The Core Codex is already available online here and here. You can follow it on Facebook, and keep up to date with hotfixes, patches and additional content here. While I appreciate any purchases, making a donation through this campaign allows you to enjoy the perks I have planned. 

Why is Funding needed?

  1. To commission interior art, to bring the book to life.

  2. To pay for an editor to put commas in the right place and check for consistency and grammar.

  3. And to pay for general administrative costs to ensure that book is production ready by year's end. 

Potential contributors can obtain the current ebook from my store. All contributors over $10 will receive a digital copy once the book is finalised. Larger contributions will be rewarded with prints, personally signed hard copies of the final 1st Edition and the Art of the Codex (I'm also looking into Core Codex flavoured dice).

Top tier contributors will be allowed to have themselves immortalised in the interior artwork or have one of the pictures sponsored in their name. This will be in addition to receiving their own personalised print depicting their caricature and a signed hardcopy of the final 1st Edition. 

The amount? For this first edition I will be contracting with a single artist to provide the interior art, naturally I will need to cover the costs of the perks, an editor and graphic designer to give the Codex a professional finish.  Edit: So many good local artists, will be considering the work of Gina Rae and Luke Molver!

Contributions Over the Goal

Any contributions over the goal will go towards enhancing and developing the Core Codex brand. I would love to be able to continue adding more content to the Codex system, such as character builds, spells, powers, equipment, vehicles, adventures and more.

Alternatives to Contributions

If you're not able to spare us some coin, then feel free to get a copy of the ebook and submit your artworks, suggestions or comments. Look out for grammatical errors, inconsistencies and typos.

Any of this will go a long way to helping us put out a professional quality book. Feel free to send me emails and comment on the Core website. If you want, you can also purchase branded merchandise here (and like everything Core, you get to build it yourself).

Stretch Goals and Other Developments

As the campaign goes it would also be nice to take what we do here and expand on it. In particular I am currently running two Codex powered campaigns for the general public at the Deetwenty Geeking Venue in Johannesburg. It would be wonderful to develop my beta campaign, set in the mysterious jungle lands of Nyara into a project on its own.

Core Codex Development Timeline

  • Phase 1: Complete a draft version for beta-testing (DONE!)
  • Phase 2: Beta-testing (DONE!)
  • Phase 3: Make modifications, updates and incorporate errata (October-November 2017)
  • Phase 4: Finalise and incorporate artwork (October-November 2017) - Digital versions will ship as soon as the book is finalised. 
  • Phase 5: Publish a final 1st Edition of the Core Codex (December 2017) - you can start to expect perks, just in time for Christmas! 

Disclaimer and Legal

The Core Codex is based primarily on the d20 System MSRD. Nevertheless, while the Core system is d20/Open Game Content based (the licensing is included in the book), it is not the d20 System. The open game content of the Core system is indicated in the legal appendix of the Codex and here.

story:
A locked room book? I'm obsessed: Mysterious Cases contain codes, puzzles, letters, and boxes within boxes! Um, yes. https://t.co/cSihdJKKTP

— Neil Patrick Harris (@ActuallyNPH) June 1, 2016
“If the art of the detective began and ended in reasoning
from an arm-chair, my brother would be the greatest
criminal agent that ever lived.”
– Sherlock Holmes, The Greek Interpreter

 

 

Robert Sabuda, the #1 New York Times best-selling 3D book creator, and his creative partners in crime, Shelby Arnold and Simon Arizpe, are bringing you an extraordinary new form of storytelling. Mysterious Cases combine the drama and intrigue of a long lost tale, with the puzzle solving marvels of an Escape Room.

Part game, part book, and part interactive adventure, each Mysterious Case contains codes to crack, puzzles to solve, letters to snoop, boxes within boxes to unlock...all leading to the dramatic conclusion of an intriguing mystery.

 

STRETCH GOAL ANNOUNCED!

 

If our campaign reaches $100,000, EVERY backer will get an EXCLUSIVE 3D pop-up vignette of a stand-alone, Mysterious Case moment - designed by Robert Sabuda!

This pop-up will be EXCLUSIVE to the campaign. While we hope to continue offering our Mysterious Cases after the campaign ends (though we can't guarantee our current low prices), this pop-up will ONLY be available to you, our supportive and faithful Indiegogo backers!

 

Exercise your detective skills from the comfort of your armchair!

These boxes contain:
  • An intriguing tale of mystery to solve
  • Tactile, hands-on puzzles
  • Codes and ciphers to crack
  • Photos, letters, postcards, and other ephemeral clues
  • Paper pop-up items and other unique objects
  • Specially designed Cipher Lock key-safes
  • AND MORE!

 

We’re raising funds to produce the first three Mysterious Cases:

 

 

Mysterious Case No. 117:
The Kidnapped Crossworder

 

 

An underground den of gangsters where everyone is keeping secrets. A vanished inventor…a million motives.


Ms. Angela B. has invented a new game. Eager to show it off, she brings it to her local crossword puzzle enthusiasts’ club. However, the prototype is stolen soon afterwards, and she begins to suspect her fellow club members of foul play. She sets about gathering evidence…only to disappear herself.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


The Kidnapped Crossworder is a code breaker’s dream, with puzzles galore and a winding plot full of secretive characters. Decode the mystery of the stolen prototype and the secret of its vanished inventor!
 

 

Mysterious Case No. 238:
The Druids’ Catacomb

 

 

A curious traveler discovers an ancient tunnel and a gauntlet of tests. But as his explorations deepen, the questions only multiply, and something is lying in wait…

 


An ancient megalithic stone structure has collapsed in a forest in Europe, and Dr. Richard Wise has arrived to assess the damage. As he sets about documenting the site, he finds an entrance to a series of underground chambers, evidently untouched for thousands of years.

 

 

 

 

 


The chambers have been perfectly preserved, and as he explores, he discovers a peculiar wooden box, locked and covered in ancient Celtic carvings. What tests lie within? And are these tunnels as empty as they claim to be?

 

 

 

 

 


Can you solve the mystery of The Druid’s Catacomb? Like a Russian nesting doll, this Mysterious Case contains a box within a box, within a box, within a box, with each puzzle providing the solution to open the next. You’ve never experienced tactile tasks like these before!
 

 

Mysterious Case No. 354:

The Star-Crossed Scientists

 

 

Two brilliant minds, two unforgiving societies. How can they
be together when everyone wants them apart? Travel back in
time and around the world to reveal the mystery!

 



She’s a brilliant researcher at one of the most prestigious universities in Victorian England...


...he’s a passionate and reckless expert funded by the greatest wildlife society of all time.



It seems everyone, and everything, is working to keep them apart. Can they overcome the odds and find a place for themselves in a savage world? Follow the clues, unlock secrets, and reveal who is behind the devious plot!

 

 

As a special bonus, Star-Crossed Scientists contains something not seen since 19th century Victorian England: a mechanical drawing automaton!

 

That's right folks:

 

 

Turn the crank, and your final clue is
  DRAWN BEFORE YOUR VERY EYES!  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Q&A:

 

I’m familiar with Robert Sabuda’s work. Will there be paper engineered objects in the Mysterious Cases?

 

Yes, indeed!  We’ll be including pop-ups and other fabulous paper-folded objects in each Mysterious Case! We’re also putting our mechanical engineering skills to the test: Robert is quite inspired by mechanical automata and we’re thrilled that the Star-Crossed Scientists will include a working drawing machine that he’s developed!  We’ve also designed specially made paper Cipher Locks, which allow keys to be locked away until the right puzzles are solved and the key is revealed.

 

 

 

Can a Mysterious Case be played again? What if I want to give it to a friend after I play it?

 

 

Yes, we’ll have a page on the new Mysterious Case website with directions for how each Mysterious Case can be returned to its original set-up. We also plan to include extras of any materials that are used during play.

Think of Mysterious Cases like mystery novels – you might not be able to play one again right away, but put it on a shelf for a while, and you’ll forget enough details to enjoy it again. You’ll also enjoy re-living the experience when watching your friends give it a try!

 

 

 

What is the age range?

 

We want these boxes to be fun for all ages. The puzzles may be challenging for younger audiences on their own, but the stories’ content will be family friendly if you intend to work on the Mysterious Case together with young sleuths. However, there are small pieces, so please be aware of potential choking hazards. There are NO edible clues!

 

 

 

What goes into the cost of Mysterious Cases?

 

In our research leading up to this campaign, we’ve discovered there’s really nothing quite like the Mysterious Cases available anywhere! This means we’ll have to do a lot of planning, organizing, and sourcing to manufacture the Mysterious Cases. However, this isn’t our first rodeo! We’ve worked closely with overseas manufacturers on high quality, hand-assembled, complex projects for many years.

 

 

 

When will my Mysterious Cases arrive?

 

We’re aiming for a 2017 release date, and will keep all of you Armchair Detectives up to date!

 

 

 

 

Will my Mysterious Case have everything shown in the photos on this campaign?

 

Our intentions are to have everything you see here (and more!) included in your Mysterious Cases. However, the photos are prototypes and are subject to slight changes.


Mentioned on:

story:
Welcome!


We would like to invite you to support our second crowdfunding campaign dedicated to high quality resin miniatures. All of them are compatible with Fantasy Battles: The 9th Age.

 

During our first campaign we showed our possibilities and strong orientation for reaching customers needs and vision of miniatures. Also projects presented in this campaign were started some time ago and developed with The 9th Age community to be as good as it was possible. Our very talented sculptors, artists and manufacturers are doing all their best to provide you with the best products possible. We have hope, and strongly believe, that you will enjoy what you see below.

 

Your support is very important for us. While we see that our products are still needed we will run future releases. So thank you in advance to give us that possibility.
 

 

What our process look like:

1. 3D sculpt

 

1b. 3D sculpt of alternative options (as stretched goal)

 

2. Printing than casting resin models

 

3. Professional painting (as special option)

 

 

All 3D sculpts has already been made. We need your help to invest in production molds and materials. Also stretch goals will help us raise finds to make some alternative versions and options for our miniatures, which for sure you will also like as base versions. 

We would like you to contribute during the development with your ideas. Please send emails (hiddendreamsminiatures@gmail.com), make comments here or post on Facebook, telling us any suggestions you may have. Your ideas will be base of mentioned before alternative options. Some of them we noticed during the development process but there is still a chance to integrate yours. You will feel that your ideas are coming alive.

As mentioned in the process example, for those of you that don't particularly enjoy painting miniatures and view it more as a chore that needs to be done, Hidden Dreams will also paint your miniatures with a color scheme of your choice and send you the finished models.

 

 

At the bottom of the site there is a list showing the current status of models sold required to make alternative options of the miniatures and that status will be updated over time. All presented miniatures will be cast. The question is only which ones will receive their alternatives.

One last thing: the delivery times are an approximation. Everything should be delivered in time, but some things could be delayed, while others could be faster. The delivery times are flexible at this point and will be changed based on the demand for specific miniatures. We will do our best to provide them at least in March 2017 and this is a very real date.

 

 

So if you like the look of the miniatures below, please support us, so we can create them for you. If you know someone who might be interested, tell him/her about this crowdfunding campaign. Visit and like our Facebook page and please spread the word wherever you can.

And last but not least we would like to thank everyone who supports our company. We would also like to thank the crew of The 9th Age, and everyone who is involved in the development of that great project. See you all on battlefield!

 

 

Offer:

1. Dictator on Vermin Hulk Bodyguard

25€ standard / 75€ painted

1b. Alternative will be unlocked after 25 sold Dictator models

 

2. Shaman

20€ standard / 55€ painted

2b. Alternative will be unlocked after 25 sold Shaman models

 

3. King on War Throne

40€ standard / 130€ painted

3b. King on War Throne (without bearers)

25€ standard / 75€ painted

3c. Alternative will be unlocked after 25 sold King models

 

4. Cuatl Lord

30€ standard / 80€ painted

4b. Alternative will be unlocked after 25 sold Cuatl models

 

5. Scourge of Wrath / Daemon Prince

35€ standard / 90€ painted

5b. Scourge of Wrath / Daemon Prince with weapon set and scenic base

50€ standard / 105€ painted

5c. Next alternative will be unlocked after 30 sold Scourge models

 

6. Duke / Knight

15€ standard / 55€ painted

6b. Alternative will be unlocked after 25 sold Duke models

 

7.Lord of Fightin'

(not finished completely - still some details to add)

10€ standard / 30€ painted

7b. Alternative will be unlocked after 20 sold Lord models

 

8. SPECIAL OFFER - Sylvan Elves Pack

30€ standard / 100€ painted

8b. Alternative set

Some new possibilities of assembly below, but there are much, much, more!

45€ whole presented set

55€ whole presented set + additional Elk body (possibility to make 2 miniatures)

 

9. Firstborn on Raptor

+ additional head!

15€ standard / 55€ painted

 

10. BONUS OFFER - Music and Standard bearer (Blade Dancers)

12€ for 1 set (2 miniatures)

 

11. BONUS OFFER - Grenadiers

 

20€ for Set of 4 x bodies; 5 x heads; 16 x hands; 4 x tails

35€ for Set of 8 x bodies; 10 x heads; 32 x hands; 8 x tails

65€ for Set of 16 x bodies; 20 x heads; 64 x hands; 16 x tails

 

 

Actual status of unlocking miniature alternatives

1. Dictator on Vermin Hulk Bodyguard 13/25

2. Shaman 0/25

3. King on War Throne 0/25

4. Cuatl Lord 3/25

5. Scourge of Wrath / Daemon Prince 2/30

6. Duke / Knight 8/25

7. Lord of Fightin' 2/20

 

 

Summary of prices:

 

 

Bonus!

You can also buy some miniatures from Sylvan Elves campaign and this is last call for them!

 

 

With bigger orders it is possible to negotiate prices. Do not hesitate to email us. hiddendreamsminiatures@gmail.com or via other media

Payment is through PayPal, but if you prefer some other way, email us at hiddendreamsminiatures@gmail.com
 

Visit us also on

https://www.facebook.com/HiddenDreamsMiniatures

All presented miniatures will be cast. The question is only which ones will receive their alternatives.One last thing: the delivery times are an approximation. Everything should be delivered in time, but some things could be delayed, while others could be faster. The delivery times are flexible at this point and will be changed based on the demand for specific miniatures. We will do our best to provide them at least in March 2017 and this is a very real date.
 

 
So if you like the look of the miniatures below, please support us, so we can create them for you. If you know someone who might be interested, tell him/her about this crowdfunding campaign. Visit and like our Facebook page and please spread the word wherever you can.And last but not least we would like to thank everyone who supports our company. We would also like to thank the crew of The 9th Age, and everyone who is involved in the development of that great project. See you all on battlefield!

story:
“Crippled God Foundry” is a new company based in Greece created by people who are passionate with role playing games, board games, miniature modeling, painting and sculpting.

We are proud to present our products, the handcrafted modular terrain dungeon tiles and accessories using our best skills in sculpting, molding and casting!

With the mentoring of our associate, master sculptor Michael Kontraros from “Michael Kontraros Collectibles”,  “Crippled God Foundry” brings high detailed modular tile sets and accessories  that enhances the gaming experience of your favorite role playing games!

 

​As gamers in “Crippled God Foundry” we based our modular tile system in the common base size of miniatures and therefore we increased the common square dimensions from 2,5 cm x 2,5 cm to 3cm x 3cm. In this way each flat tile can easily fit 4 miniatures .

In more detail each tile, is 6cm x 6cm, divided into 4 squares of 3cm x 3cm and with 2cm wall height (if there is any). With maximum height of 2 cm, it is easy to move miniatures, dice, and accessories without much effort.

​

- Hand sculpted and hand casted.

- Made from high quality resin.

- Durable, can withstand hard usage.

- Paintable with hobby acrylic paints of your choice.

- Available into two style variations: resin gray or  painted.

- Each Tile comes with and anti slide base to allow a firm grip as you build your scenery. It comes unglued or glued if requested.

​

- Reusable, so with one or more tile sets, can make infinite number of terrain variations!

- Suitable for the heroic scale miniatures and games (25mm-32mm).

 

 

​

Our vision is to deliver best quality and interesting looking terrain, miniatures and accessories for gamers, painters and hobbyists!

Your contribution will help us bring our ideas into creation and you in turn, will be able to enjoy our fine products in your tabletop games and adventures!

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

​

 

We ship worldwide.
All orders will be accompanied with a tracking number which will be send to you.
We are not responsible for any extra customs charges in your country.
For more information about the shipping cost of each perk see the table below:
