story:
Hi, I’m Anastasia, the owner and creator of Tiny Furniture.

For about three years, our small team, has been creating, producing and painting unique miniature accessories for tabletop gaming. We have a huge assortment of small-scale furniture already available; bookshelves, a medieval bakery, tavern accessories, beds, tables, chairs, building accessories, and many other unique miniatures.

With your help and this crowdfunding campaign, we want to blaze a new trail for Tiny Furniture… the creation of miniature characters who live in our small worlds.

The market already has a considerable number of figures to represent the traditional adventurer (knights, wizards, orcs, elves, etc). They fight in battles, defeat the dragons, delve deep into the dungeons, uncover the lost lore and mighty artifacts, sometimes they die heroically… sometimes not so heroically. These are the stories that we tell with miniatures.

But they are never the only actors on the stage. There is a need for the person to be rescued, the one to give the quest or pass on some vital rumor or clue. Someone needs to stand behind the market stall, serve in the church, steal an unguarded coin purse, beg, bake, and entertain. In short, your cities need to breath and be alive.

So, we set out to make our Tiny Villagers. Together with our partners from Evocatus Miniature we have custom designed and developed a 3D line of medieval civilans.

All figures will be printed on a high-quality 3D printer and cast in resin. We already have some of this line completely ready, and would like to ask for support in finishing the line.

Thank you for your support and happy adventuring.

Anastasia.

 

Miniatures

 

1. Young Noble *UNLOCKED*

The young nobleman put down his feather, sealed the letter in an envelope and secured it with a wax seal. He called the servant and said: "Take this letter to the market square and give it to a girl named Angelina, who usually stands at the corner near the stall with vegetables." Looking out the window at the messenger, running across the street, the young duke thought: "Mother will not approve of my choice. As always."

 

2. Old Widow *UNLOCKED*

“I FORBID IT!” - shrieked the Noblewoman.

The nearby servants turned their heads and pretended to go about their work. Lowering her voice to a whisper, but not tempering her fury: “ I forbid you to go hunting. Do you not remember the last time you were nearly gored to death?”

“But Mother, I...” - stammered the young Noble.

“Go to your studies. Forget going hunting. Forget your silly little whore.” - replied the Dowager Duchess, indicating that the conversation was over. 
“She’s not a whore!” - the young Noble yelled as he stormed away up the stairs to his room.

 

3. Thief  *UNLOCKED*

With a predatory glance, Derrick had been watching the young and carefree Nobleman for several blocks. The Noble was currently stopped at a stall selling Persian carpets. Previously he had gone into a perfume shop, a flower shop, a chocolatier, and one of those clothing stores that sold those silly impractical frilly outfits that the grossly rich always seemed to be wearing. The Noble was clearly trying to impress someone… a woman perhaps. His pouch still bulged quite nicely even after all of that spending. This man’s excessiveness irked Derrick, whose daughter Mika had complained just this morning that all they had to eat was moldy corn tortillas. All morning, Derrick had been following the Noble like a secondary shadow, and now he was just waiting for the right moment to strike. Licking his fingers and warming them up, Derrick hid a short, wicked blade in his sleeve and began closing with his target like a shark drawn to blood. Mika would have meat for dinner tonight… and for the rest of the month… maybe even a new dress. 

 

4. Monk *UNLOCKED*

Brother Gregor stood at the walls of the cathedral and gazed attentively upwards while nervously rubbing the smooth wooden beads of his rosary between his hard-calloused hands. His long journey from his small monastery in the mountains had worn on him more than he thought it would. Three days past his sandals had fallen apart, and he had continued the journey barefoot. His food had run out a day ago. Gregor was exhausted but had urgent business that he needed to speak with the Bishop about. Now he stood patiently awaiting the appearance of the Bishop and soon he joined the rapidly growing crowd that had gathered for the day’s sermon. The appearance of His High Holiness with his golden staff consecrated in Rome renewed Gregor’s strength and determination.

 

5. Drinker *UNLOCKED*

The old man, in his dirty rags, was sitting in the mud just outside of the tavern. Staring at the sun through the dirty glass of the bottle that he had emptied hours ago; it’s reflection causing him to squint. Lamenting, his mind wandered to better days. Half a century ago, Archie… then Archibald III was a young man of considerable wealth. Born of noble blood, an owner of a large estate, his life was one of luxury. Then he had a whole cellar filled with the finest wines and liquors to be had. Back then he didn’t believe that his life could be any better, and then fate stepped in and introduced him to the love of his life, the lovely daughter of the Viceroy to the King himself. Countless were the times that he would ride to their castle on the hill, a dashing figure on his magnificent black courser Tempest. He showered her in expensive gifts, reading reams of poetry and forever proclaiming his eternal love. Paulina, was her name; and they had spent several secretive nights in each other’s embrace. Often talking of eloping together. One beautiful spring day, Archibald came to the castle, planning on that being the night that they would run away together. But the guards did not let him enter the castle, turning him away after a scuffle. Archibald vowed to return the very next day, but by then it was too late. Paulina, the reason he drew breath, had been married to another. The months after that are still a blur to Archie… his influential father died in a war, his mother soon after of heartbreak or the plague he wasn’t sure. Most of that time Archie was drunk or getting drunk. He drowned his pain in the wine cellar of his families’ estate. One night, the estate burned down under mysterious circumstances. Soon afterwards he was stripped of his lands and family title. Penniless, loveless, and with nowhere to go Archie retreated to the one place he felt safe… the bottom of a bottle. A shadow fell over him, snapping him hazily back to reality… please don’t let it be Rufus and his gang. I copper coin landed in his lap. Above him towered the young Nobleman that lived on the hill with his widower mother. The dashing young man in a beautiful feathered beret, flashed a grin and squatted to meet his eye. “Archie! Why so glum? It’s a beautiful day, full of promise and love. Go my friend, have a beer on me.” Stumbling to his feet, Archie, bowed with gratitude. “Thank you, my Lord,” he managed to stammer. As the young man walked away, Archie smiled to himself as he flipped the coin in the air. Something in the face of that young noble reminded Archie of himself when he was a lad.

 

6. The Hermit *UNLOCKED*

Ivor, "Old Ivor" to some, comes into town hunched over under the weight of his burden every Sunday. His huge wicker bag is filled to the brim with berries that he collects in the woods. He sets himself up off to the side as not to be in the way of other sellers. Ivor does a fairly brisk business as he sells his berries for a pittance; Ivor is not really interested in making a profit. The reason that Ivor comes to town every week is because he wants to see his estranged daughter. Many years ago she left home, breaking off all contact with him and moved to the city. Her dream was to become a famous actress, working in the city's prestigious theater district. But life had other plans for her; she had fallen on hard times, and now Ivor watches with sadness in his eyes. Seeing his beautiful daughter, dressed as a harlot, attracting customers to a city brothel breaks his heart.

 

7. Gipsy and Boris *UNLOCKED*

Unhooking the chain the man, with the magnificent black mustache, removed the muzzle from the bear. "Well, Boris, it was a hard day, but now it's time for rest", as he gently stroked the bear behind the ears. Boris shook his massive frame, grateful to be free of the muzzle, and rubbed his warm nose against the man's palm.

 

 

8. Apple seller *UNLOCKED*

Marko has always loved prose, in his youth he had been a flashy poet with some promise. But sadly, these days it seemed that people no longer needed beautiful princesses and their brave knights; or at least didn’t want to pay for them. To feed his family Marko purchased a small piece of land, seeded it with apples and worked from sunup to sunset. Over the years he came to appreciate the beauty and unspoken poetry of growing apples. The feeling of the sunrise on his face, the pattern of sweat as it ran from his brow, the smell of a hot pie made with his apples, the smile of a child as they bit into one of his apples. These were all things as worthy of a ballad as any knight to Marko now. Today he is happy coming to the local market and singing the praises of his labor of love; creating beautiful rhymes about his sweet and juicy apples.

 

9. Bishop *UNLOCKED*

From the cathedral baclony, bishop could see the crowds swarming about the market square below. The remnants of his recent meal - rich and dripping with lard - still shone on his chin as he sluggishly thought: "Seems the city is growing , an increase in the tithe may be in order".

 

10. Courtesan *UNLOCKED*

The out of breath servant handed Angelina the letter and hurried off as not to be seen. She was right where his master had said she would be standing on the corner of the market square next to the vegetable stall. The beautiful young courtesan smiled and coyly brought the envelope to her perfect little nose. Closing her eyes, she breathed in deeply the smell of the young noble’s expensive perfume. Slowly she traced the outline of the family crest in the seal, and abruptly she tore the letter unread into several pieces and threw it into a pile of rotting vegetables that had accumulated nearby.

 

11. Herald *UNLOCKED*

Leaving the Cathedral’s heavy iron gates to close behind him, the Herald tucked the large scroll with the Bishop’s new decree under his arm and hurried on his way. Taking a shortcut though the back alleys, he quickly headed towards the town’s square. The smell of the market made him glad that had just recently cleaned his jacket. Cleaning it had not been cheap; but the special herbs that the washer used overpowered the smells of city life, and Belinda loved the scent. Stepping quickly to avoid a pool of what was possibly urine and rotting tomatoes, the Herald ascended the stairs. Taking his place and unfolding the scroll, he quickly scanned the text. Clearing his voice, the Herald spoke loud enough to be heard by all, “Here ye! Hear ye! A proclamation to all good citizens from his Most Holy Excellency. Be it known by all that there will be an increase in church tithes that will take place starting this holy day…” Looking around the courtyard at the crowd of on-lookers that had gathered for their reaction. Did that woman just pick up a rotten tomato out of that urine pool? Letting out a sigh, he resigned himself to wash his beautiful jacket yet again.

 

12. Carpet merchant  *UNLOCKED*

The market was abuzz with all manner of sights, sounds and smells. It was a busy day and business should be brisk. Nabir, however did not share in the excitement that surrounded him. For the tenth time in as many minutes he cursed under his breath, “It is already the fifth hour since I’ve opened and have not sold a single carpet. Curse my luck, and curse these people.” Looking around at the other stalls doing a vigorous business Nabir whispered, “I should have listened to my beloved Elaheh… next time I bring a caravan of dry figs and curcuma.”

 

13. Peasant girl  *UNLOCKED*

The young girl, in the simply cut but neatly maintained dress, danced in and out of the swirling mass of humanity that is the marketplace. Deftly jumping a puddle, ducking under a low stall beam, a swirl of the skirt and she was around an upended cart. Where ever she went smiles and greetings followed her, all of which she returned in kind. People were always glad to see Agnes, and not because she worked for the old noble widow on the hill, but because she was a gentle soul. Arriving at her destination, the vegetable merchant smiled broadly as she approached. After greeting the merchant, Agnes began her inspection of the pumpkins and cabbages. After choosing the best available, she waited while the merchant worked his abacus. “Eight pence” the merchant said. Agnes frowned slightly, “Not five days ago this would have only been four pence,” narrowing her eyes she continued, “this seems a little greedy to me Peter.” The merchant looked at the ground, and nudged some dirt with his boot, “I’m sorry Agnes, but I cannot sell my vegetables at my old prices anymore. Last week the Bishop almost doubled the church tithe. I cannot survive and feed my own family at that loss.” Agnes sighed, some of the light leaving her face. Resigned, she put the cabbage back on the stall, shook her head and thought, “My lady will surely curse me again.”

 

STRETCH GOALS

 

14. Minstrel - $3000 *UNLOCKED*

 

15. Sleeping City Guard $3500 *UNLOCKED*

 

16. Blacksmith apprentice with a bunch of swords $4000 *UNLOCKED*

 

17. Curious girl in a flower wreath $4500 *UNLOCKED*

 

18. Soothsayer gypsy woman $5000 *UNLOCKED*

 

19. Blacksmith $5500 *UNLOCKED*

 

20. Baker $6000 *UNLOCKED*

 

21. Innkeeper $6500 *UNLOCKED*

22. Boy with hoop and stick  $7000 *UNLOCKED*

 

23. Hunter with his prey  $7500 *LOCKED*

24. Prisoner in chains $8000 *LOCKED*

25. Cripple $8500 *LOCKED*

 

Road Map

An optimistic view of the "Tiny Market Square" campaign future below.

November-December 2018: prototyping

January 2019: making initial molds, begin casting

February 2019: Casting, casting, casting

March 2019: Casting continues and shipping starts

April 2019: no casting anymore! Shipping the last part of orders.

 

Risks and challenges

Risks to this project are minimal. We do mold making and casting every day. And have been doing so for almost 3 years as a small workshop. 3d printing of prototypes is made by us too.

We cast miniatures in resin. And it is an intensive manual labor without any automatization. Casting 10 units or casting 1000 units, its the same amount of time and work to produce each piece. 
If the project is particularly successful, then this may overstretch our current capacity. If so, we will expand production with new staff and equipment. 

This kind of miniature manufacturing is what we have been doing for years. There is nothing out of the ordinary workflow. Everything will be produced to our usual high standard.

 

Special thanks to:

"Evocatus miniature" team for amazing sculpts and ideas;

Chris Suess and @hpstorian for the help in texts edition;

George Seryapov for the sketches.
story_txt:
Hi, I’m Anastasia, the owner and creator of Tiny Furniture.

For about three years, our small team, has been creating, producing and painting unique miniature accessories for tabletop gaming. We have a huge assortment of small-scale furniture already available; bookshelves, a medieval bakery, tavern accessories, beds, tables, chairs, building accessories, and many other unique miniatures.
With your help and this crowdfunding campaign, we want to blaze a new trail for Tiny Furniture… the creation of miniature characters who live in our small worlds.
The market already has a considerable number of figures to represent the traditional adventurer (knights, wizards, orcs, elves, etc). They fight in battles, defeat the dragons, delve deep into the dungeons, uncover the lost lore and mighty artifacts, sometimes they die heroically… sometimes not so heroically. These are the stories that we tell with miniatures.
But they are never the only actors on the stage. There is a need for the person to be rescued, the one to give the quest or pass on some vital rumor or clue. Someone needs to stand behind the market stall, serve in the church, steal an unguarded coin purse, beg, bake, and entertain. In short, your cities need to breath and be alive.
So, we set out to make our Tiny Villagers. Together with our partners from Evocatus Miniature we have custom designed and developed a 3D line of medieval civilans.
All figures will be printed on a high-quality 3D printer and cast in resin. We already have some of this line completely ready, and would like to ask for support in finishing the line.
Thank you for your support and happy adventuring.
Anastasia.
 

Miniatures
 
1. Young Noble *UNLOCKED*

The young nobleman put down his feather, sealed the letter in an envelope and secured it with a wax seal. He called the servant and said: "Take this letter to the market square and give it to a girl named Angelina, who usually stands at the corner near the stall with vegetables." Looking out the window at the messenger, running across the street, the young duke thought: "Mother will not approve of my choice. As always."
 
2. Old Widow *UNLOCKED*

“I FORBID IT!” - shrieked the Noblewoman.
The nearby servants turned their heads and pretended to go about their work. Lowering her voice to a whisper, but not tempering her fury: “ I forbid you to go hunting. Do you not remember the last time you were nearly gored to death?”
“But Mother, I...” - stammered the young Noble.
“Go to your studies. Forget going hunting. Forget your silly little whore.” - replied the Dowager Duchess, indicating that the conversation was over. “She’s not a whore!” - the young Noble yelled as he stormed away up the stairs to his room.
 
3. Thief  *UNLOCKED*


With a predatory glance, Derrick had been watching the young and carefree Nobleman for several blocks. The Noble was currently stopped at a stall selling Persian carpets. Previously he had gone into a perfume shop, a flower shop, a chocolatier, and one of those clothing stores that sold those silly impractical frilly outfits that the grossly rich always seemed to be wearing. The Noble was clearly trying to impress someone… a woman perhaps. His pouch still bulged quite nicely even after all of that spending. This man’s excessiveness irked Derrick, whose daughter Mika had complained just this morning that all they had to eat was moldy corn tortillas. All morning, Derrick had been following the Noble like a secondary shadow, and now he was just waiting for the right moment to strike. Licking his fingers and warming them up, Derrick hid a short, wicked blade in his sleeve and began closing with his target like a shark drawn to blood. Mika would have meat for dinner tonight… and for the rest of the month… maybe even a new dress. 
 
4. Monk *UNLOCKED*


Brother Gregor stood at the walls of the cathedral and gazed attentively upwards while nervously rubbing the smooth wooden beads of his rosary between his hard-calloused hands. His long journey from his small monastery in the mountains had worn on him more than he thought it would. Three days past his sandals had fallen apart, and he had continued the journey barefoot. His food had run out a day ago. Gregor was exhausted but had urgent business that he needed to speak with the Bishop about. Now he stood patiently awaiting the appearance of the Bishop and soon he joined the rapidly growing crowd that had gathered for the day’s sermon. The appearance of His High Holiness with his golden staff consecrated in Rome renewed Gregor’s strength and determination.
 
5. Drinker *UNLOCKED*


The old man, in his dirty rags, was sitting in the mud just outside of the tavern. Staring at the sun through the dirty glass of the bottle that he had emptied hours ago; it’s reflection causing him to squint. Lamenting, his mind wandered to better days. Half a century ago, Archie… then Archibald III was a young man of considerable wealth. Born of noble blood, an owner of a large estate, his life was one of luxury. Then he had a whole cellar filled with the finest wines and liquors to be had. Back then he didn’t believe that his life could be any better, and then fate stepped in and introduced him to the love of his life, the lovely daughter of the Viceroy to the King himself. Countless were the times that he would ride to their castle on the hill, a dashing figure on his magnificent black courser Tempest. He showered her in expensive gifts, reading reams of poetry and forever proclaiming his eternal love. Paulina, was her name; and they had spent several secretive nights in each other’s embrace. Often talking of eloping together. One beautiful spring day, Archibald came to the castle, planning on that being the night that they would run away together. But the guards did not let him enter the castle, turning him away after a scuffle. Archibald vowed to return the very next day, but by then it was too late. Paulina, the reason he drew breath, had been married to another. The months after that are still a blur to Archie… his influential father died in a war, his mother soon after of heartbreak or the plague he wasn’t sure. Most of that time Archie was drunk or getting drunk. He drowned his pain in the wine cellar of his families’ estate. One night, the estate burned down under mysterious circumstances. Soon afterwards he was stripped of his lands and family title. Penniless, loveless, and with nowhere to go Archie retreated to the one place he felt safe… the bottom of a bottle. A shadow fell over him, snapping him hazily back to reality… please don’t let it be Rufus and his gang. I copper coin landed in his lap. Above him towered the young Nobleman that lived on the hill with his widower mother. The dashing young man in a beautiful feathered beret, flashed a grin and squatted to meet his eye. “Archie! Why so glum? It’s a beautiful day, full of promise and love. Go my friend, have a beer on me.” Stumbling to his feet, Archie, bowed with gratitude. “Thank you, my Lord,” he managed to stammer. As the young man walked away, Archie smiled to himself as he flipped the coin in the air. Something in the face of that young noble reminded Archie of himself when he was a lad.
 
6. The Hermit *UNLOCKED*


Ivor, "Old Ivor" to some, comes into town hunched over under the weight of his burden every Sunday. His huge wicker bag is filled to the brim with berries that he collects in the woods. He sets himself up off to the side as not to be in the way of other sellers. Ivor does a fairly brisk business as he sells his berries for a pittance; Ivor is not really interested in making a profit. The reason that Ivor comes to town every week is because he wants to see his estranged daughter. Many years ago she left home, breaking off all contact with him and moved to the city. Her dream was to become a famous actress, working in the city's prestigious theater district. But life had other plans for her; she had fallen on hard times, and now Ivor watches with sadness in his eyes. Seeing his beautiful daughter, dressed as a harlot, attracting customers to a city brothel breaks his heart.
 
7. Gipsy and Boris *UNLOCKED*


Unhooking the chain the man, with the magnificent black mustache, removed the muzzle from the bear. "Well, Boris, it was a hard day, but now it's time for rest", as he gently stroked the bear behind the ears. Boris shook his massive frame, grateful to be free of the muzzle, and rubbed his warm nose against the man's palm.
 
 
8. Apple seller *UNLOCKED*


Marko has always loved prose, in his youth he had been a flashy poet with some promise. But sadly, these days it seemed that people no longer needed beautiful princesses and their brave knights; or at least didn’t want to pay for them. To feed his family Marko purchased a small piece of land, seeded it with apples and worked from sunup to sunset. Over the years he came to appreciate the beauty and unspoken poetry of growing apples. The feeling of the sunrise on his face, the pattern of sweat as it ran from his brow, the smell of a hot pie made with his apples, the smile of a child as they bit into one of his apples. These were all things as worthy of a ballad as any knight to Marko now. Today he is happy coming to the local market and singing the praises of his labor of love; creating beautiful rhymes about his sweet and juicy apples.
 
9. Bishop *UNLOCKED*


From the cathedral baclony, bishop could see the crowds swarming about the market square below. The remnants of his recent meal - rich and dripping with lard - still shone on his chin as he sluggishly thought: "Seems the city is growing , an increase in the tithe may be in order".
 

10. Courtesan *UNLOCKED*


The out of breath servant handed Angelina the letter and hurried off as not to be seen. She was right where his master had said she would be standing on the corner of the market square next to the vegetable stall. The beautiful young courtesan smiled and coyly brought the envelope to her perfect little nose. Closing her eyes, she breathed in deeply the smell of the young noble’s expensive perfume. Slowly she traced the outline of the family crest in the seal, and abruptly she tore the letter unread into several pieces and threw it into a pile of rotting vegetables that had accumulated nearby.
 
11. Herald *UNLOCKED*


Leaving the Cathedral’s heavy iron gates to close behind him, the Herald tucked the large scroll with the Bishop’s new decree under his arm and hurried on his way. Taking a shortcut though the back alleys, he quickly headed towards the town’s square. The smell of the market made him glad that had just recently cleaned his jacket. Clearing his voice, the Herald spoke loud enough to be heard by all, “Here ye! Hear ye! A proclamation to all good citizens from his Most Holy Excellency. Be it known by all that there will be an increase in church tithes that will take place starting this holy day…” Looking around the courtyard at the crowd of on-lookers that had gathered for their reaction. Did that woman just pick up a rotten tomato out of that urine pool? Letting out a sigh, he resigned himself to wash his beautiful jacket yet again.

The market was abuzz with all manner of sights, sounds and smells. It was a busy day and business should be brisk. Nabir, however did not share in the excitement that surrounded him. For the tenth time in as many minutes he cursed under his breath, “It is already the fifth hour since I’ve opened and have not sold a single carpet. Curse my luck, and curse these people.” Looking around at the other stalls doing a vigorous business Nabir whispered, “I should have listened to my beloved Elaheh… next time I bring a caravan of dry figs and curcuma.”

The young girl, in the simply cut but neatly maintained dress, danced in and out of the swirling mass of humanity that is the marketplace. Where ever she went smiles and greetings followed her, all of which she returned in kind. Resigned, she put the cabbage back on the stall, shook her head and thought, “My lady will surely curse me again.”

15. Sleeping City Guard $3500 *UNLOCKED*

17. Curious girl in a flower wreath $4500 *UNLOCKED*

 
18. Soothsayer gypsy woman $5000 *UNLOCKED*

 
19. Blacksmith $5500 *UNLOCKED*

 
20. Baker $6000 *UNLOCKED*

 
21. Innkeeper $6500 *UNLOCKED*

An optimistic view of the "Tiny Market Square" campaign future below.
November-December 2018: prototyping
January 2019: making initial molds, begin casting
February 2019: Casting, casting, casting
March 2019: Casting continues and shipping starts
April 2019: no casting anymore! Shipping the last part of orders.
 
Risks and challenges
Risks to this project are minimal. We do mold making and casting every day. And have been doing so for almost 3 years as a small workshop. 3d printing of prototypes is made by us too.
We cast miniatures in resin. And it is an intensive manual labor without any automatization. Casting 10 units or casting 1000 units, its the same amount of time and work to produce each piece. If the project is particularly successful, then this may overstretch our current capacity. If so, we will expand production with new staff and equipment.

story:
Skyline Chess is a company founded by two London based architects, Chris and Ian. We take iconic architecture from around the world and reimagine it as pieces on a chessboard, allowing you to play with your favourite cities and pit them against each other.

The concept was first conceived when we shared a flat together and would play chess in the evenings. The idea grew out of a conversation about whether we could replace the classic pieces with our favourite buildings. This led us to design and develop our first set, based on the skyline of our hometown, London.

Following the success of the London edition, we are delighted to present the next skyline in our range - New York City.

Having visited this city many times, its inspirational and iconic high-rise architecture made it the perfect choice for us to bring to the chessboard.  

We've chosen a range of buildings from across the city, some of which capture the essence of the early 1900's construction boom and the growth of skyscraper architecture, through to their more contemporary counterparts, along with some of the city's most recognisable silhouettes.

 

We gave careful consideration to selecting each piece on the board, to ensure that it both visually reflected the appropriate chess piece and also reflected the architectural status and scale of that building in the city.

  • King - One World Trade Tower 
  • Queen - Empire State Building 
  • Bishop - Chrysler Building 
  • Knight - Flatiron Building 
  • Rook - Guggenheim Museum 
  • Pawn - Brownstone House 
 

After we made these initial choices, we modelled and then 3D printed our prototype set, to make sure the scale and proportions were suitable for play. From there, we will develop the pieces further to ensure they can be injection moulded - including the design of a cavity inside each piece for a metal weight core to be inserted, to ensure a pleasing weight on the chess board.

We are funding on Kickstarter to allow us to complete our first production run of sets and packaging - this will allow us to produce the full 32 piece chess set, complete with presentation box and folding board. Each set contains an information sheet with details on each building and how to set up the board.

We have a number of different options available for pre-order:

 

We are now taking pre-orders with delivery anticipated in September. We will keep you fully updated as the the progress of manufacturing as we go.

story:
A Grave Yard Mega Set is a 35 piece terrain set containing the following:

 

Pelage levels


 12 piece Grave Stone resin set.

 4 piece column set,

 5 piece set of monuments

 7 piece coffin set

 4 piece Grave yard fence set,

 a singe barrow,

 a multi peace grave yard,

One mausoleum.

 

TMS

If you run a hobby store and want to support our campaign, we're happy to offer you proper retailers terms. You can support via KS or  by direct contact, either way will guarantee you delivery at the same time as our individual backers.

Please contact us via private message or via e-mail artur@tabletop-miniatures-solutions.com

story:
It all comes down to this:

The Game is ready, and we have populated the cards with characters and stills from the Submerge movies, but we STILL NEED CARD ART! This creates a bottleneck for us, and an opportunity for you.

We can and will:

  • Send you the whole shiny, violent and mind-bending game with original professional art!
  • Label this release First Edition for this campaign only
  • Offer awesome bonus items, like your very own card bearing your lovable face
  • Update the game with each and every new Submerge movie
  • Ship the games by January 31st, 2020

What you can get!

1. One (or more) Deck(s) of Submerge; The Card Game in a Printed Box and Easy Instructions - $20 each

2. One (or more) Deck(s) of Submerge: The Card Game in Shrink Wrap and a link to online instructions - $15 each

3. One (or more) Deck(s) of Submerge: The Card Game with Customization. We will add your face and name to a Leadership card (Choose Krag or Rebel) with Printed Box and Easy Instructions - $35 each

4. One (or more) Deck(s) of Submerge: The Card Game with Printed Box and Easy Instructions, plus a limited edition Submerge Poster signed by fimmaker Demtrius LeSean Witherspoon - $30

5. One (or more) Giant, Tarot Card Sized Deck(s) of Submerge: The Card Game with Print Box and Easy Instructions - $50

6. One (or more) Deck(s) of Submerge: The Card Game with Printed Box and Easy Instructions, plus the entire series of Submerge movies on DVD, signed by filmmaker Demtrius LeSean Witherspoon - $100 (Echo 51, Ni're Reborn, The Chronicals of Ni're, and The Frozen Land.

​Stay Tuned for the latest Submerge Movie:

BLUE STAR

Possible Risk:

  • Shipments may unavoidably delayed if art is delayed
  • In the event that art is delayed passed 1/31/2020, you will have the option of cancelling your support with a full refund

Thank you so much for your support of Submerge: The Card Game, the Universe of Submerge, and all the actors, filmmakers, writers and artists that have contributed to this singular vision.

In the event that art is delayed passed 1/31/2020, you will have the option of cancelling your support with a full refund
Thank you so much for your support of Submerge: The Card Game, the Universe of Submerge, and all the actors, filmmakers, writers and artists that have contributed to this singular vision.

story:
What's Happening

You know what's wrong with our generation? We play games with no religious content.

We forget about hakodosh boruch hu while we engage in gashmiyus and leitzonus. 

Kiruv vs. Orthodoxy is here to change that. You can continue to engage in halchah, hashkafah, and machshava of Judaism, The Best Religion in The Fucking World TM, even whilst socializing with your friends (of the same gender, obviously). 

A History of the Jewish People

This idea started as a personal project, and after just a few short nights of going to sleep way too late, had blossomed into 180 cards of highly offensive Cards against Humanity-style of cards. (This game is not in any way affiliated with that brand)

The Hashgacha of the number 18 couldn't be overlooked, and I initially uploaded it to my own humble site, and shared them to Reddit. There, people asked to buy them and I was like, why, taka, fucking not? 

So here we are. Collecting a few good men (women, you don't exist) to join together and get these cards printed in a way that's worth my while. If we can raise $500 or more I'll take the time to print these cards and get us all playing this shit. You know you want to. 

So, What Does This Thing Look Like

Like I'd show you before you paid? But here are a few choice examples.

Sfardi Cards:

  • The meaning of life is simple. It's ____ .
  • Mrs. Epstein, I'm afraid we caught your son ____ .
  • Raboysay, it's time we stopped ____ .

Ashkenazi Cards:

  • The gimatriyah of your name, minus one
  • Taking the bone out of the fish and not, chas v'shalom, the other way around
  • Drowning in a lake because you went swimming during sfira like a total dumbass
  • The fiery fury of God's omnipotent love
  • Like, literally eating pig

Why I'm Doing This

I'm not about to get rich off this, I just hope I don't lose money. Catering to the niche OTD/Frum-yet-cool niche is not a very lucrative model. But I care about you, because you are my bros. 

And it was cathartic for me to create these cards, and then masturbationally refresh my own site endlessly to see the random combinations it generated, and I hope it might be cathartic/healing/entertaining for you too. 

Something about taking these concepts that are touted ad-nausem and used to abuse and manipulate our emotional world, and seeing just how interchangeable they are, and how they are applied in every fucking (yes, I like this word a lot. I only recently learned how to use it. Am I doing it wrong?) opportunity, helped put things in perspective.

The Halachic Details

The game is played as follows, in the style of Apples to Apples or Cards against Humanity. 

  1. Each player receives 7 (the holiest of numbers) Ashkenazi (white) cards
  2. The Sfardi (black) cards are put face down in the middle
  3. The person who said asher yatzar last becomes the Card Nazi and turns over a Sfardi card
  4. Everyone picks an Ashkenazi card from their hand that they feel best matches the Sfardi card in question
  5. Is there a right answer? No! Elu v'elu divrei elokim chayim! The Card Nazi must Pasken which card they like the most, based off their own svara and understanding of the sugya
  6. Whoever submitted the card they pick is the winner of that round, and gets to keep that Sfardi card.
  7. Play continues with the player to the right (a very holy direction) beocming the next Card Nazi and turning over another Sfardi card
  8. The game ends when everyone is completely sick of playing or it's time for kriyas shma of shachris, whichever comes first, and the person with the most Sfardi cards wins (this is just one example of how this game is different than real life)

What's in The Box?

First off, who said there will be a box?

There's gonna hopefully be 180 cards. If you pledge over $5, you'll get a digital version of them right away. Over $18 (plus shipping), and I'll print a set and send them to you. 

I can't guarantee that they will be exactly like Cards against Humanity, but they'll definitely be usable, tangible products that you can hold in your hands (which is better than a lot of the other ideas you've been sold on in the past).

One interesting option is to actually combine these cards with a regular CaH deck and see what happens when you combine Mashiach and Auschwitz (my favorite card, and obviously yours as well).

So yeah, manage your expectations, but don't curb your enthusiasm. This is gonna be great. If you weren't already, this game will send you to hell faster than you can say "pass the cholent".

Haskamos and Brachos

This project has haskamos from the greatest minds of the generation, who came together from arguing about absolutely everything to agree that "this was the best fucking game they had ever seen, and whoever backs it will be zoche to a ton of yeshuos and his family definitely WILL NOT get ANY corona."

Names of specific rabbis will be photoshopped upon request. 

View the permanent home of these cards on the Kiruv Vs. Humanity main site, and generate your own random pairs and download the complete set. Generate your own cards here.

story:
The Project

We’ve all had those moments of ecstasy when we get the dice result we wanted, against the odds or uphill, and of course those moments too when it all turns to faecal matter. One thing that will make you smile though is my idea for this project – CASUALTY DICE! This in a nutshell is quite a simple concept, if you are rolling for injury then, whatever the outcome, it’s fun because you get to potentially ruin someone’s day (if you are into that sort of thing) or at the very least remove players from the game.

The project comprises of two dice, one 6-sided laser engraved 16mm Opaque White Die and the other an 8-sided Translucent Red Die. You will in all likelihood be familiar with this mechanic for your favourite Fantasy Football Game. My dice design for this project shows clearly what the result is. No fumbling about getting the two numbers mixed up etc. In an instant you see what’s happened because the sides of the dice are specifically designed this way, and should you require more information detailing the seriousness of the injury, you will be able to reference the handy high quality reference card included with each set of dice backed.

Casualty Dice Sets

How to Order Advanced D8's with League Deals

To do this you need to use the ‘BACK IT’ button that sits above the Perks and below the Campaign Progress Bar on the campaign webpage. When you click ‘Back It’ it will ask for a ‘Donation Amount’. Here you need to add a figure that covers your requirement. So for example, if you require two Advanced D8’s, you would enter £7 x the number of D8’s you require, in this case, 2. Perhaps five backers would like to upgrade out of ten of your Medium League Deal, that would be £7 x 5 = £35 Donation.

Once you’ve made that Donation take a look at your ORIGINAL LEAGUE DEAL ORDER DETAILS. Take a note of your ‘Order ID’ (a two or three digit number). Once you have that number you can then use the Contact Button to send me a message. Here you will be able tell me your order number, how many Advanced D8’s you require and the colours required. It’s VERY important that those details are given to me so I can complete your order and ship to you on time at no extra cost to you.

If you have any problems during the process of upgrading please do not hesitate to contact me via this website, Facebook, Twitter or Email on charlievictorproducts@gmail.com - I’m here to help.

The Six Sides Of The Casualty Dice

The Eight Sides Of The Advanced D8

Double Sided Reference Card

 

The dice icons are designed specifically with a medical theme in mind, with the exclusive use of the red and white colours. I've always felt that Dice should communicate to you and your opponent the result with immediacy, and a good, simple and clean design does just that and that's what I have produced for this project.

I will end this project introduction by simply saying that using a set of dice for one specific purpose is great fun. I love to roll these dice and actively look forward to getting to use them against my opponent, and I'm sure you will too! These dice have my love of Fantasy Football, my creativity and my energy poured into them, and I hope you can be part of the journey to bring them to the community for all to enjoy.

Stretch Goals

It's my pleasure to introduce the Stretch Goals to you all. When the Campaign hits each Stretch Goal Target I will produce a card for every set of dice backed. So each person who gets a set of dice will also get a card for each stretch goal unlocked. Now is the time to talk to friends in the community to help push and unlock these goals for all to enjoy.

 

Allow Me To Introduce Myself

My name is Duncan, I’m a 37-year-old self-employed designer with 20+ years of industry experience, living in Leicester, UK. I’m also the founder and current Commissioner of the Leicester Blood Bowl League (LBBL). Ask anyone who knows me from the LBBL and they will tell you one thing (actually might be more than one) - I’m fanatical about DICE! It’s not just that I like to collect dice, but I also love to CREATE dice!

As a designer and dice fanatic I have a good feel for what dice should look like and how they should perform. My first dice project was to produce my very own Block Dice; I wanted to pour my creativity into something other then my day-to-day job's requirements. I produced around 100 sets Block Dice and have successfully shared these with Blood Bowl leagues and fellow fanatics around the world. I just love to produce design, no matter how small or large the idea. I get a real kick out seeing people using products I have created, and this is where I hope you, the community can come in and help my vision for these Casualty Dice become a reality. Here is a selection of my previous creative work, some of which you may recognise. 

Your Contribution and What You Will Receive

This project does not aim to break any technological bounds nor does it pretend to be anything other then an opportunity for me to bring my design ideas to life, and for you in the community to have fun with them. It’s in my nature to share and I very much want to share this with you.

I’m deliberately using laser engraving because despite it being more expensive, it’s by far the best quality finish and has an increased longevity over any other type of production process.

Individual backers, will receive 1 x Set of Injury Dice: this includes 1 x engraved D6 and 1 x D8. You will also receive a handy double-sided quick reference card to help you communicate in detail to your distraught opponent how bad their day just got.

The Advanced Individual Set includes 1 x Set of Injury Dice: this includes 1 x engraved D6 and 1 x Advanced D8 in a choice of three colours. This removes the need for the Reference Card, but you will still get this and a copy of all the unlocked Stretch Goals regardless.

There are now many Perk options, so please feel free to take a look and see which one fits you.

Perks

I’ve created five different Perk levels for backers. The first level is for the individual backer who just requires one set of Injury Dice. The next four sets are for backers who wish to club together within their league or gaming group to make a saving not only on the cost of each set of dice but also a saving on the shipping due to it being securely shipped out to just one location. Please go ahead and share this campaign with your gaming groups and spread the word, it might just save you some money.

Risks & Challenges

I like to think I’m a trusted member of the Fantasy Football Community and I value that trust immensely. I responsibly manage the finances and have produced many designs for the LBBL, from sets of dice for each season of the LBBL completed by a coach, to custom loot & prizes such as engraved Dog Tags, Custom Poker Chips and Custom Bribe Coins. I think the point I’m trying to make is you can trust in me to deliver this project to you, my reputation depends on it.

There is not really much in terms of challenges that haven’t already been overcome. I have the designs completed and prototyped and I’ve found a good dice producer that can produce the quantities we might need. I’ve worked with printers for all my 20+ years of design career and I’m satisfied that they can produce the high quality reference cards for this project. I’ve been designing products for many years so understand the challenges of shipping products across the world. I’m 100% confident that I’m equipped to deliver this project. 

I aim to deliver this project to Backers in November 2017.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please consider backing this project and spread the word to as many people as you can. If however you choose not to back this project then please feel free to share this project with people you think would like to get involved. This support would be very much appreciated and could make all the difference.

Thank you for taking the time to read my pitch, and I hope you choose to help me succeed on this passion project of mine. Should you have any questions please do not hesitate to ask; I'll be ready and waiting to answer them.

Cheers!
Duncan

story:
Welcome

We are the Role Playing Games League (dba RPGL/RPGLeague). The first ever industry-wide, ranked TRPG league, we rank every TRPG regardless the system you play!

We also want to help grow and strengthen the future of TRPG Therapy, as none of our events are exclusive to our members.

Get To know TRPG Therapy:

Here are some of the therapeutic aspects we are referring to, please check out these sites/articles:

https://geekandsundry.com/dungeons-dragons-as-t...

https://hornetapp.com/stories/role-playing-game...

http://www.academia.edu/3668971/Role-playing_Games_Used_as_Educational_and_Therapeutic_Tool_for_Youth_and_Adults

http://scholarworks.lib.csusb.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1609&context=etd

These are but a few of many ways that TRPG's are helping change the world for the better!

 

Objectives

To finish funding our website, currently in production, with the following features:

  1. The posting of our year around, cooperative Ranking System (Players, Game Masters & Groups) to our Leaderboards.
  2. An industry-wide gaming network which will support all venues (At Home, Online, In Stores, & Conventions) expanding the entire form of entertainment.
  3. An events participation tracker for tournaments rewards/awards to help facilitate the first ever tabletop RPGLeague Sporting Season.
  4. A redemption rewards tracker for the issuance of product earnings.
  5. A Role Playing Games League Community Forum.
  6. An exclusive industry-wide, capable, tabletop role-playing game marketplace.

 

Purpose

To accomplish the above objectives and completely fund all phase of the website.  A detailed description of the phases below;

Ranking System & Leaderboards:

We currently have GM and Player leaderboards and are working on future Groups/Guilds.  If you would like to be apart of the excitement please join us in supporting our efforts to bring our wonderful community to life.

Industry-Wide Gaming Network:

We plan on working with all TRPG business structures to bring forth the best of everything TRPG's have to offer the community at large.  This means discounts, rewards, and prizes for our RPGLeague members. Below are some pictures of events we've already held:

Knowhere Games & Comics: San Marcos, Ca. 92078

 

Yu-Gi-Holics:  Bull Rd. Compton, Ca. 90221

Zander's Game House:  Ventura Blvd. Camarillo, Ca. 93010

The War House:  Willow St. Long Beach, Ca. 90806

 

Events Participation Tracker:

For our Partners, we would like to open the doors for an exclusive look inside the industry and bring life to a world that has been hidden for far too long.  Please support and contact us for more info.

Redemption Rewards Tracker:

Did you think we were done, lol... Just getting started with more benefits and rewards to include our Redemption Rewards Tracker that takes your actions into account, for every TRPG played you will earn points that can be redeemed for prizes that will be shown and available once the website running perfectly.

Community Forum:

Of course, feedback, advice, and good old-fashioned brainstorming will help us support you and vise versa, so please don't be a stranger we can help you with almost anything, but knowing is half the battle.  By the way, where is the GI-JOE TRPG?

Marketplace:

With this one of a kind website we will be able to host all kinds of TRPG goodness, from Core Role Playing Game Publishing Companies, OGL (Open Gaming License)/Third-Party Game Supplement Publishing Companies, & TRPG Merchandisers of all kinds be them established or newly independent start-ups.  Our Marketplace, by design, is intended to benefit our global wholesales and customers equally.

 

Perk Tiers

 

**All Perks will be shipped approximately one month after the close of this crowdfunder.

Email Appreciation

This perk is just that an email showing our appreciation for all our backers.  The time you took out of your busy days to come check out the goodness we are offering and for the support you have shown for a great cause.  Thank you in advance for all you do.

 

Car Stickers

Personally, I can't wait to get these car stickers myself and we're thinking of other possible stickers we can use.  If you would like to give some input as to what type of car sticker you would like to see, hit us up. 

 

Mechanical Pencils

We all know how much we all love our mechanical pencils and how valuable they can be when you have to change something on your character sheet.  So we are bringing you four of our colors and branding.

 

RPGL Poster Calendars

These are amazing, almost like a twofer one sale.  You get a poster and a calendar all in one.

 

RPGL Artist Rendition

Thank you to our terrific friend and artist this perk has come to life!  I have a few ideas on what I want him to do for me, but I'm really curious as to what your imaginations can come up with...

Bringing your favorite character to life with a custom character sketch/design from our artist. After purchase of this perk, email us (orpglc@gmail.com) these basic classifications: Race, Class, Sex, Weapon, Clothing, and Style like cartoonish or realistic.  When done RPGLeague will email our artists' rendition of your character. See example image above.

 

RPGL Beanie/Toque

For those cold winter nights when your up role-playing until dawn.  May the warmth of your head give you comfort and joy as you make your way through the dungeons.

 

RPGL Hat

These hats are one size fits all and may not be powerful or give you magic skill sets, and I highly doubt you can pull a rabbit out of one at least you can say you are part of a league.  

 

Character Portrait T-Shirts

Our character portrait t-shirts have a special place in our hearts because there is actually a storyline behind each one and how they were made.  All t-shirts come in black only, but you may order them in multiple sizes including female v-neck and regular cut.

 

Gimmicky T-Shirts

Hi, folks meet our gimmicky t-shirts and the fun that we intend to bring as our goals are met.  Some of our gimmicks are actually part of a bigger series and you will see more of that as you scroll down.  All t-shirts come in black only, but you may order them in multiple sizes including female v-neck and regular cut.

 

Marketing

Hi, All TRPG Industry companies; would you like to be a sponsor and help us help you by placing your logo here!  With this tier, we will put your logo below during our crowdfunding campaign for as long as the campaign runs.  Started Feb 15, 2018, and ends Apr 16, 2018

 

Meal at GameX

Going to GameX in Los Angeles CA., in May 2018?  Want to hang out and grab a meal with an owner of Role Playing Games League LLC?

Back the project at this level to join us for dinner during the convention. The cost of food is included.

 

*All Perks will be shipped approximately one month after the close of this crowdfunder.

 

Stretch Goals

 

Any Three Character Portrait T-Shirts Stretch Goal:

  • When TWELVE (12) people or more buy the Three Character Portrait T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters & an RPGL Logo Sticker on each order at no extra cost.
  • When TWENTY TWO (22) people or more buy the Three Character Portrait T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, an RPGL Logo Sticker & 2 RPGL Six Sided Dice to each order at no extra cost.
  • When THIRTY-SIX (36) people or more buy the Three Character Portrait T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, an RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Six Sided Dice & a random Calendar Poster to each order at no extra cost.
  • When FIFTY FOUR (54) people or more buy the Three Character Portrait T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, an RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Six Sided Dice, a random Calendar Poster & an RPGL Mechanical Pencil to each order at no extra cost.

 

Four Gimmicky T-Shirt Stretch Goal:

  • When EIGHT (8) people or more buy the Four Gimmicky T-Shirt Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters & an RPGL Logo Sticker to each order at no extra cost.
  • When FIFTEEN (15) people or more buy the Four Gimmicky T-Shirt Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, an RPGL Logo Sticker & 2 RPGL Six Sided Dice to each order at no extra cost.
  • When TWENTY FIVE (25) people or more buy the Four Gimmicky T-Shirt Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, an RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Six Sided Dice & a random Calendar Poster to each order at no extra cost.
  • When FOURTY (40) people or more buy the Four Gimmicky T-Shirt Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, an RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Six Sided Dice, a random Calendar Poster, & an RPGL Mechanical Pencil to each order at no extra cost.
  • When FIFTY-FIVE (55) people buy the Four Gimmicky T-Shirt Perk we will through in 2 RPGL Coasters, an RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Six Sided Dice, a random Calendar Poster, a RPGL Mechanical Pencil & a RPGL Beanie/Toque to each order at no extra cost.

 

Five Character Portrait T-Shirt Stretch Goal:

  • When FOUR (4) people or more buy the Five Character Portrait T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters & an RPGL Logo Sticker on each order at no extra cost.
  • When EIGHT (8) people or more buy the Five Character Portrait T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, an RPGL Logo Sticker & 2 RPGL Six Sided Dice to each order at no extra cost.
  • When FOURTEEN (14) people or more buy the Five Character Portrait T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, an RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Six Sided Dice, & a random Calendar Poster to each order at no extra cost.
  • When TWENTY TWO (22) people or more buy the Five Character Portrait T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, an RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Six Sided Dice, a random Calendar Poster, & an RPGL Mechanical Pencil to each order at no extra cost.
  • When THIRTY TWO (32) people buy the Five Character Portrait T-Shirts Perk we will through in 2 RPGL Coasters, a RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Six Sided Dice, a random Calendar Poster, an RPGL Mechanical Pencil, & an RPGL Hat to each order at no extra cost.

 

Nine T-Shirt Stretch Goal:

  • When TWO (2) people or more buy the Nine T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters & a RPGL Logo Sticker to each order at no extra cost.
  • When FIVE (5) people or more buy the Nine T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, a RPGL Logo Sticker & 2 RPGL Dice to each order at no extra cost.
  • When NINE (9) people or more buy the Nine T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, a RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Dice, & a random Calendar Poster to each order at no extra cost.
  • When FOURTEEN(14) people or more buy the Nine T-Shirts Perk we will add 2 RPGL Coasters, a RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Dice, a random Calendar Poster, & a RPGL Mechanical Pencil to each order at no extra cost.
  • When TWENTY (20) people buy the Nine T-Shirts Perk we will through in 2 RPGL Coasters, a RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Dice, a random Calendar Poster, a RPGL Mechanical Pencil & a RPGL Beanie/Toque to each order at no extra cost.
  • When THIRTY (30) people buy the Nine T-Shirts Perk we will through in 2 RPGL Coasters, a RPGL Logo Sticker, 2 RPGL Dice, a random Calendar Poster, a RPGL Mechanical Pencil, a RPGL Beanie/Toque & a RPGL Hat to each order at no extra cost.

 

Secret Tiers

 

50 Backers will open a Six (6) D6 RPGL Dice tier.

200 Backers will open a Twelve (12) D6 Dice tier.

300 Backers will open the Character Class Line tier.

500 Backers will open  Any Three T-Shirt tier.

1000 Backers will open Any Four T-Shirt tier.

2000 Backers will open a singular GM/DM RPGL Shield tier.

 

REFERRAL CONTEST

 

To get the word out about the project and thank the people who do so, we will be running a referral contest throughout the campaign.

The 3 people who bring in the most money to the project through their referral links will win gift cards from Role Playing Games League LLC.

1st place will get a $50 gift cards

2nd place will get a $25 gift cards

3rd place will get a $15 gift cards

To count as a referrer, you must promote the campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools (located at the top of the page) while logged into your Indiegogo account. This is important because otherwise, your unique ID won’t be attached to any resulting contributions or visits.

Example:

When Funder A is logged into their account and uses Indiegogo’s share tools to send a Reddit, for example, the link in the tweet includes Funder A’s unique ID. Then, when Funder B reads the Reddit and clicks through the link to contribute, Funder A is recognized as helping bring in the amount contributed by Funder B.

 

Achievements & Other Support Efforts

If now's just not a good time to help support, that's okay!  Here are a couple other ways you can:

  1. Get on social media and help spread the word about the campaign.
    • Facebook Likes & Follows
    • Tweeter Likes & Follows
  2. Use the Indiegogo share tools to refer people to the project and get entered to win a FREE gift card from Role Playing Games LLC, if you're one of the top 3 referrers!

(Please note that you must be logged into your IndieGoGo account when using the share tools to get credit for any referrals.)
story_txt:
WelcomeWe are the Role Playing Games League (dba RPGL/RPGLeague). The first ever industry-wide, ranked TRPG league, we rank every TRPG regardless the system you play!We also want to help grow and strengthen the future of TRPG Therapy, as none of our events are exclusive to our members.Get To know TRPG Therapy:Here are some of the therapeutic aspects we are referring to, please check out these sites/articles:https://geekandsundry.com/dungeons-dragons-as-t...https://hornetapp.com/stories/role-playing-game...http://www.academia.edu/3668971/Role-playing_Games_Used_as_Educational_and_Therapeutic_Tool_for_Youth_and_Adultshttp://scholarworks.lib.csusb.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1609&context=etdThese are but a few of many ways that TRPG's are helping change the world for the better! ObjectivesTo finish funding our website, currently in production, with the following features:
The posting of our year around, cooperative Ranking System (Players, Game Masters & Groups) to our Leaderboards.
An industry-wide gaming network which will support all venues (At Home, Online, In Stores, & Conventions) expanding the entire form of entertainment.
An events participation tracker for tournaments rewards/awards to help facilitate the first ever tabletop RPGLeague Sporting Season.
A redemption rewards tracker for the issuance of product earnings.
A Role Playing Games League Community Forum.
An exclusive industry-wide, capable, tabletop role-playing game marketplace.
 PurposeTo accomplish the above objectives and completely fund all phase of the website.  A detailed description of the phases below;Ranking System & Leaderboards:We currently have GM and Player leaderboards and are working on future Groups/Guilds.  If you would like to be apart of the excitement please join us in supporting our efforts to bring our wonderful community to life.Industry-Wide Gaming Network:We plan on working with all TRPG business structures to bring forth the best of everything TRPG's have to offer the community at large.  This means discounts, rewards, and prizes for our RPGLeague members. Below are some pictures of events we've already held:Knowhere Games & Comics: San Marcos, Ca. 92078



 
Yu-Gi-Holics:  Bull Rd. Compton, Ca. 90221Zander's Game House:  Ventura Blvd. Camarillo, Ca. 93010The War House:  Willow St. Long Beach, Ca. 90806 Events Participation Tracker:For our Partners, we would like to open the doors for an exclusive look inside the industry and bring life to a world that has been hidden for far too long.  Please support and contact us for more info.Redemption Rewards Tracker:Did you think we were done, lol... Just getting started with more benefits and rewards to include our Redemption Rewards Tracker that takes your actions into account, for every TRPG played you will earn points that can be redeemed for prizes that will be shown and available once the website running perfectly.Community Forum:Of course, feedback, advice, and good old-fashioned brainstorming will help us support you and vise versa, so please don't be a stranger we can help you with almost anything, but knowing is half the battle.  By the way, where is the GI-JOE TRPG?Marketplace:With this one of a kind website we will be able to host all kinds of TRPG goodness, from Core Role Playing Game Publishing Companies, OGL (Open Gaming License)/Third-Party Game Supplement Publishing Companies, & TRPG Merchandisers of all kinds be them established or newly independent start-ups.  Our Marketplace, by design, is intended to benefit our global wholesales and customers equally. Perk Tiers **All Perks will be shipped approximately one month after the close of this crowdfunder.Email AppreciationThis perk is just that an email showing our appreciation for all our backers.  The time you took out of your busy days to come check out the goodness we are offering and for the support you have shown for a great cause.  Thank you in advance for all you do. Car StickersPersonally, I can't wait to get these car stickers myself and we're thinking of other possible stickers we can use.  If you would like to give some input as to what type of car sticker you would like to see, hit us up.  Mechanical PencilsWe all know how much we all love our mechanical pencils and how valuable they can be when you have to change something on your character sheet.  So we are bringing you four of our colors and branding. RPGL Poster CalendarsThese are amazing, almost like a twofer one sale.  You get a poster and a calendar all in one. RPGL Artist RenditionThank you to our terrific friend and artist this perk has come to life!  I have a few ideas on what I want him to do for me, but I'm really curious as to what your imaginations can come up with...Bringing your favorite character to life with a custom character sketch/design from our artist. After purchase of this perk, email us (orpglc@gmail.com) these basic classifications: Race, Class, Sex, Weapon, Clothing, and Style like cartoonish or realistic.  When done RPGLeague will email our artists' rendition of your character. See example image above. RPGL Beanie/ToqueFor those cold winter nights when your up role-playing until dawn.  May the warmth of your head give you comfort and joy as you make your way through the dungeons. RPGL HatThese hats are one size fits all and may not be powerful or give you magic skill sets, and I highly doubt you can pull a rabbit out of one at least you can say you are part of a league.   Character Portrait T-ShirtsOur character portrait t-shirts have a special place in our hearts because there is actually a storyline behind each one and how they were made.  All t-shirts come in black only, but you may order them in multiple sizes including female v-neck and regular cut. Gimmicky T-ShirtsHi, folks meet our gimmicky t-shirts and the fun that we intend to bring as our goals are met.  Some of our gimmicks are actually part of a bigger series and you will see more of that as you scroll down.  All t-shirts come in black only, but you may order them in multiple sizes including female v-neck and regular cut. MarketingHi, All TRPG Industry companies; would you like to be a sponsor and help us help you by placing your logo here!  With this tier, we will put your logo below during our crowdfunding campaign for as long as the campaign runs.  Started Feb 15, 2018, and ends Apr 16, 2018 Meal at GameXGoing to GameX in Los Angeles CA., in May 2018?  Want to hang out and grab a meal with an owner of Role Playing Games League LLC?Back the project at this level to join us for dinner during the convention. story:
About Our Idea

The idea came to my partner and I when we were looking for a subscription date box that fit our interests. We were particularly looking for a 'date box', or a box that had items for a pre-planned date. However, none of the boxes were themed for couples who like to play games together. Additionally, there are very few subscription boxes that ship within Europe, whereas in America and the UK, business is booming. We wanted to change this. Our idea developed into the 'Board Date' box. A subscription box available in the UK and Europe for couples keen to playing board games.

We are doing this campaign to get the first month of the project started with a select but dedicated group of customers. It’s important for us to get to know our customers, and a platform like IndieGOGO gives us that opportunity.

Our first contributors will help us streamline the process and ensure our product is of the highest quality. Additionally, the contributors will be able to help us further develop the box to fit the needs of our target group through feedback.

What We Need & What You Get

The first 50 donations of  €50 or more will receive the exclusive first month’s box. The boxes will be shipped in mid October.

Each box includes:

  • 1x - 2(+) player board game/card game
  • Pre-made snacks to share
  • Photo props for silly picture perfect memories
  • *Themed Couple's Surprise*

Images from our Prototype Box

Once the initial 50 donations have been made and the first 50 boxes claimed, any additional donations of €20 or more will add you to the waitlist for the next month’s box (November) with a 20% discount.

The money goes to funding our first month worth of boxes, supply line establishment, and the purchasing of other distribution related item/services. With these payments done we are able to sustain our business model by incoming revenue in the future.

The Impact

We wanted to make a subscription box for couples like us and many of our friends. Couples who like to play boardgames, but are too lazy to, or not able to, go to a Board Game Shop. Couples who are missing out on date night because of lack of time, ideas, or motivation to actually go somewhere. With this box we want to provide all that in one package delivered at YOUR doorstep.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest obstacle with successfully maintaining our idea can be summed up in one word: SHIPPING. Since we include items (the board game) that are a bit on the heavier end and combine them with some more items, our boxes tend to weigh more than other subscription boxes. Due to this, our biggest challenge will be finding a balance between the cost of shipping for the customer and the cost of shipping for us. We do not want to put the entire cost of shipping on the customer, nor could we maintain selling boxes should we solely cover the costs.

Therefore our plan is: The first month of boxes will be majorly covered by us, with only a €4.01 cost to the customer. Hopefully, after the first month of boxes are ordered and shipped, we will have a better understanding of how to fairly price the box including shipping.

The final issue regarding shipping is whether or not to include shipping in the price or add it as a separate charge. If you have a preference of how we should add the price of shipping let us know at info@boarddatebox.com

Other Ways You Can Help

You can still help us if you are unable donate. Share our IndieGOGO page with your friends and family, or whoever might be interested. We thank you from the bottom of our heart for any help you can give us.

We look forward to talking with you in the #BoardDate Community on Facebook, Instagram & Twitter! @BoardDateBox

story:
CUBBLE DICE

The dice that will change the way you play tabletop games forever. It is my pleasure to announce you the Cubble Dice. I am a former architect, current graphic and product designer and I felt in love with a dice I saw presented right here on KickStarter. I promissed myself I will create a better version, with less compromises.

The Story

Cubble Dice was borned from my obsession with dice and odds. There’s nothing more enjoyable in a game than that emotion when you’re rolling the dice and you wait to see the outcome.

This was a passion project, and you can help bring it to life if you like what you’re seeing. A lot of effort, time and thought went into the design, and the math of the dice.

was a passion project, and you can help bring it to life if you like what you’re seeing. A lot of effort, time and thought went into the design, and the math of the dice.

Traditional dice was used as a base, and I worked on that. I have taken simple architectural concepts and techniques to implement modern elements into this retro-clean dice. This simple idea, resides in a complex concept, beautifully integrated into this new design.

This dice feels so natural in your hand that you don't want to throw it. They are different from everything else I've ever tried, the special design gives it that certain extra excitement you can't feel in regular D6 die.

Having a dice, that looks a lot like a decoration for your desk, is definitely a big advantage.

Each set of Cubble Dice will contain a pair of dice in anodized aluminum. You chose your colors, and I will do the rest.

Also Comes In Tungsten?

YES! And here are a few reasons why this is one of the strongest dice you'll ever own:

  • 70% denser than lead 
  • Denser than Uranium 
  • Nearly impossible to melt 
  • 4x harder than Titanium 
  • 19x denser than water 

Tungsten as a metal, has the highest melting point of any element. Did you know that? Actually, you can't easily build a container to melt it. You have to use expensive powder compression techniques to shape it. 

Needless to say CNC machining is a real challenge and a lot of skill and patience is needed for each piece. 

Tungsten is also an extremely rare element (only 100 parts per billion in the earth's crust!!!), that's one of the main reasons behind the high cost. 

But it is totally worth the pain, because it really is a beautiful thing, wouldn't you agree?

DESIGN

Cubble dice takes the old boring regular dice, and converts each number into simple shapes. As you can see on the design, each number from 1-6 has a different setting, based on the corresponding number. The cool part is these numbers are all connected via custom CNC engraving. Where the pip line of one number, continues on a adjacent face of the dice to create a nice look and feel.

THE MATH BEHIND IT ALL

I had to take into account the Centroid of the geometric shape. Which is the center of an object. That means I had to keep the Center of Mass (or Center of Gravity) as close as possible to the one of the original pip dice.

When I decided to create this particular metal dice, I wanted to minimize the rotational Moment of Inertia in order to develop a dice that would roll to stop at statistically even probabilities for each of the six possible outcomes.

I’ve accomplished this, by making sure I’ve subtracted the same amount of material from each face of the cube. This is the result:

Obviously there is room for error since the die is CNC machined and obviously the material used is not exactly homogenome in density, but this is as close as it gets to a perfectly balanced dice.

MY CHALLENGE, YOUR GAIN

Now I’m obviously satisfied with this design, otherwise I wouldn’t have brought it to your attention. BUT, I also want to bring this product into mass production, and here is where you can make a difference.

All the funding I get from this project, will go into initial order, packaging, shipping & handling, and other related costs.

These things come at a steep price, since this is a custom, unique design you won’t find anywhere else in the world. At least for now.

All materials are CNC machined. 

The colored dice are 100% Aluminum, not zinc alloy. That's why is pretty expensive, since the process takes time, and can only be completed in 3 phases:

  • 1. The initial outside shape of the dice
  • 2. Anodization
  • 3. CNC machinning 

The basic set package is $14 (even so you're still getting it cheaper than the estimated sale price of $17)

As an add-on, we have special price for multiple sets you order (check right hand side for specials) in case you want to share this special dice with your loved ones. 

Cubble Dice will make a perfect gift for your friends or family.

ADD-ONS

For any of the basic packs of Colored Aluminum Dice, be it 2, 4, 6, 8 or 10 CUBBLE dice, you can add dice made of different metals according to what you like.

So for example if you order a "FOUR (4) Cubble Dice - Get 4 CUBBLES in any colors you like"for $25, and you also want a CUBBLE made of Brass, you just add to your pledge another $17. 

So your final pledge would be $25 + $17 = $42

If you want to add one CUBBLE in Stainless Steel it would go like this:

$25 + $25 = $50

If you want one CUBBLE in Tungsten it would go like this:

$25 + $55 = $80

Of course, you can also add pairs of the above different metal dice to your Aluminum Colored Dice. You can consult the prices on the diagram above, where each extra is described to let you know how much to add to your main pledge. 

That's the plan IF the funding goes well and Cubble Dice is generously funded. This is the extra you gain, because production cost will go down considerably and stretch goal rewards will be unlocked for all backers with more finishing choices AND FREE SHIPPING worldwide will be achievable.

  • Tweet about us
  • Share us on FB (they deserve to know...)
  • Email your pals


How you can help us deliver you new colors:

If you want to make these new colors attainable please SHARE this project wherever you see fit. On your Facebook profile, a Facebook page you manage, Twitter, Pinterest or Instagram. Forum links are also accepted.

But wait! There is more! More for YOU! Sharing will get you a FREE custom Cubble BOX for your brand new pair of dice! - just let me know where you've shared the link via a direct message - I read them all.

 CUBBLE Dice in Different Metals

By backing this project you not only help me bring an amazing project to life, but you also help start new ones. But if you can’t afford to back at this time, you can still help by sharing my project via social media, email and word of mouth to let your friends about this brand new dice.

Thanks in advance!

P.S. here's a little preview of the dice rolling

Risks and challenges

I’m confident this dice is nothing short of amazing. I have tested, calculated and contacted the best manufacturer I could, to be able to provide quality in due time. The only challenges I have at the moment is producing and distributing it.

Of course, there are possible challenges to this KickStarter project, but I’m confident I can deliver a great experience to each and every one of you that get this dice.

Thanks for taking the time to review this Project, that means a lot!

Now go roll that awesome dice! 

Dango
story_txt:
CUBBLE DICEThe dice that will change the way you play tabletop games forever. It is my pleasure to announce you the Cubble Dice. I am a former architect, current graphic and product designer and I felt in love with a dice I saw presented right here on KickStarter. I promissed myself I will create a better version, with less compromises.The StoryCubble Dice was borned from my obsession with dice and odds. There’s nothing more enjoyable in a game than that emotion when you’re rolling the dice and you wait to see the outcome.This was a passion project, and you can help bring it to life if you like what you’re seeing. A lot of effort, time and thought went into the design, and the math of the dice.was a passion project, and you can help bring it to life if you like what you’re seeing. A lot of effort, time and thought went into the design, and the math of the dice.Traditional dice was used as a base, and I worked on that. I have taken simple architectural concepts and techniques to implement modern elements into this retro-clean dice. This simple idea, resides in a complex concept, beautifully integrated into this new design.This dice feels so natural in your hand that you don't want to throw it. They are different from everything else I've ever tried, the special design gives it that certain extra excitement you can't feel in regular D6 die.Having a dice, that looks a lot like a decoration for your desk, is definitely a big advantage.


Each set of Cubble Dice will contain a pair of dice in anodized aluminum. You chose your colors, and I will do the rest.
