story:
Beginning with an encounter with a disguised god, Moon Daughter's Fate brings the characters into the province of Whisper Valley (Sheng1Xi1Gu3, "Sheng Xi Gu"), where divine matters have taken a dangerous turn. Alice Peng has crafted an intricate situation based on Chinese folklore that begins with a mystery and can end in various different resolutions of a quarrel among gods, with a healthy dose of fighting and mayhem along the way. The players' skills at negotiation and mysteries are crucial in addition to combat tactics, and at times the characters' lives may depend upon problem-solving rather than their fighting skills.

The adventure is available in versions for 5th edition D&D, Pathfinder 1st edition, and Swords & Wizardry (OD&D). The difficulty level varies a bit by rule-system, but is essentially a mid-level adventure in all three versions, and the book is approximately 32 pages -- again, depending on the rules-system.

The book contains a number of new monsters, as one might expect, and ranges across several different mini-adventuring areas. It also includes brief commentaries from Alice Peng on certain characteristics of Chinese folklore that are fundamentally different from the base assumptions of D&D, and a pronunciation guide. 

The Project 

Necromancer Games  projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover)
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation)
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for Moon Daughter's Fate and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • A previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

Overseas Shipping

For the last several months, as those of you who follow us on Discord know, we have been grappling with the issue of high costs on shipping to locations outside the USA. We have decided that the most cost-effective way for our overseas customers to get books is by printing the books in print-on-demand format. This does not affect the USA, where we will continue ordinary printing and shipping.

The print-on-demand books international customers will be receiving are high quality, but please be aware that they are different from the premium-quality books we are advertising for sale in the USA.

We have tremendous love and respect for our international customers, and this is the most workable way we have been able to find to keep you supplied with books with reliable delivery times at a reasonable price.

story:
The Final Chapter

The trading post is closed, the Dancing Bear is empty, people are missing, and those who remain look suspiciously at the returning “heroes.” In fact, wanted posters bearing the likenesses of the characters hang around the small village.

The true evil in the wilderness has risen within Castle Ravenrock …

 

In medias res

When our heroes return to Ravenreach all is not well. The castle is in lockdown and the town hasn’t heard from anyone there in days. Worse, our heroes learn they are wanted for attempting to assassinate the baron.

Sneaking into the castle through a secret entrance at the bottom of the hill they find a way in via a slippery sewer drain. Snaking up through the dungeons below they unearth ancient secrets, encounter deadly monsters, nasty traps and twisted abominations.

As they piece together the sinister plot to frame them, the party must take care to avoid killing friends while fighting foes as they navigate the dungeon and castle. At last they encounter the usurper and his guard of monstrous henchmen for a final boss fight!

This exciting adventures includes:

  • Detailed treasure descriptions.
  • GM tactics for major encounters.
  • New creatures and new troll fighting equipment.
  • Ancient secrets.
  • A lurking evil spirit.
  • A horrifying experimental laboratory.

The Tiny Print Run

Why Indiegogo?

Frog God Games is continuing the use of this indiegogo crowdfunding method for Mystery at Ravenrock This method is almost the inverse of how we design our crowdfunding projects on Kickstarter. We call it the 'Tiny Print Run'.

Thus, Indiegogo projects by Frog God Games will-

  • Be short in duration
  • Be limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Design all stretch goals and project bonus' affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Be the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means 100 pound glossy interior pages with a thick, glossy cardstock cover. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects. These smaller projects are happening in response to the feedback we have heard from both fans and 'almost' fans alike. We hear the request for less expensive options for our projects and products all the time. A second frequent desire expressed to us, whether at conventions, on social media or in email, is for a larger selection of smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions and not necessitate a full two year campaign.

Additionally, Frog God Games has grown in both sales and brand awareness.  This opportunity will give us the additional resources to invest in the very best books in all of our formats. 

Project Reward 

With the wishes of the fans in mind, this and future Indiegogo projects will fund standalone projects that are both affordable and fun. This project, as well future Tiny Print Run projects, is narrowly focused with all stretch goals adding resources to the principle reward which traditionally would not be feasible for a publisher our size. 

Examples of Enhancements from Higher Funding

During the 15 day primary project period for Mystery at Ravenrock and after the $1000 goal is met the focus will be to improve the delivered product. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of the planned extras that increased funding would bring to  Mystery at Ravenrock -

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 

Example added for funding for Menace in Ravensreach (January project, at printer now):

The previous Indiegogo project, Menace in Ravenreach, added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.

  • Printed Player map(s)/Insert. This is one we would love to do but it would require a substantial increase in overall project funding.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table
  • Digital extras (player handouts etc) that are focused on quality table-top play.

Like this token example!

Help with the digital assets to enhance the module for the Fantasy Grounds marketplace. This has been done for all three previous releases from Indiegogo by Michael Potter.

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS by clicking here- 

https://wwwapps.ups.com/ctc/request?loc=en_US.

A second frequent desire expressed to us, whether at conventions, on social media or in email, is for a larger selection of smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions and not necessitate a full two year campaign.Additionally, Frog God Games has grown in both sales and brand awareness.  This opportunity will give us the additional resources to invest in the very best books in all of our formats. Project Reward With the wishes of the fans in mind, this and future Indiegogo projects will fund standalone projects that are both affordable and fun. This project, as well future Tiny Print Run projects, is narrowly focused with all stretch goals adding resources to the principle reward which traditionally would not be feasible for a publisher our size. Examples of Enhancements from Higher FundingDuring the 15 day primary project period for Mystery at Ravenrock and after the $1000 goal is met the focus will be to improve the delivered product. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases the better the final product will be for everybody.Examples of the planned extras that increased funding would bring to  Mystery at Ravenrock -Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. Example added for funding for Menace in Ravensreach (January project, at printer now):The previous Indiegogo project, Menace in Ravenreach, added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
Printed Player map(s)/Insert. This is one we would love to do but it would require a substantial increase in overall project funding.
Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table
Digital extras (player handouts etc) that are focused on quality table-top play.
Like this token example!Help with the digital assets to enhance the module for the Fantasy Grounds marketplace. This has been done for all three previous releases from Indiegogo by Michael Potter.Project DeliveryPDF PerksWe will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.Softcover PerksSoftcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. Overseas ShippingNOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS by clicking here- https://wwwapps.ups.com/ctc/request?loc=en_US.

story:
The Adventure

A treasure map, a mysterious valley, and a group of untried adventurers -- what could possibly go wrong? This introductory-level adventure is written for a free-form, old school type of play, as the characters go "hex crawling" through the wilderness to discover the secret of a strange map that has fallen into their hands.

This classic adventure was originally published in 2010, and contains the original introduction about how to approach "old-school" type play with Dungeons & Dragons and similar RPGs. The edition is re-done and is printed in premium quality for three rules-systems: D&D 5e, Pathfinder 1e, and Swords & Wizardry. 

The Project 

Frog God Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for 1975 and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters for accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access to your reward*.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code will be sent via Constant Contact to the email address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

*Generally after the project ends a second coupon is provided allowing supporters to add their digital reward  to their DriveThruRPG.com PDF library.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS

story:
Pre-Orders are still open via Backerkit

On February 2nd, 2019, my youngest daughter, Harper, was diagnosed with leukemia. The next few days were hard. Two days after diagnosis, while sitting in bed, Kelly from Child Services came in with a gift card from Friends of Kids with Cancer. Harper immediately perked up, and within 15 minutes she’d sent me out of the hospital to spend that money!! Friends of Kids with Cancer gave us our First Good Day. Harp is in remission and we want to give back some of what they’ve given us.

Harper is a gamer; she’s in Tales of the Margreve (Kobold Press) with her sister, Ghoul Island (Petersen Games), and she plays D&D and loves to write stories. It only makes sense that we write a D&D adventure book together and to use it as a platform to raise funds Friends of Kids. This project began as a conversation in the hospital, turned into an outline after she was discharged, and is now an amazing book that we’re all so proud of.

Joining Harper and I are an elite team of creators including: Jeff Stevens, Ben McFarland, Brian Suskind, Hannah Rose, Ashley Warren, Kienna Shaw, Bill Barnett,  MT Black, Donathin Frye, Anna Landin, Gwendy B, Anna Meyer, Dyson Logos, Jessica Ross, and others! Kobold Press and Petersen Games also pitched in to us bring this to life.

What is Harper's Tale?

Harper’s Tale is a forest-based adventure path of 10 connected adventures culminating in the party, now 10th level, confronting the source of the plague within their home land. The adventure is intended for players as young as 10, but I promise players of all ages will find plenty to keep them engaged with the story.

The adventure path starts in the Village of Grove as the heroes come to a seemingly deserted village. Through exploration and investigation, they learn that a mysterious illness has taken over the town, leaving only two young women, Rose and Grace, to care for the populace.

Their investigations take them under the town, and, in learning the source of the illness, they find themselves drawn into a much bigger plot by a mysterious force they know little about. What is clear is that the forest they call home is in danger, and the entity behind the illness of Grove has only just begun its foul machinations as evidenced by a sudden outbreak of madness in a neighboring town.

A second outbreak is staved off by the heroes—surely they are best described as such after saving not one but two villages—and they find themselves traveling to see the arch-druid of the forest, Deng. The journey is arduous, but the clever adventurers comport themselves well, and learn much in their audience with the ancient druid, including the ingredients for fashioning a cure for the otherworldly contagion and, more importantly, the appropriate rites for harvesting the key components.

Harvesting the cure is a greater challenge than the adventurers anticipated as they must deal with a cold war between the hidden powers of the forest in addition to gathering the ingredients in the dark recesses of the primordial wood.

The adventure culminates in a confrontation with the creature whose machinations have been behind the debilitating disease wracking the forest. The heroes have learned much of their enemy, but have they learned all there is to know? How will they react when confronted with the source of so much pain and sorrow? Can it be defeated? Redeemed? Or will it win the day? There’s only one way to find out.

Meet the Team.

Harper’s Tale is much more than a story about hope and adventure. It’s more than an opportunity to help kids just be kids. It’s also about inclusivity and hearing the voices of those who aren’t heard often enough. To bring those perspectives we have a team of old pros – Brian Suskind and Ben McFarland have literally dozens of titles, multiple ENnie awards, and have worked with publishers such as Kobold Press, Rite Publishing, Paizo, Wizards of the Coast, Atlas Games, and Storm Bunny Studios; there’s also MT Black, a guild adept with more titles than I can list whose work appears in official Wizards of the Coast products.

Joining these seasoned writers are some new(ish) faces. Myself (author/lead developer for Kobold Press, Petersen Games, Infinity Black, Chaosium, and owner of Saturday Morning Scenarios), Donathin Frye (Encounter Roleplay, Saturday Morning Scenarios, Petersen Games, Mage Hand Press, and Modiphius), and Jeff Stevens (DMsGuild bestseller & creator of Savage Encounters series).

But most exciting of all are the folks that are going to carry us all forward for years to come. Ashley Warren (the amazing Uncaged Anthologies and DnD Beyond among other things), Kienna Shaw (Salty Sweet Games), and Bill Barnett (Infinite Black), and Hannah Rose (Wizards of the Coast, DMsGuild, and Kobold Press). Rounding out our team are Gwendy Bee and Anna Landin whose amazing art is on display on this page, and our editors (Jess, and Craig Judd) and Layout (Craig again).

Backer Levels

  • $1 - Thank You for the Donation!!!
    • Thank you, access to backer only updates, and post-campaign ordering.
  • $5 - Just the Tale
    • For those on budget but interested in supporting the campaign. The PDF will be fully edited and professionally laid out. Only thing missing will be the art.
  • $15 - Harper's (e)Friend
    • A fully-indexed, illustrated, and DRM-free PDF of Harper's Tale, your name in the book, and all unlocked stretch goals.
  • $21 - Harper's Friend
    • A code, redeemable at DriveThruRPG, for a print-on-demand copy (backer pays print and shipping costs) of the book, a fully-indexed, illustrated, DRM-free PDF of Harper's Tale, your name in the book, and all unlocked stretch goals.
  • $45 - Friends of Kids with Cancer – limit 50
    • This pledge level is for backers wishing to give a book directly to Friends of Kids. As a thank you for your gift you will receive a fully-indexed, illustrated, and DRM-free PDF of Harper's Tale, your name in the book, and all unlocked stretch goals. This pledge includes delivery of the book to Friends of Kids with Cancer.
  • $65 - One for You and One for Me – limit 50
    • The backer receives a code, redeemable at DriveThruRPG, for a POD copy (backer pays print & shipping) of the book, a fully-indexed, illustrated, DRM-free PDF, your name in the book, & all unlocked stretch goals. Friends of Kids with Cancer will also receive a copy of the book delivered to them at no additional cost.
  • $75 - Dedicated Friend – limit 20
    • The backer names an NPC, item, or location, they receive a code, redeemable at DriveThruRPG, for a POD copy (backer pays print & shipping) of the book, a fully-indexed, illustrated, DRM-free PDF, your name in the book, & all unlocked stretch goals. Friends of Kids with Cancer receives a copy of the book delivered to them at no additional cost.
  • $75 Online Game with a Designer – limit 8
    • A code, redeemable at DriveThruRPG, for a print-on-demand copy (backer pays print and shipping costs) of the book, a fully-indexed, illustrated, DRM-free PDF of Harper's Tale, your name in the book, and all unlocked stretch goals. One of our designers will run an online session the adventure they wrote for Harper's Tale for you.
  • $200 Kid's Best Friend – limit 6
    • The backer designs an NPC, item, or location, they receive a code, redeemable at DriveThruRPG, for a POD copy (backer pays print & shipping) of the book, a fully-indexed, illustrated, DRM-free PDF, your name in the book, & all unlocked stretch goals. Friends of Kids with Cancer receives a copy of the book delivered to them at no additional cost.

Funding & Stretch Goals

When we fund with $12,000 raised we will be delivering a donation in excess of $3,000 to Friends of Kids with Cancer. Additionally, Friends of Kids will be getting an electronic copy of the book for anyone that wants it and any books donated by backers.

**UPDATED**

  • $15,000. The donation increases to over $4,500 and I guarantee the delivery of 100+ full-color, premium hardback adventure books to Friends of Kids.
  • $18,000. The donation increases to over $7,000 and all books for backers will be upgraded to premium hardbacks (you'll still get coupons for soft-cover and regular hardback too).
  • $25,000. The donation increases to over $13,000 and a chapter will be added showing Harper's notes, drawings, and WIPs of the other artists.
  • $30,000. The donation increases to over $18,000 and a comprehensive table of adventure hooks and encounters suitable for inclusion in any forest-based campaign will be added as an appendix.
  • And beyond! We've kept the stretch goals to a minimum to maximize the donation to Friends of Kids with Cancer. There is no upper limit to the donation and all net proceeds will be presented to them this year.

The Book

Harper's Tale will be released as a PDF and as physical books. Books will be fulfilled by DriveThruRPG's print-on-demand program. Backers of that level will receive a code to allow them to print the books at cost and have it shipped directly to them. The book is expected to be 130-150 pages long and be completed in June 2020.

Risks & Challenges

Harper’s Tale is not my first crowdfunding campaign, and the biggest challenges for most crowdfunding campaigns is completing the project and getting it to the backers in a timely manner. To mitigate those risks, Harper and I began working on this book as soon as she got out of the hospital. All of the contracts are out and signed. A significant portion of the work has been completed, and all printing and shipping of physical product will be handled via DriveThruRPG. This is a very low-risk campaign for you to back.

story:
Fuck You - The Game began actually out of frustration with a shared job between me and my roommate.  The business we worked for basically cheated the workers every chance they could.  They didn't offer fair pay, or customer service when necessary.  Their attitude towards their employees was a big Fuck You.  

I had started creating card games with another roommate, so while sitting around at work, discussing how our job didn't care about us, my roommate Tony joked about having a card game about getting screwed over.  I can't remember the title he suggested, but the object of the game was to spell out this long, inappropriate crude phrase.  Though he was just joking around, I said, "No, you're joking, but this can be a really great game.  But we got to spell out something simpler."  From there we tossed around other ideas.  Some too long still...others too short.  Eventually settled on "Fuck You"....it was perfect!

We created rules, cut out slips of paper and played a trial game.  Then, tweaked he rules where needed until we came up with what I believe is the funnest card game I've ever played.  

It was really important to me to find a game that playable and fun with 4 players or just 2.  Most card games are not fun with only two players.  However, I had recently purchased Exploding Kittens for me and a friend to play at a get together.  It was AWESOME!  I think it's even more fun if it's only two players.  So, I wanted to create something that lived up to those standards.  And, surprisingly, I succeeded.  

So, you now know the story.....wanna find out about the game?  Well, who cares, Fuck You!  

Just kidding.  LOL

I won't spoil the surprise but if you're into party drinking games, make sure to get the Fuck You Too! Expansion Pack:

Risks & Challenges

Funding received will mostly be going towards overcoming our biggest problem: production costs. In order to get the game produced at a low enough cost, a certain inventory must be ordered. However, that's capital we just do not have. We're just two poor guys with entrepreneurial spirits. So help us conquer the world and get this game into production so we can sell on Amazon as well as attend trade shows and get it into local stores everywhere.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask your friends to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Dice Tower - Crowdsurfing - December the 9th

(25:39)

Dice Tower - Zee chooses The specialists for the Pick of the week here:

(46:40)

Man vs Meeple - Video Rules

 
 

Foreign publishers, if you are interested in a localized retail version of the standard game, get in touch with us contact@explor8.com (object Localization).

 

 

 

https://explor8.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/DRAFT_EN_Rules_TheSpecialists_10Nov.pdf

 

 
 
 
 

 

Follow The Specialists on BoardGameGeek! 

https://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/320992/specialists

Follow Explor8 on:

 Facebook (Explor8) https://www.facebook.com/Explor8

 Instagram (@explor8_games) https://www.instagram.com/explor8_games/?hl=fr

Website :  https://explor8.com/the-specialists-en/

 

 

 

Check our Kickstarter Page for more information:

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/explor8/the-specialists-boardgame-0/description

Check our French Kickstarter Page for more information:

https://explor8.com/kickstarter/fr/

 

Risks and challenges

The Specialists is our second project on Kickstarter. Our previous campaign Big Monster was a success. The game has been produced and successfully delivered.

Now we are very excited to share with you our new game.

The Specialists has benefited from a long development and many tests. All the artwork for the game is complete. We are ready to submit the final files to the manufacturer.

The game has been extensively playtested. Prototypes circulate all over France and Belgium. We also sent copies to reviewers.

The manufacturing plant (NSF in The Netherlands) is chosen and we visited it. We are in regular contact with a project manager of the factory in order to professionally and qualitatively prepare all the elements necessary for manufacturing. It is the same factory than for our first game Big Monster.

We've used realistic estimates to account for unknowns and bumps in the road. Our main fufillment partner is Meeple logistics, except for US and Canada.

Publishing a board game is always a risky business. Many problems can arise, mistakes can be made because a game is not a standard product, it is always custom.

We have benefited from our first experience with Big Monster and also 2 other games (published without Kickstarter campaign : Pirates under Fire and Anludim). We have also benefited from many expert advice from the publishing industry to prevent the maximum risk. The publisher team consists of 2 people with complementary profiles. Everyone did not count their hours to offer a quality product that was deliverable on time. In France, Explor8 is distributed by Asmodee.

story:
What's going on here then?

Carcosa is a board game that successfully funded on Kickstarter in July 2017, exceeding it goal by over 400% and hitting all 10 of its stretch goals.

Production is now underway with the manufacturer and this campaign will allow you to pre-order Carcosa to be part of that first print run!

Because the crowdfunding campaign is complete on Kickstarter by preordering directly here from Indiegogo you know exactly what you're getting. There's no funding goals, no stretch goals and none of the uncertainty that accompanies being a backer in a crowdfunding campaign but you will still get all of the additional content unlocked or added during the campaign!

That means the two mini-expansions, five art cards, four unique chapter house cards, four custom prophet meeples, a box liner, solo rules and multilingual reference cards will be included with every copy sold here!

Have a look below - we hope you like what you see.

-- One Free Elephant

Your copy of Carcosa will contain the following game components:

Plus the following:

These are some of the features and highlights you'll encounter while playing Carcosa that people have been getting excited about!

Each time you play, you summon a different Carcosa. Each player must compete for their choice from a shifting display of tile stacks.

Once chosen, each unstable tile must be added to Carcosa either to expand it or to replace another unstable, unguarded tile.  

You will deploy your cultists to districts, ley lines and ritual sites to expand your domain, protect it and even invade your opponents.

These are familiar mechanics but each has unique thematic purpose and benefits that make them strategically different from other tile laying games.

Any tile with a yellow tint may have a hidden feature that is only revealed when the tile is “stabilised” (and flipped over)! This gives Carcosa players secret plans, the ability to bluff and the need to analyse their opponents moves to try and discern what secrets they know about Carcosa.

In this animation: Blue adds a tile and a sacrifice. A feaster is revealed and devours three cultists!

Carcosa played well is a game with a rhythm - you plan, you build and then you reveal over a number of turns. This makes the building tense and the successful reveal (or your opponents thwarting of it!) exciting. Carcosa is balanced to reward long-term strategies over building small things frequently.  

Your cultists go mad when they succeed and must recover before they can be reused. Mechanics are built to support the theme, giving a sense of "person" to your cultists and a sense of mystery to Carcosa. (What did they see?)

In this animation: Orange cultists recover their sanity.

You will build power in 3 ways in Carcosa:   

  • Occult Power will simply drive you towards victory.  
  • You will recruit more cultists as you explore the districts of Carcosa to gain more control over the landscape.  
  • You will empower Ritual Stones with game changing spells you can use later to sway the game in your favour.  

Choosing what to concentrate on each turn provides short-term goals that will hopefully feed your long-term schemes!

There are two, mutually exclusive, ways to win in Carcosa. This means late in the game one or more players can be trying to win one way while the others try and thwart them and work towards their own victories. Uneasy alliances can form and are often betrayed – just like you would expect from a group mad cults with a common goal!

Each player leads a Lovecraftian Cult. Taking turns, their Prophet selects a tile representing a part of Carcosa and adds it to a ethereal landscape of ritual sites, ley lines, towers and domes. Players can then deploy Cultists to control a ley line, conduct a ritual or explore the districts they have summoned.

But Carcosa is no normal city:

  • Tiles must be stabilised with power drawn from ley lines or they may be reshaped by other cults! 
  • New cultists may be recruited by performing the Forbidden Play at theatres you reveal! 
  • Your cultist will be driven mad by the power they desire or sacrificed to the horrific Feaster from Beyond for even greater power! 
  • Ritual stones will let you cast game-changing spells! 

The game ends when a Cult completes the Summoning of the King Himself or when enough of Carcosa has been summoned that it becomes a permanent feature of our Earth. Only one Cult can succeed in one of these insane tasks - but in Lovecraft’s mythos, can one truly call that winning?

If you want to learn more about how Carcosa plays, you can read the main rule book or the solo rule book by following these links:

 

Alternatively, and for the first time for us, you can try the virtual version if you have a copy of Tabletop Simulator!

We will be shipping from within the EU with the distributor Games Quest so that our European and UK backers, like our US and Australian backers, will not have to pay any customs charges.

Nigel Kennington, Designer 

Nigel is a one time video game designer turned educator. The rules, the rules rewrites, the rules rewrite rewrites, the glorious spelling mistakes - Nigel provides them all.

www.onefreeelephant.co.uk
Email him! (He's needy.) nigel@onefreeelephant.co.uk

Sarah Kennington, Project Manager

Professional project manager with 20 years of experience and designer of One Free Elephant's successful first game ORE-SOME! Sarah is organising manufacturing, shipment, dealing with most of the logistical issues and generally talking to humans like a proper grownup.

www.onefreeelephant.co.uk
Email her! (She gets stuff done.) sarah@onefreeelephant.co.uk

David Franco Campos, Artist 

Freelance artist working in both video games and board games, the superb “signature pieces” for the game - the box art, logo, rulebook illustrations and the cult mat - have been designed by David. 

https://www.artstation.com/artist/davidfranco

Jason Kimmings, Graphic Design 

Professional graphic designer and photographer, Jason has designed the luxurious rulebook and enticing box base.

http://www.photographyjk.co.uk

Colin Briggs, Modeller 

An Edinburgh based lecturer with over 10 years teaching and 7 years industry experience in animation, UX and Web. Colin has contributed to the tile art and the buildings of Carcosa.

http://www.colinbriggs.com

story:
We are the Knights of Vasteel. We are on a mission to create premium tools and accessories for tabletop RPGs that meld the print and digital worlds into one seamless experience.

For those of you who are new to the scene, NPC For Hire is a deck of 52 cards with beautiful hand-drawn portraits of fantasy folk. And as a complement to the deck, we created a companion app which can be found on the App Store and on the Play Store.

NPC For Hire: Fantasy Races is the next step on our journey. We successfully launched NPC For Hire: Human Edition earlier this year and just received our funding on KickStarter for NPC For Hire: Fantasy Races. We are hard at work creating the artwork for our new decks and won't be finished until the end of August. This gives us 2 months to allow more people to order decks before we put our order in.

The Original NPC For Hire: Human Edition

How to use the cards

You know that look on your players faces when you say the name of an NPC in your campaign, and they have no clue who you are talking about? It’s not cool, and it detracts from the game. We created NPC For Hire to help with those moments. Instead of just describing your NPCs you can show them a detailed portrait. You will be surprised at how much easier it is for your players to recognize visual representations of a character than it is to recall a spoken names (Honestly, who really remembers names).

Beyond their value as a visual cue, you can use NPC For Hire Face cards in a number of ways to enhance your game and your DM skills. Here are a couple:

  1. Practice creating NPC ideas by drawing a card at random and making up a backstory.

  2. Keep 3 villager NPC cards ready with side quest seeds to pull out during any game. 

  3. Find creative ways to reuse the cards. For example, the bartender might have a “twin” in another city.

  4. Show the cards to the party, and have them formulate some of the NPC’s mannerism.

  5. Push yourself to include cards in your game that you think are odd or you don’t immediately resonate with.

This campaign is to fund the Elf & Demon Edition and the Dwarf & Halfling Edition. They will both consist of 52 portraits. Unlike the Human Edition, these decks will consist of multiple races. (Elves and dwarves aren't as distinct as humans, so rather than have a lot of look-a-likes to fill the 52 portrait quota, we decided to use other races.)

Elf & Demon Edition

The races in this deck are as follows:

  • High Elves
  • Wood Elves
  • Sea Elves
  • Dark Elves
  • Half-Elves
  • Fey Creatures
  • Half-Demons

Dwarf & Halfling Edition

The races in this deck are as follows:

  • Mountain Dwarves
  • Hill Dwarves
  • Chaos Dwarves
  • Halflings
  • Gnomes
  • Half-Orcs
  • Dragon Folk

As with our first campaign, we are again teaming up with Cristiana Leone (Cru) to create the portraits. This will keep the theme and the style consistent throughout all of the decks.

We were very deliberate in our effort to create a style and mood that would draw players into the game. The pencil lines over paper texture invite players to imagine they are in an ancient fantasy realm. The portraits are full of character and are drawn with just enough detail to leave room for the imagination. There is nothing like this on the market.

The back of each card is blank. This, of course, was intentional. We wanted to give GMs the space to make notes and updates to their NPCs without forcing our vision on them. Using a clear plastic card protector and a piece of paper, you can write down your notes and slip them behind the card without blocking vital information or artwork.

The companion app that we created (available on the App Store and on the Play Store for $4.99) has all of the portraits from the Human Edition and will be updated with all of the portraits created from this campaign once available. It also allows you to create, generate, and manage your NPCs in one place.

We built the app to focus on the story of an NPC rather than the nitty gritty details such as stats. This makes it so that this app can be paired with any fantasy game. Also, we've found that when we need an NPC quickly, it's mostly in a non-combat scenario where we need story/background and not stats.

Nathan Smith

Nathan is a passionate designer, entrepreneur, and DM. His first successful Kickstarter, Dungeon Explore Card Deck, taught him a lot about creating, managing, and delivering a product. Professionally, Nathan designs mobile applications and is always looking for ways to bring technology into his hobbies. The idea to create NPC For Hire came from not being satisfied with the current digital tools for creating and using believable NPCs in his current 5e campaign.

You can find his RPG tile art in the Roll20 marketplace and his blog at MakerGames.net.

Austen Probst

Table-top games and video games are Austen's jam. It was his love for video games that drove him to become a programmer, and now he is using those skills to bridge the gap between table-top games and technology. For his day job, Aust works as a full-stack web developer with a PHP back-end and a vanilla JavaScript front-end. At home, he works hard teaching his 3-year-old and his 8-month-old the ways of gaming.

Cristiana Leone

Cristiana Leone was born in 1980, in the province of Rome. She has been passionate about drawing ever since childhood. As a self-taught artist, she is eager to master new techniques and learn as much as possible. In 2012 she decided to leave her secretary job to become a full-time artist. She currently works as a professional illustrator and character designer. She does private and commercial work. Her clients include many international customers and in 2016, she was hired to do graphics for an animated, independent horror film, called "Malevolent".

There is nothing like this on the market.The back of each card is blank. This, of course, was intentional. We wanted to give GMs the space to make notes and updates to their NPCs without forcing our vision on them. Using a clear plastic card protector and a piece of paper, you can write down your notes and slip them behind the card without blocking vital information or artwork.The companion app that we created (available on the App Store and on the Play Store for $4.99) has all of the portraits from the Human Edition and will be updated with all of the portraits created from this campaign once available. It also allows you to create, generate, and manage your NPCs in one place.We built the app to focus on the story of an NPC rather than the nitty gritty details such as stats. This makes it so that this app can be paired with any fantasy game. Also, we've found that when we need an NPC quickly, it's mostly in a non-combat scenario where we need story/background and not stats.Nathan SmithNathan is a passionate designer, entrepreneur, and DM. His first successful Kickstarter, Dungeon Explore Card Deck, taught him a lot about creating, managing, and delivering a product. Professionally, Nathan designs mobile applications and is always looking for ways to bring technology into his hobbies. The idea to create NPC For Hire came from not being satisfied with the current digital tools for creating and using believable NPCs in his current 5e campaign.You can find his RPG tile art in the Roll20 marketplace and his blog at MakerGames.net.Austen ProbstTable-top games and video games are Austen's jam. It was his love for video games that drove him to become a programmer, and now he is using those skills to bridge the gap between table-top games and technology. For his day job, Aust works as a full-stack web developer with a PHP back-end and a vanilla JavaScript front-end. At home, he works hard teaching his 3-year-old and his 8-month-old the ways of gaming.Cristiana LeoneCristiana Leone was born in 1980, in the province of Rome. She has been passionate about drawing ever since childhood. As a self-taught artist, she is eager to master new techniques and learn as much as possible. In 2012 she decided to leave her secretary job to become a full-time artist. She currently works as a professional illustrator and character designer. She does private and commercial work. Her clients include many international customers and in 2016, she was hired to do graphics for an animated, independent horror film, called "Malevolent".

story:
Reviews & Articles

 

Geekdad: Read the complete review

EverythingBoardGame: Read the review

Casual Gamer Revolution: Read the article

IndieTableTop: Read the review

Board Game Stories: Read the review

ProfesseurBoardGame (FR) : View the video review

Jeux.ca (FR) : Read the article

 

 

FAQ

 

Any "Pick-Up" option ?
• Yes ! For people living in Montreal, once we receive the games at our office, you be able to pass by and we will refund the shipping cost. Note that a 2 months delay may apply (boat shipping takes longer)

Is Kiwetin available in other languages ?
• Kiwetin will be delivered with two sets of cards and rules. French and English. German and Spanish rules will be available in PDF on our website soon.

How many miniatures in the box ?
• ​There is 6 highly detailed miniatures in the box. We only showcase the 3 spirits because there will be 2 of each. Allowing games up to 6 players.

Why no stretch goals ?
• ​We decided not to offer strectch goals because we believe Kiwetin is a game simple enough that already had every mandatory elements. We wanted to give the best. Right away!

 

Risks & Challenges

The quality of the game’s production is our main concern. We work with BangWee Productions, and quality control is paramount for them. We therefore do not foresee any problems at this level. We received prototypes from them and the quality was beyond expectations.

We are planning to deliver all copies of the game no more than 60 days after the end of the campaign. However, we are not shielded from being a little late beyond our control.

Be aware that some customs fees may apply.

We will keep you informed of the progress made concerning the production and delivery process.
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Your help is important to us, here is what you can do if you want to help:

  • Share this campaign page on your social networks.
  • Spread the word to all your friends who might like the game.
  • Drop us a little hello in our mail box.

 

Thanks !!

story:
Who We Are

My name is Rodney Smith and because of your support, my friends & family have been creating videos dedicated to teaching and playing board games for 7 years. This is something we'd like to continue!

Our goal is to:

  • Create enjoyable, high quality content.
  • Fully teach you the game, so you can skip the rule book.
  • Play the game, so you can see how it works and decide if it is a good fit for you.
  • Create a community where you know are a valued participant.
  • Make it easier for more people to discover and enjoy tabletop gaming.

What We Created Last Year

Donations to Watch It Played enable me to work on the series full time. Your support last year created 167 videos, where we:

  • Taught 44 Unique Games
  • Played 11 Unique Games
  • Conducted 9 Live Q&A Shows
  • Previewed 12 Games
  • Previewed 6 Products
  • Posted 19 Videos from the GTS Come & Play Event
  • Posted 4 Table Talk Segments
  • Created 17 News, Updates and Contest Videos

The Fundraiser Goals!

Below you'll find our key goals to success this year (and some fun stretch goals too!). Completed goals will gain this UNLOCKED title!

UNLOCKED! - GOAL: $60,000 - Tutorials & Rodney Funded! This goal gets things started by ensuring I'm personally funded and can continue creating tutorial and other related solo content all year long! You can track our progress towards this first goal below. Each $5,000 we raise covers another month that we'll mark on the calendar as FUNDED.

 

UNLOCKED! - GOAL: $70,000 - Gen Con Mountie Cosplay! You funded the show and you're well on the way to ensuring I have a co-host. Your support deserves a display of gratitude! At Gen Con 2018 I will wear a Mountie costume for a full day of cosplay, as requested by a viewer at Origins this past year! Pictures will be taken and shared.

 

UNLOCKED! - GOAL: $80,000 - Game Plays & Pep MacDonald Funded This is a very important goal for Season 7. Being able to record game play episodes requires a partner. It also allows us to cover more tutorials and bring you more fun. Pep MacDonald has been working on the show for the past year, but to support his ongoing contributions, I need to be able to compensate him for all he brings to the table. This stretch goal ensures I can do that.

 

GOAL: $90,000 - We Did It! You've ensured Watch It Played maintains its fundraising from the previous season and can continue to grow in new directions. As an extra thanks I will be letting the viewers vote on a game we feature during the 7th season. Note: Games that I would not find appropriate for the show, or fall outside the boundaries of my capabilities (or are the game featured in the next perk level), will not be included in this vote.

GOAL: $100,000 - The Force Is Strong! It has become an online source of jokes and prodding (spearheaded by a certain Marty Connell from Rolling Dice and Taking Names), but at this funding level, yes... for all of you going above and beyond... I will... finally... create a tutorial video for Star Wars Rebellion.

UPDATE - August 4, 2017
I don't even know where to begin. In response to this stretch goal, a video was secretly created and posted online by some of my most favorite people.  It's... well... just watch.

Season 7 Perks

Unique Promo Cards: The promos are meant to be a small token of appreciation - rather than the purpose of the donation, but I hope you'll enjoy these offerings from our publisher friends!

  • Delivery of these promos will be dependent on when I get copies from the publishers. I will keep you updated during the campaign and in regular fundraiser updates following it.
  • To ensure all backers have the best chance of getting each promo card they want, you may not request duplicate promos within the same donation.
  • Unless otherwise stated, each pictured promo is a single card. For example, if you want all of the Legacy promos, when making your selection, these will count as 3 separate promos.
  • If you're looking for a promo we offered during a previous season and don't see it listed, that is because we didn't have enough to offer at this time.
  • The Dead of Winter Promos are in limited supply. I may not be able to get them again, but I should have enough left over to cover anyone who donates at their perk levels. If I feel we may run out, I'll put an update on the fundraiser page well in advance to indicate it, and donations for them will be fulfilled in order of when the pledge was made.

$5 - The Backer: Every donation counts, and we thank you for yours - you help make the show possible!

$15 - The Reader: At this donation level you'll receive a Newsletter after the fundraiser closes, with important information about the next season of the show. Don't worry, only one or two newsletters will be sent a year - promise!

We have 4 new promos this year, and at the $20 donation level, you can choose one of them, or get all 4 at the $45 pledge level.

$20 - The Traveller: We hope you enjoyed joining us for our Near and Far play through, and now you can bring us along for your own! This single promo does include both a Rodney and Pep adventurer for your games of Near and Far. If you are curious about their special icons:
Rodney: If you complete a quest, you gain or lose 1 extra reputation (your choice).
Pep: If you complete a quest, you gain 1 extra coin.

$20 - The Raider: When we set sail in our play through of Raiders of The North Sea, we were competing raiders, but now we've united in a single Hero card that we're excited to share with you!

$20 - The Martian: You've been exploring the landscapes of Mars in First Martians: Adventures on the Red Planet, and now you'll have new objects to find in this 4 token set that counts as one promo.

$20 - The Noisemaker: This year we taught you the deck-building, dungeon delving game Clank, and we're getting a unique promo for that game to offer you. Artwork is pending, but we will update this space as soon as we have it.

$45 - The Gatherer: At this backer level you'll get all 4 new promos released this season.

$65 - The Survivor: At this backer level you'll get all 4 new promos released this season and the complete set of Dead of Winter promos we offered in the past. These are two Crossroad cards featuring Andrea and Luke, and a full character promo of Rodney with standee (but no stand). The Dead of Winter Promos are in limited supply. I may not be able to get them again, but I should have enough left over to cover anyone who donates at their perk levels. If I feel we may run out, I'll put an update on the fundraiser page well in advance to indicate it, and donations for them will be fulfilled in order of when the pledge was made.

$80 - The Producer: At this backer level in addition to all the individual promos listed previously you'll have your name added to the credits of every video we release this season (with some rare exceptions where the situation might require). You also gain early access to our game play videos to help check for errors, and begin planning your game play suggestion for when it goes live. Note: you can be removed from the mailing list for the early access any time you want with a quick email to me. This is one of my favorite perks, as it highlights many of the fellow gamers who make this show possible. See The Survivor level for information on the Dead of Winter Promo availability.

$100 - The Legacy: Thanks for your generous support to push our fundraiser to its goals. There truly isn't a perk offering I could offer to thank you properly for this donation, but at this perk level you'll receive everything from The Producer level as well our past promos for Imperial Settlers and Legacy: The Testament of Duke de Crecy. See The Survivor level for information on the Dead of Winter Promo availability.

 

Looking Back (and Ahead!)

In this video I discussed last year's season in more detail, and shared some of my personal thoughts about the year.

In this follow up video I shared some of your comments and feedback, as well are my responses to them.

 

Why I Need Your Support

I have had the privilege of working on Watch It Played full time because of the support of my family, sponsors and viewers like yourself. The money I make from the show is how I contribute financially to my family, which allows me to keep creating videos.

If you have enjoyed the videos we create, please consider making a donation!

story:
Our story

Hello! We're Evan and Josh, lifelong pun-lovers and general mischief makers. You might know us as the creators of Charty Party, a card game for making absurd charts that we crowdfunded last year.

For some of us, punning is a way of life. Far from the lowest form of humor, a well-crafted pun is a hilarious blend of wit and creativity. But, when put on the spot, even seasoned pun-lovers freeze up — coming up with a pun out of the blue is, like, super hard.

That's why we're hoping you'll help us bring Puns of Anarchy to life. It's a card game designed to make punning accessible to everyone, from dad-joke masters to your Aunt Belinda who's never made a pun in her life (yet).

We've played Puns of Anarchy with groups ranging from millennials to coworkers to relatives at Thanksgiving, and two things have always held true: the puns people create are endlessly unique, and we've never seen people laugh this hard. 

So, if you want to bring a dose of creativity and wordplay to your next game night, please help us make this game a reality. We can't wait to see what puns you come up with! Thanks so much,

-Evan and Josh

 

What's in the box?

Each copy of Puns of Anarchy includes:

  •  250 Punnable Dry Erase Cards with your favorite bands, movies, and more, all carefully pre-selected to be ideal for punning. Each card is printed on high quality stock and laminated with a special dry erase coating that won't smudge easily, erases super clean, and can withstand hours of intense punning.
     
  • 60 Category Cards to play your puns into, ranging from "Food" to "Loud Things" to "Title of My Sex Tape."
     
  • 6 Dry Erase Markers with Erasers. These bad boys are fine-tipped so you can write even the most elaborate puns clearly. Then, just use the built-in eraser to wipe a card clean!
     
  • Instructions. Duh.

 

 

Risks and Challenges

Since launching our last game, Charty Party, we've learned a ton about card game production and have a fantastic relationship with our game manufacturer. We've just placed our third order for Charty Party and have a great understanding of the timeline and logistics for getting games produced, shipped, warehoused, and sent to your door. But, the dry erase cards and markers in Puns of Anarchy are new territory for us. To make sure we get these right, we've done extensive prototyping and testing to ensure all game components are high quality and can withstand hours of vigorous punning.

It's also really important to us that everyone gets their games on time. We were able to stick to a quick delivery timeline with our last game, and we plan to do the same with this one. That's the reason we've decided not to include lots of gimmicks or custom reward elements, since they can really muck up timely production. We're keeping things simple (and making sure all of our backers get the best possible version of Puns of Anarchy) with one high-quality product that can get to your doorstep as soon as possible.
